author: {'steamid': '76561198120783261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1664569815}
review: It's a lot different than the other Civilization games in the sense that it's not as easy to quickly take over every other nation in a quick genocide run. In Civ 3, you need to actually build up before you can even be SOMEWHAT ready to go to war. There wasn't as much effort on the soundtrack as there was in Civ 2, so you kinda unconsciously get annoyed at the game. Other than that, it's absolutely wonderful and addictive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368099358', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1630382586}
review:
[h1] Sid Meier's Civilization III: Complete [/h1]

[b] A Mechanically Ancient Classic [/b]

[b] Sid Meier's Civilization III: Complete [/b] is not a welcoming addition to the Civilization franchise, certainly not with the way the franchise itself has evolved in more streamlined gameplay. All of the right pieces are there in order to make a compelling 4X strategy title, but the final product was too clunky, vague, and unintuitive for me to enjoy.

I normally do not knock older titles on presentation and visuals, but this title is a bit hard to look at. Not by any technical or graphical standard, but by a sheer lack of cohesion with the user interface. Menus feel bloated, clunky, and look drab. Character models and cities feel a bit washed out with the background environments, and the terrain itself has textures lower than you might expect. Granted this title came out twenty years ago, but it doesn't look very good nowadays.

However, my biggest issue with this game was its tutorial, or real lack of one. 4X strategy titles are generally complex in nature, and despite being an older title in the genre there are still loads of mechanics and details to become accustomed to. Yet [b] Civ III [/b] decides to essentially throw you into the world with a bloated rulebook to take alongside you. There is an unhealthy amount of trial and error in this title, and most actions have confusing and uneventful consequences (at least, visually). I found myself confused as to how to play a Civ game, and I've played [b] Civ IV [/b] and [b] Civ V [/b] before!

Music is decent and has a nice, bouncy beat to it, but the overall presentation and gameplay package was too much of a headache to process. I didn't spend much time with this one, and I do [b] Not Recommend [/b] you do either. This is a title that should be saved for older, more hardcore fans of the franchise that grew up with the game, but the newer titles do a much better job or translating Civ's classic gameplay loop to newer generations of gamers.

[h2] Final Verdict: 1/10 (Terrible) [/h2]

If you enjoyed this review, feel free to check out my curator page for my thoughts on a variety of other games!

https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37542043-ADHD-Reviews

author: {'steamid': '76561198304452465', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1748, 'last_played': 1658660057}
review:
[h1]前言[/h1]
我是第一次接触文明系列，以下萌新可以看一看，也许对你有帮助。
游戏汉化某贴吧有或者评论区，游戏没有新手教程关卡，只有在设置里的新手提醒。
文明有点耗时间，但是挺有意思的，没准下一个回合就天亮了。
B站和贴吧都没有教学视频，当时愁死我了，我把我游戏心得写在下面了。
[h1]帮助新手更快了解游戏怎么玩[spoiler] 我也是半萌新[/spoiler][/h1]
这个不像红警和敌人一起行动，这个是回合制，所以一般直接定居原地（感觉位置不好可以重开）。

[b]先修路[/b]（先人总说修通了路才能走出去，这里也是一样的），修路可以让移动目标节省回合（跨国家移动则是每回合只能走一步）。

[b]双击城市创建建筑和造人[/b]，每个刚开始城市都以工人+工人+移民造人（如果刚开始造移民则会人口不够造不出来），之后可以造武士。

[b]武士去探路[/b]，一般开局不会被打仗，地图会有蘑菇（类似红警的奖励箱子），武士不能造太多，要适当的造移民工人，抢地盘！

[b]科技升级有个可以钻的空子[/b]，你可以看右下角每次回合结束，科技回合就会减少，当还剩2回合，这时你去点左上角像对话的按钮，把科技条拉成一回合，这样可以省国库资金，记得还拉回来不然科技发展慢。

至于体制这个东西我也没懂，好像是在变革之前要把之前学到的东西建造完，不然变革完就没了。

屏幕中间的人和上方的横条我也不是很懂，反正一般不要乱点，除非发生暴乱，城市不能运作的时候，把他们变成演员，然后工业值就会恢复。

打仗的话，要看清路，有的路可以直接跨过你到后面，占领要道，步步为营，不然会守不住，占领城市后，要派兵镇守，不然会被敌人人民重新夺取。铁路是个好东西（小兵在铁路移动不费回合数），可以绕城建造一圈，这样就不怕他们偷袭。

[h1] 如果我说的不对的，希望大佬在留言区指出[/h1]
萌新记得留言哈，可以把心得写出来。
[spoiler]我就打了一局简单，打了快30小时，这个游戏太耗时间了，萌新装大佬，嘻嘻嘻[/spoiler]

review:
Game fails to run.

It fails to run SO spectacularly, in fact, that Steam can't even force it to end process. Nor can Steam tell when the process has been forcibly ended through Task Manager. In fact, Steam continues to think that the game is running after being closed and restarted, forcing the entire computer to be reset just to be able to uninstall this garbage.

Literally malware.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276592266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 41707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 38, 'playtime_at_review': 20031, 'last_played': 1710702835}
review:
I love playing civ type of games - specially with the OG Sid Meyer's Civ games.

For me the upgrade "Test of Time" was at the time a real thrill - it really leveled up the gameplay. Earlier on I even had put up a local network for to computers to play the Civ II Net with my spous.

Nowadays I play the game "Sid Meyer's Civilization III : Complete" at least once a week. In a word it's just a lot of fun - compared to other civ type of games.

Growing on, both my sons were impressed and intrigued seeing me play Civ games. 

Today we play co-op games online, thanks to Steam.

review: I love this game. I have played this since i was 5. I had the original CD but had lost the CD key so i could only play it on my old laptop. Then when i saw it on steam i bought it without thinking twice. I love the CIV series but this still remains to be my favorite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130624838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 26629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12565, 'last_played': 1708327094}
review:
A fantastic gem of 4x strategy gaming! An underrated title that's more simple than the later iterations, yet still has that addicting "one-more-turn" aspect to it. I'm a little biased because I grew up with this one, I'll admit, but it's still my favorite to this day. Great selection of Civs for an older game, and there's a decent amount of ways to customize the map and settings to fine tune everything the way you want it, without being overwhelming to new players. If you get bored of the regular game, there's a variety of scenarios to play, all of them unique and interesting. There's also special maps and scenarios that were submitted by fans and included in the game, definitely worth a try. 

The biggest issue I have with this game is the AI. It's not very smart when it comes to trading, and it often blatantly tries to rip you off with one-sided deals, but it's quick to get upset if it thinks you're doing the same, not to mention the fact that it heavily favors trading with other AI players over the human. It also likes to move units through the human player's territory without permission, and on higher difficulty levels will not hesitate to declare war on you for simply asking them to move their troops out. Another thing that bothers me is that the AI does not get smarter on higher difficulties, they only start out with more settlers/workers/warriors etc., which forces the human player to pick Civs with very specific traits as they reach the hardest difficulties if they want a real chance at winning. 

Overall, I'd still highly recommend this game, despite the outdated AI. It's a great buy at such a low price, especially if you like the other Civs, or if you're a history buff (and if you're both, like I am, what are you waiting for?).

review:
Никогда раньше не играл в Цивилизацию, и вот решил попробовать. И почему-то решил запустить не 6 или хотя бы 5 часть, а вот эту, тройку. И не пожалел! Несмотря на то, что игре почти 20 лет, она всё равно увлекает и в нее можно играть запоем. Да, порог вхождения не очень низкий, но большого труда разобраться нет, достаточно пару гайдов прочитать. 

Больше всего впечатлило, насколько же много в игре возможностей. Жаль, что не добрался до нее в детстве, провел бы в ней сотни часов, делая "самый последний ход".

author: {'steamid': '76561198328515568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5972, 'last_played': 1708959372}
review: This game has saved me 15/25/55 dollars, as I have no desire to purchase a newer civ game since playing this. I played for years as a kid on CD, so the 100 hours I have is more like 1000. The one knock on this game is that its very easy to snowball and very hard to come back from losing a war, even if you get out of it quickly, so unless you have the patience to build the units and take all the cities required for domination, the game sort of loses its fun at about 1700AD give or take. This game has provided me with hours upon hours of boredom prevention and excitement since I was about 7 years old and my uncle gave me and my brother this game on CD. Definitely recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198428468622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1592800855}
review: 情怀，小时候看着爸爸玩通宵一直不理解，知道6岁那年爸妈出门买菜自己在家无聊打开了这个游戏。。

author: {'steamid': '76561197982225800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 318, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1708884075}
review:
Like the other Civ games I've played, Civ III's mechanics are unique enough to differentiate it from the other games in the franchise, which makes it by no means "obsoleted" by its sequels. The interface and mechanics are also somewhat cryptic at first, but with a bit of time, it reveals itself to actually be rather simple. For the most part.

So on one hand, I think it's worth playing for its mechanical differences from other Civ games, but on the other hand, games like Civ IV, and especially Civ V, have made absolutely [i]huge[/i] interface and quality-of-life improvements (tooltips!) that just make them so much smoother to play and to discover their mechanics and learn how they work.

Since I've never played the Civ games growing up, my first experience with the franchise only started with Civ V a few years ago. So, no rose-tinted glasses here for me when I say that I think Civ III is still a good, rather addicting game, but the sequels just do so many things better and more intuitively.

Stick with Civ IV, V, or (gasp) even VI.

author: {'steamid': '76561198963574702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1571153349}

author: {'steamid': '76561198431926174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1603989294}
review:
I used to own this game years ago, and the disc ended up scratched beyond repair from so many years of use, so I grabbed this title. Still the same game I remember, but with three changes:

1) The game locks up and crashes, likely due to it not being properly patched for Windows systems after XP.
2) There is no access to a level editor that I can find.
3) Cannot change anything about video.

I'd say get this game on Humble Bundle for cheaper, and enjoy it for what it's meant to be; a simpler game from a previous decade.

EDIT:
After repeatedly trying to finish a game, and failing every time, I've come to the conclusion this game simply cannot be played on Windows 10, as it stands. Maybe an emulator will allow other people to play the game without it breaking as soon as you threaten to get a science win, but nothing has worked for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067009811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 17890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 793, 'last_played': 1693005092}

author: {'steamid': '76561198079472221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 58550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15473, 'last_played': 1705012952}
review: The AI has ridiculous advantages past Regent difficulty, and the natural hostility to the player gets old faster than in Civ II MGE. All of this would be tolerable IFF the combat system weren't so poorly designed. The terrain modifiers are a bit imbalanced, and maybe half of the world Wonders are worth building. After playing through twice on Monarch difficulty, I will never play this game again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199661719', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1687117943}
review:
Envejecio mas o menos.

Sigue siendo disfrutable, pero la IA simplemente chitea fabricando más rápido que vos cualquier unidad a pesar que nisiquiera tiene el recurso adecuado (ej; hierro para los swordman) en su territorio.

Si estas buscando la verdadera experiencia del CiV clásico te recomiendo mejor el Civilization 5, y sino, directamente pasa al 6 que es más "casual" pero igualmente divertido que su predecesor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015833539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 11686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4576, 'last_played': 1706472262}
review:
il gioco è il classico CIV III
Se lo state cercando perché ci avete giocato in passato e volete rispolverare una vecchia perla è ampiamente soddisfacente.
Presenta però alcune pecche fastidiose a mio avviso, il gioco essendo in 32 bit (si c'è la compatibilità ma non permette di utilizzarla) tende a crashare se tentate di fare più azioni contemporaneamente (esempio cliccare sui consiglieri mentre si svolgono le azioni automatiche dei  lavori e/o truppe).
A completamento partita anche li c'è il rischio di crash del gioco per motivi apparentemente ignoti.
Non è chiaro il perché quando ho acquistato questa versione dava la possibilità di più lingue ( come nel cd all'epoca) invece evita nell'installazione la parte della scelta della lingua e di default si installa in inglese. 
A parte queste pecche il gioco funziona perfettamente ed è divertente da giocare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198374283720', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3913, 'last_played': 1679964884}
review:
Civilization es una de las sagas de estrategia que más tiempo he jugado, junto a Age of Empires. 

Ya modifiqué el archivo conquests.ini y las propiedades de Civ3Conquests.exe para que funcione a pantalla completa en Windows 10/11 y desactiva la intro. El problema es al ganar una partida, se traba y hay que forzar el cierre.

La mejor forma de jugarlo sin problemas es usar una PC/laptop viejita o una máquina virtual con Windows XP.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073729843', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1097, 'last_played': 1708459407}
review:
"Mummy, please, just one more turn..."

STRICT ALERT!!! The game is going to cause dependency/addiction to it.

Only play if you have many hours to spend on it - don't even start if you have less than two hours of free time!

Shame it still lacks HD resolution support, just like it doesn't have actually ANY graphics settings - although when it got released in 2001 it didn't look bad compared to its age being an isometric 2D-game. Still, some lags/AI thinking times might occur, which I cannot say agreeable looking at its graphics level...

I think this entire game should get an HD remaster - newer than Windows XP operating systems can have serious compatibility support issues with the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036536255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1214, 'last_played': 1528382694}
review:
This is still my favorite Civ game because of its simple, to-the-point, yet quite appealing art design.

You don't get any flashy animations or stylish ui choices that ultimately just hinder you from enjoying it to its fullest.

It is the perfect game for an after-work cooldown session and remains as addicting as ever.

Oh and it scales to modern resolutions quite well too.

review:
Don't get if you hate strategy.  How you got here if you have to listen that advise I have no idea.

So much time wasted on this game in my youth.  But this is the accumulation of civ games from the first generation, and I have heard they had to reset the franchise cause of this game.  But it is a classic 4X, if you don't have it get it.  It is 5 bucks for the base game and all the expansions, yes I said expansions, not that dlc crap that replaced expansions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032914146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2963, 'last_played': 1663942857}
review: One of my favorite games of all time. I spent countless hours playing Civ3 back in the day (and have a few in the Steam version). I highly recommend it to anyone who likes strategy games and hasn't played it yet. Also, the game originally came out in 2001, so by today's standards, even an old PC should be able to easily handle it (unless you're somehow still running with a PC that predates Windows 2000/XP, I guess).

author: {'steamid': '76561198369929807', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 24819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14145, 'last_played': 1703944656}
review: Sem dúvida um jogo divertido pra quem gosta do gênero. Ele é leve, então deve rodar na grande maioria dos computadores. A trilha sonora é muito agradável e combina perfeitamente com o ele. Os gráficos são simples, mas tem uma arte bacaninha. O jogo tem conteúdo considerável pro seu tempo, podendo garantir boas horas de diversão. A dificuldade é até bem alta e pode ser desafiante. Só não recomendo em 2 casos: se você não gosta do gênero do jogo ou se pode comprar um game mais avançado da franquia.

review:
Não recomendo nem para brasileiros e nem pra quem entende de inglês, Até por que o jogo não há uma tradução para outras linguagens.
A dificuldade do jogo é extremamente alta, mas não por ter um ''Game Over'' tão rápido ou algo assim. No início você até se sai bem, mas não entende nada pois o Tutorial do Jogo não existe! Apenas vai indicando coisas que tem que fazer (pelo que eu me lembre, é possível de nem isso ter.) sem explicar nada!

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198017420220', 'num_games_owned': 480, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3814, 'last_played': 1639585277}
review:
Don't be fooled by the number above, I have more than 3k hours played at least. On the the review now:

I've been playing on and off since it's release. I've learned a lot of history and English terminology through playing this game as a kid. The game play is not the best: the next games are superior game play wise. However they eliminated the endless combat that reigns over Civ 3. It is one of these games, uniquely so, that you can hoard military units, stack them up near the enemy's borders, declare war and take 5 cities, big or small, before the enemy gets his turn. Although a lot, A LOT, of micromanagement is required to pull off this kind of tactic, it is really rewarding if somewhat tedious. The technology system is fine, it's slower than later games, but you have more time to play between eras. Most unique units are well-designed. A lot of Wonders are broken (Statue of Zeus, cough cough) and can allow you to cut through early eras like a knife through butter. Early eliminations are common and wonder fights are exciting. 

The OST is BONKERS. I still listen to it, so many years later, even without playing. Jungle sounds, mesoamerican music etc. Really well orchestrated.

Overall, I've been enjoying this game for so many years. It's my childhood darling so I may be a bit far from objectively measuring its pros and cons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198798190209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1666122150}
review:
Sid Meier's Civilization III is all about land grabbing, scientific and military expansion, and patience. You start with a single settler and are expected to carve out a civilization that is capable of withstanding the trials of time while competing with domineering neighbors for the possession of Wonders and military might. 

I am enjoying Sid Meier's Civilization III very much. I recommend it to all strategy game lovers due to the depth of the world and the complexity of game itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030753508', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 29432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2122, 'playtime_at_review': 20469, 'last_played': 1710440720}
review: Can't get enough of this game since 2001. It was so huge with long global scale maps that were played for days. It has some concepts implemented (like corruption) that were since lost in subsequent installments of Civ series. It supports resolutions up to 2560x1440 and works perfectly fine on modern machines. If you want some thoughtfull, meditative, old school strategy experience go grab it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198807476565', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1570892929}
review: Решил с другом против ботов поиграть (2 на 2). Команд в игре нету поэтому понадеялись что боты не перебьются до нашего прихода. Сначала оказалось что мы на одном острове. Ну не велика беда, боты активно разжирались и давно нас перегнали по очкам. Спустя несколько тысяч лет я наконец изучил кораблики, которые могут плавать по океану и пошел в разведку. Нашел второй остров, где как раз были два бота. Как выяснилось (после покупки карты у одного из ботов), что там Америка пресует Хинди. Ну подумали окей, вдвоем на одну сверхдержаву будет интересно. Начал активно торговать с Америкой, товарищ же сидел и разжирался на базе. В итоге приспичило мне украсть у Америки технологию, больно уж у меня страсть была к передовым технологиям. Разобрался как это сделать (это не так просто понять), отправил шпиона. Моего недошпиона сразу же словили и Америка объявила мне войну. Друг ржет, я в легком а**е. Потом увидел корабли противника около моих границ и понял что надо что то делать. Начал переговоры, в итоге согласились на мир за огромную сумму. Я все таки, как никак обрадовался. Корабли он отвел, но один остался. Я подумал для разведки, все таки он же не знал полностью нашего острова. Тут с корабля вылазит коник на мои берега. Я что бы снизить цену за мир подписал договор об открытых границах, поэтому запретить ему ходить я не мог. Ну бегает себе, я и забыл уже. Как вдруг мне послание "Америка объявляет вам войну". "Да б****" - подумал я. И тут сыграл роль коник. Он стоял возле Сан-Петербурга (играл за Россию). Армия была маленькая, так как не воевал. И та что была была рассыпана по всему острову. И вот конник вторгается в город (заметьте не столицу) и мне высвечивает сообщение, что я проиграл. Я в а**е, друг ржет, игра проиграна. Причины поражению мы до сих пор и не поняли. Игру рекомендую 10 Вашего рабочего заватили варвары из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979881961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 46656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 71, 'playtime_at_review': 20842, 'last_played': 1710666756}
review:
First of all i play this game since it came to market. It's a great game and makes still fun to play. I prefer it to the newer versions of civilization. 

The graphics are still good even after so many years and it is very balanced. It has no 3d graphics and that's what i like about the game. It gives me a better overview and in my opion 3d is not needed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057618638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1559486907}
review:
Боже, иногда я до сих пор слышу звуки из этой игры в своей голове!!
Познакомился я с ней в далеком 2006 году, когда взял у друга во дворе диск с этой игрой, как же меня, 9-летнего пиздюка она впечатлила, именно с этого момента началась моя любовь к серии игр CIVILIZATION, которая длиться уже более 13 лет.    
Сколько было сыграно партий, уже наверное и не вспомнить, сколько было потрачено нервов, когда не совсем окрепший детский мозг вступал борьбу со сложными ботами. III часть я всегда вспоминаю с теплотой, конечно на данный момент играть в неё в Стиме невозможно, всё таки столько лет прошло, но для своего времени, это был шедевр, с кучей прикольных механик и фич, которые к сожалению в следующих частях убрали. Например постройка дворца, когда ты мог из обоссаной пещеры с троном сделать огромный дворец, выбирая при этом архитектурный стиль, и намешать всё, и создать этакого Франкенштейна от мира дворцов. Или экран обзора города, на котором ты видел как растёт город, и все постройки в городе. 
В стиме же я купил эту игру, как дань уважения к ней, и к своему детству, которое в ней провёл. Вкупе со всеми воспоминаниями и эмоциями, эта игра стоит намного дороже 450 рублей. Для меня, CIVILIZATION III навсегда останется лучшей пошаговой стратегией. Сколько бы не прошло времени, как бы не были хороши 5 и 6 части, а желание вернуться в 3 часть всё равно не пропадает...

author: {'steamid': '76561198212574036', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1559201412}
review: херня, не смог запустить на десятке в полном экране

author: {'steamid': '76561198027973295', 'num_games_owned': 1820, 'num_reviews': 1844, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1559172514}
review:
Третья Цивилизация занимает в моем сердце место где-то по соседству с третьими Героями, это две очень важные стратегии. Я видел реально много в этих пикселях.

Игру совсем не адаптировали под современные компьютеры, нет даже разрешения 1920x1080p. Если в 2011, когда я ее брал, такая ситуация, возможно, была ОК, то спустя восемь лет такое положение дел никуда не годится. 

Скорее не рекомендую брать Циву 3 в Стиме.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990562257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1558895179}
review: Each time I started the game to check on some detail, six hours mysteriously vanished. Perfectly captures the epic sweep of the previous games but adds a bunch of new features that improve upon an already brilliant concept. It's superior in every way to "Civilization II". The interface is much better implemented this time around...To make a long story short, Civ. III is a worthy heir for the franchise and a definite must have for any strategy gamer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044472061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 21377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15734, 'last_played': 1679483186}
review: Incredibly biased opinion since this is based on nostalgia (still have played a lot even now) but I love this game to death. Later civs really try hard to develop things like diplomacy, religion, social policies etc. but I'm out for global domination which is very possible in this game unlike later ones where they make it much more difficult and I'd say they actively discourage it. The later ones feel almost like accounting games with all the things you have to consider but this one is simple enough and straightforward. Old game but always a blast to make stacks of death and mow down every civilization you find. When on sale you can get it for about a dollar. I'll take being able to play this over a mcchicken any day.

review: I cannot understand how to play, spent 1 hour trying to play without a tutorial then 2.5 hours playing after a crash still haven't found tutorial things kept happening to my towns so i clicked random s**t till it worked. another downside of this game is that it runs in 640 x 400 and I haven't found a damn clue on how to increase resolution, the options menu is s**t, somewhat was a little fun even though I did not know what I was doing. I heard good things about this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100642009', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 2278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1704055989}
review:
SI bien conserva características de los juegos anteriores como modificar el palacio y ver la ciudad, además de ser la versión completa y existir un parche en español, la verdad No lo recomiendo a gente nueva a esta saga, comparado incluso a Civ 1 el juego se me hace lento, la mecánica de corrupción está desbalanceada, la información del manual no está actualizada a la de la civilopedia y ésta última está muy mal organizada, además tiene esa odiosa notificación que te aparece cada vez que tus unidades entran en territorio de otra civilización.

Personalmente recomiendo Civ 4 a cualquiera que no haya jugado esta saga, sigue la misma fórmula que el 3 pero las mecánicas se sienten más pulidas

A pesar de lo que comenté no me parece mal juego, pero si uno algo tedioso, si ya haz  jugado cualquier Civilization dale una oportunidad al 3, pues es un gran reto con su curvas de dificultad elevada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098085700', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1559, 'last_played': 1695742292}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012380713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 6195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6175, 'last_played': 1680082373}
review:
Ένα από τα καλύτερα turn base παιχνίδια στρατηγικής. Κρατάει το ενδιαφέρον στον παίχτη και μετά από ώρες σε κάθε παρτίδα του. Παίζει πολύ καλά σε αργά PC's λόγο των 2D γραφικών του. Τα νεώτερα παιχνίδια της σειράς βάλανε αρκετούς νέους κανόνες για να διαφοροποιηθούν αλλά το 3 έχει την καλύτερη ισορροπία μεταξύ βάθους και πολυπλοκότητας.

10/10

review: У меня были версии SID MEIER'S CIVILIZATION 1, 2, 3 и 5. Самой интересной по набору возможностей была версия 3. К сожалению на текущий момент нет этой версии, адаптированной к новым системам Windows и размерам экранов. Как обратиться к разработчикам (Firaxis Games - ?) с просьбой о такой адаптации? Мне кажется, что такая адаптированная версия имела бы спрос.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033180312', 'num_games_owned': 1704, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1556662883}
review:
[table]
[tr]
[th]평가요소[/th]
[th]평가(5점 만점)[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]

[/tr]
[tr]

[th]★★★★[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]

[th]★★[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[th]난이도/성취감/컨텐츠량 적정도[/th]
[th]★★★[/th]
[/tr]
[/table]
===============총평===============
[h1]CIV 5, 6에 큰 절 올리게 하는 게임. [/h1]

저는 CIV 5, 6만 합쳐서 몇백시간은 한 것 같습니다. CIV3과 CIV4의 경우에는 문명 시리즈 살 때 같이 들어가 있었을 뿐, 사실 한 번도 실행해보지 않다가 이번 기회에 한 번 실행해봤습니다.

이걸 제가 15년 전 플레이 해봤다면, '오 혁신이다.' 라고 할 수 있을 수 있겠지만,

현재의 제가 플레이하기에는 큰 단점이 몇 가지 있습니다.

1. 한글패치 x

2. UI가 굉장히 직관적이지 않음.
  (차라리 CIV5, 6을 안하고 왔으면 덜 느꼇을 수 있지만, 이미 적응할 대로 적응했으니..)

3. Age of Empire의 턴제게임 느낌 (그래픽적인 요소만 봤을 때)인데, 각 버튼에 대한 직관성이 너무 부족

결론은 CIV 5,6이 나오게 해 준 참 감사한 게임이지만, 현재 플레이하기에는 참 어렵네요^^;

author: {'steamid': '76561198063279260', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1608052952}
review:
J'ai joué à tout les Civs., certes très peu mais j'y ai pas mal joué.. Je dois dire que cet opus est complexe vu qu'il n'est qu'en anglais en tout cas sur steam et qu'il y a énormément de choses à gérer donc si on manque légèrement de vocabulaire en anglais on peu se retrouver à feuilleter pas mal son dictionnaire anglais/français. 

En ce qui concerne le jeu si comme moi vous êtes rétro-gamer de temps en temps ce jeu fera parfaitement l'affaire et en 2019 il reste encore bien potable. Franchement si vous êtes amateur de jeu de stratégie et principalement stratégie tour par tour ce petit jeu rétro est vivement conseillé.

A savoir que je recommande plus que vivement toute la série Civilization et non-seulement celui-ci.

J'ajouterai également que je n'ai aucun soucis avec Windows 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112173506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1556134727}
review:
I played this for untold hours off my CD, likely from the base, or close to the base version (note, 
 I bought this as a backup copy, what does that tell you?).  I couldn't recommend it enough back in the day, but it's a bit older, and thus the graphics aren't as high.  The later editions added things like vassal states, which you can turn off, but I never liked, and I like to play with all rules on.  This older version has all the main features, and later editions try more and more to make complete conquest of the map harder and harder so players don't get frustrated by being knocked out in multiplayer, but it takes away from the global domination that most old players aim for.  So, in that case, older is better!

****NOTE:on Windows 10, always hit space bar when it starts up to skip the login screen, or an error will make it crash when the "2K" animation ends.  This is a super old game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198439150692', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 12147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5175, 'last_played': 1702300923}
review:
我是新玩家！！！评论字字血泪！！！！
因为有个朋友几乎每次上steam都在玩文明，我很好奇，就顺手买了3和6。依照我喜欢从前作开始玩的习惯我打开了3。
并且花了很长时间来捉摸如何开游戏，如何用补丁，结果我没有研究出教程在哪里。然后被各种耻辱性失败嘲讽了。其中有一局，国家随机到有日本，然后我兴冲冲的在海岸线登录，打下了横滨，然后把飞机战斗机全部飞过来准备轰炸，不知道从什么地方冲出几个日本武士把我的重重包围给冲破了...？我眼睁睁的看着几十架飞机在我眼前折成两段。
我当时，真实的，感受到了，美国，被偷袭，珍珠港，时候的，愤怒。
一瞬间对日本的好感下降到了我有生以来的最低点。
后来我潜心钻研去b站还有贴吧，又打开了文明6，然后被6代大富翁一般的人设逼回了3代，不过还好6代有教程。后来我花了几十个小时，真·几天几夜，细致入微的布局（强迫症），最后成功在每一块土地上设置了那个类似塔防还是什么的鬼东西，结果进入新时代，图标变成了一个个青绿色的方块，映入我眼帘的地图就像一块块巨大的菠萝皮（真的，要是评论能放图我很想和大家分享一下那个画面），这时候已经是200回合了（至于为什么还没赢，除了我是废物大概是因为我的开局设定出现了致命性失误），我还在磨磨蹭蹭的，一回合要布局接近20分钟，后来又玩了两天，实在忍不住，差点吐了，就关了游戏，再也没开过5555...
游戏很好玩，但是我一想起我的菠萝皮我就不想玩了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198052468639', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1553284165}
review:
Ich habe Sid Meiers Civilization III damals in einer schicken Kisten verpackung mit CD zum Geburtstag von meinen Eltern bekommen.
Daher hatte ich aus Nostalgischen gründen sofort zugeschlagen als ich gesehen hatte das es sogar eine Expansion dafür gab.

Leider ist das ganze Game auf English, was dem Nostalgie Faktor etwas hemmt. 
Außerdem ist mir aufgefallen das man keine Felder um die Nahrung aufzubauen bauen kann, in der deutschen Version auf CD die ich hatte konnte man dies schon recht früh machen.
Nur ich hänge da spiele Rom und kann das nicht? 

Ich kann nur Straßen und Mienen bauen, ist das vlt. ein Bug?
Zumindest ein Bug der weitreichende Konsequenzen mit sich bringt und daher dieses Spiel leicht zerstört.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077337487', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 9923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4235, 'last_played': 1604389887}
review:
Провёл много времени в этой игре в своём 2007 и ранее, играя в неё одинаково много, как и в какие-нибудь GTA VC, NFS MW и AoE II (минутка ностальгии, да), и не смотря на всю свою сразу появившуюся нелюбовь к пошaговым стратегиями (rts – one love) – эта игра мне весьма и весьма зашла
К приобретению сейчас – разумеется не советую. Ибо устарела в плане геймплея (дизайн в таких играх не бывает "серьёзным", поэтому думаю даже сейчас она смотрится сносно для своего жанра в силу своей простоты), из-за некоторого гемороя с запуском на совр. системах (там будет не сильно сложно сделать её работоспособной, но повозиться придётся, тем не менее) и, пожалуй главное для меня – несбалансированности. Приведу в сравнение игру весьма другого жанра (ибо это первое, что приходит в голову на вскидку): в каком-нибудь LoL'e (да и во второй Дотке думаю есть подобные механики) урон ульты какого-нибудь Гарена рассчитать абсолютно точно не возможно: 350 фиксированного урона, плюс урон от максимального запаса здоровья (или недостающего, но не суть) – то есть абсолютное умение этого чемпиона используется приблизительно; чтобы наверняка ты доводишь уровень здоровья оппонента-танка, скажем, до пятисот хп и ультуешь, но на фоне общей простоты механики чемпиона это – ерунда. В остальных же случаях ты наверняка знаешь, сколько урона ты нанесёшь и сможешь ли ты доиграть, лишь в пяти случаях из 95% идя на неоправданный риск по принципу "пан или пропал"
В большинстве стратегий (отходя от концепции моба-игр) – разумеется аналогичный принцип, ибо это мать её стратегия, просчитывание на перёд и расчётливость должны вознагражаться! Здесь же.. Понимаю, что в игр свои механики и некоторые принципы реальной жизни/опыта реальных боевых действий могут быть не применимы, однако: 
@ твой юнит стоит в городе (вроде бы, как раз это из тех факторов, что в игре не имеют значения, но всё же)
@ в городе уже построены стены!
@ город был построен на холме или в лесу, в то время как нападающий персонаж - стоит в степи
@ твой воин – ранга элита, скажем, с пятью блоками хп из шести
@ оппонент – ветеринар (ветеран, да), а порой это может быть и просто солдат регулярной армии (три блока хп у стандартных персонажей)
@ твой персонаж - пикейщик (щит, копьё, все дела) против вражеского.. Ну, например, лучник или пусть даже всадника (тоже логика и здравый смысл того, что копьеносец законтрит прущегося на него кавалериста, сколько бы у него урона не было; с лучником - тоже самое: у него есть урон, а у тебя защита, ты обороняешься, дамаг тебе и не нужен)
всё, казалось бы - ты выиграл осаду!.. Но нет. :) Ты оставляешь ему один блок хп, а потом он сносит тебе всё твоё хп и плевать на все невероятные пункты преимущества, описанные выше. :)))
Аналогичную ситуацию имеют моменты, когда ты находишься в хороших отношениях со своим территориальным соседом, а тут он просто берёт и заключает против тебя военный союз, хотя никаких предпосылок не было; можно было бы понять парочку других оппонентов, с которыми у тебя "раздражённые" отношения, но это-то – каг, зачем, почимууу???77777 Понимаю, когда такой гемплей есть в каком-нибудь Hots'e (не понимаю вообще, как в такие игры можно играть, ыы), но когда такое добавляют в стратегию.. В общем такие процессы горения, что просто..
Вряд ли когда-нибудь потрачусь на последующие части игры, ибо предпочту скорее упомянутую выше, пусть и устаревшую вторую Эпоху Империй или Империю Земли, тем не менее с этой игрой связаны теплые воспоминания, так что отзыв положительный.~

author: {'steamid': '76561198009250344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 908, 'last_played': 1551119372}
review: Coming from Civ V as my first Civ game - well, technically it was Civ Revolution but let's pretend that didn't happen -, I found this game enjoyable. In my limited experience so far though, there seems to be less things to do, however the present mechanics are on a larger scale. For example, there are no social policies but a few government types, religion only in the form of a few religious buildings I guess but nothing customizable and so on. Though on the other hand, you build far more cities and mass produce units, often the same things over and over. It's the same things with workers, for the most part you build roads and either irrigation or mines on the tiles. Overall, the core experience looks like it's the enjoyable same, but a simpler zen-like experience. I could also run the game on both Windows 7 and Windows 10 both x64 just fine, resolution is also ok.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116137351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1047, 'last_played': 1556896204}
review:
I'll keep this short and simple - you shouldn't get this game for really really playing it. A nostalgic kick, sure, but as a Civ-series game, nah.

This game is pretty much a downgraded version from Civ V, which is in my opinion the best game of the series. Worse graphics, worse AI, worse everything really. Which is to be expected, of course, since this is the 3rd installment, V logically being the fifth. 

All in all, looking to play Civ? Get the fifth one. This game's a 3/10, Civ V is a 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156193725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2408, 'last_played': 1701014774}
review:
My first and favourite of all CIV games, CIV 3 is a lovely experience. It has some fairly annoying combat mechanics (tanks sometimes losing to barbarians, etc) but its simple and effective interface is a stark contrast to the later installments of the CIV series.

Despite its occasional flaws, Civilization 3 remains my favourite product of the entire series. I fully recommend it to anyone who might be interested!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013759011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 4582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3489, 'last_played': 1694440677}
review:
This review is in English and Slovak language:
Táto recenzia je v Anglickom a Slovenskom jazyku:

I have been playing the mother of all strategies continuously since 1993 and gradually I went through all her titles and subtitles to V. part. Civilization III. became my longest playing heart affair and I was very reluctant to say goodbye to it as I slowly moved on to the V. part. Personally, I think that III. the part is far better than IV., V. and probably VI., but it is a bit outdated and does not offer such a range of gameplay options. What makes it unique, however, is that this is the last Cvilization where you have the opportunity to create truly gigantic empires with countless armies on large maps.

Matku všetkých stratégií hrám nepretržite už od roku 1993 a postupne som si prešiel všetkými jej titulmi aj podtitulmi až po V. diel. Civilizácia III. sa stala mojou najdlhšie hranou srdcovou záležitosťou a len veľmi nerád som sa s ňou lúčil, keď som pomaly prešiel na V. diel. Osobne si myslím, že III. diel je ďaleko lepší ako IV., V. a asi aj VI., ale je už trocha zastaralý a neponúka takú škálu možností v rámci hrateľnosti. Unikátnym ho však robí to, že je to posledný diel, kde máte možnosť vytvoriť naozaj gigantické impéria s nespočetným množstvom armády na veľkých mapách.

review:
Tips:
Add the following lines to the ini file in the Conquests folder to play in your native monitor resolution and to skip the intro on startup:
KeepRes=1
PlayIntro=0

With KeepRes=1 the menu will appear small with black borders but once you start a game the map will use all available screen space.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076378579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 293, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1545877625}
review: I have played every Civ from the first. They all progress in many ways, while regressing in others. I have to say after replaying Civ III after having played CIV V, this confirms it. Terrain looks so bland, there is no popup that estimates the percent of success in a battle, the UI is clunkier, etc. But for the price of a good cup of coffee, I will not complain. I love all the CIV games (so far 1 to 5). I would hate to know how many thousands of hours I spent on them, certainly enough to be fluent in Russian or some other difficult foreign language. 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034132607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1545862761}
review:
你11岁，拿着字典翻找Masonry是什么意思，每个回合都在犹豫自己要干什么，拿着弓箭撞上邻国的坦克，你用了2个月的时间赢下了第一局，专门给同学打电话分享自己的战略；
你15岁，兴高采烈地打开新文明的光盘盒，虽然知道游戏说明书甚至不能让你赢下settler难度的一局，但是新印的油墨味道依然令你着迷；
你19岁，跟自己刚认识的大学同学高谈阔论着新一代的文明，顺便还在推荐这个叫做steam的正版游戏平台，也许还会跟他们聊下cs也是这个steam母公司的早期作品；
你25岁，走出校园，在论坛和群里跟大家一起期待和吐槽新系列，新机制，新玩法，顺便再diss一遍跑偏的未编号上一作；
你29岁，游戏对你来说意味着时间成本，开一局文明对你来说已经是奢望，今天是圣诞节，队列推荐给你的文明3把你带回了翻着字典，11岁的你……

—————————————————————————————————————————
回到文明3，我只想说：九鼎国马兵！理想主义赛高！天国的橡胶你在哪里……

author: {'steamid': '76561198005282571', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 4578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2836, 'last_played': 1554380053}
review:
civ3 creates an impression that is it much more designed for robots than humans

it seems as well AI acts with perfect knowledge of map (which is nearly the only strong way to heavily cheat on this without some quadruple bonuses to everything, however all those are a thing on top difficulty i bet; and in those old civs you pretty sure are not winning in this absurd case)

it seems AI doesn't really try to unite against you in case of lead (though maybe does get furious at riches), yet is overly happy to try silly backstabs / 'surprise attacks' or else; it may even try to assault clearly later era stronghold with simple hordes that would almost never win there

oh and there's the quite massive downside in old civ - combat is literally random, so much that it matters almost endlessly, since there are massive terrain bonuses as well and ancient spearmen could very well beat tanks; it's not even a weird and rare case - hopelessly outdated AI hordes may just jump onto your mountains anytime and become unmovable force

there is a lot of inconvenience with units such as limits to upgrading, mostly no true way to skip tons of unit movements and such (maybe in case of railroads it becomes sort of that), while there are tons of units and often clumsy or limited control over them - and then 'same continent' is breaking minds of automated workers, there was a case where they literally rushed through many foreign borders and large lands that are hostile - to sometimes work on nearly or actually foreign volcano that recently exploded - and then instantly all die to yet another explosion, while they stand right on top of volcano

AIs for some reason barely ever wish to cooperate anyhow equally, even if it's them who often try to ally their weak nation to much more advanced one - even if it's exactly they who backstabbed you and awfully need protection now - of course it's you who always should pay army's worth of upkeep in protection treaty; then there's both positive and strange moment - bots can be (furious) at you yet still seriously try to ally and get protection

civ3 is somehow quite confusing and unintuitive i suppose, even when simultaneously tools available + core mechanics are ridiculously simple (but even pacing is very strange); it also seems to take massive time to playthrough even a bit - and without much management i guess (spammy) AI and all those older type mechanics can result in a quick death of civilization

it did have some nice ideas but the rest can simply create rather stupid spammy - defensive-favoring (and as well ruining that for YOU the player, because you lack any extra automation possible) grind, starting even from most ancient times where first of all units can be massed and rushed by population that generally anyone has and some do in massive surplus

overall civ3 has either too serious or too numerous problems to be offset by a few good moments; i'd say in practice it is easily nearly unplayable, inconvenient and quite mindless - while serious business going on against you won't let you be mindless one (or there you could lose on the easiest setting possible); it is possibly not even really challenging since maps feature very inhospitable lands (full of mountains not to even settle or ever grow anything) while as well rich and useful plains

so from the start it seems about all factors are against you; that's somewhat interesting but not for long (and that's a bit too much patience still)

since it is often not even easy to survive - some a bit casual or even a much later civ5 player will likely be plainly outspammed by ruthless AI if they miss about anything in proper setup and management (and when unfamiliar, there must be a lot to miss)

author: {'steamid': '76561198206886068', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1553362874}
review:
Sid Meier's Civilization III is the de-facto greatest game in terms of basic graphics and gameplay-wise, especially in the entire Sid Meier's Civilization series. It brung more things the other two didn't implement, such as animated leaders, advisors, and updated isometric view, and brand new land graphics simulating the real world, and even coastlines.

This version, however, is the greatest buy I have ever accomplished. You got editors, and other civilizations bundled with this! It has all three expansions, and adds a functioning multiplayer! I love this game and it even competes with my love for Civilization IV. I just love it, and you guys should get it at any opportunity, such as sales and special events.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997374071', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 39297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9420, 'last_played': 1604802662}
review:
Величайшая пошаговая стратегия всех времён. 4 часть и далее уходят куда-то в сторону SimCity и, как уже писал один англоговорящий рецензор, вызывают глазной рак. 

Из преимуществ, о которых мало пишут: шедевральный редактор, который осваивается за 5 минут — с его помощью можно поменять игру вообще как угодно, и полное соответствие правилу "easy to learn hard to master" — эта игра это само его воплощение.
Из недостатков: крайне большая продолжительность одной партии — от 2 часов (довольно грубый, сделанный фанатами в редакторе режим игры для мультиплеера) до, без преувеличений, полутора суток (если играть в обычном режиме без правил для быстрой победы), и скудный ИИ вкупе с проблематичной игрой в многопользовательском режиме (продолжительность, баги, возможность "легально" читерить просто проверяя сохранения на другом компьютере или во время перерыва/перезагрузки). 

Ремастер этой части был бы просто потрясающим: игре очень не хватает гексагональности, картинки посовременнее (без смены рисовки и минималистичного стиля), чуть более подробной настройки карт, улучшенного ИИ и большей приспособленности к игре по сети — на всё это даже не пришлось бы тратить и двух миллионов долларов, а такая игра бы стала лучшей игрой в галактике. Лучше всех существующих игр в Steam и на консолях, лучше тетриса, лучше покера, шахмат, "три в ряд", футбола и лучше Фортнайта.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972538083', 'num_games_owned': 970, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 28240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17821, 'last_played': 1705193424}
review:
This game is a good starting point for newcomers to the Civilization series and currently the best value for money. It is fully compatible with modern systems and still worth playing today. The visual aesthetic of the game is one of its best features, and I still consider III to be the best looking Civilization game, due to its appealing artstyle and readability.

Civ III lacks some of the sophisticated gameplay mechanics introduced in the later games and I consider the combat in particular to be a weaker point of this game, as it usually amounts to just mindlessly building more units than your opponents. Despite this, Civ III gets the job done simply and effectively, which is why I always come back to it over the other games in the series. The Conquests scenarios are an interesting addition to the game and I have replayed them countless times. There are also numerous custom scenarios and mods available. If you have an interest in history and like strategy games, I would fully recommend Civilization III.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983777241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1174, 'last_played': 1681847823}
review:
Самые интересные ситуации из всех цивилизаций у меня были именно в этой игре. Пусть на сложности выше нормальной меня почти всегда выносят, но это все равно интересно. Получить коварный удар в спину и не вынести войны на два фронта, открыть новый континент и застроить его городами, потерять эти города в войне, стартовать на малюсеньком острове в десятках океанических клеток от континента с остальными нациями - в этой игре я пережил всякое. Землятресения, вулканы и нашествия варваров прилагаются.
Самая атмосферная часть серии, где наиболее полно дух чувствуется  истории: технологии развиваются, империи рождаются и гибнут, осваиваются новые земли. Другие части слишком похожи на настольные игры, экспансия там не поощряется и даже вредна, что для большей части человеческой истории абсолютно абсурдно. Построили три города - и играем ими до конца. А в третьей Циве побеждают большие империи, хотя разориться от массовой застройки неперспективных территорий тоже очень легко.
В плане войны, конечно, жутко бесящая вещь, хотя плюсы в сравнении с более поздними частями также есть. Война здесь реально изматывает, как население, так и самого игрока.
Если хочется играть в Циву на вашем deadbook-е, то "трешку" можно смело брать, в плане геймплея она слабо уступает (если вообще уступает) более поздним часиям.

author: {'steamid': '76561198331489848', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1552397088}
review: I grew up playing Civilization II but never tried any of the subsequent games. When I saw Civ 3 on sale I decided to give it a go, a decision I would happily make again. An interesting and fun game that has areas of complexity mixed in with simplicity, I easily lose track of time playing this game and would definitely recommend it to anyone who enjoys strategy games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198309847540', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1524984514}
review:
[h1][b]The Good[/b][/h1]
The delightful simplicity even with the complex nature of the game. The Civilipedia is very insightful, and helps you a lot when playing the game. Graphics is good (although not excellent) and music is catchy. The way that it makes me THINK like no other game EVER managed to do is remarkable!

[h1][b]The Bad[/b][/h1]
Slowness of AI turns during the latter stages of the game was a bit bad, but not bad enough to prevent me from becoming a total addict.

[h1][b]The Bottom Line[/b][/h1]
All I can say is that if you don't know about this game yet, you're missing out on the most important of all computer games EVER.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037469371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1077, 'last_played': 1542510232}
review: I absolutely hate this game. I've played Call to Power 1 and 2, Sid Meier's Civ 5, 6, and this. I see all these reviews about how this is still the best Civ game, and I just do not see what they're seeing. In Civ 5 and 6, the enemy AI will at least kill and absorb far weaker AI. They will at least every once in awhile do little pretend wars where they attack another equal AI's city (not take it, but just damage it ). The enemy AI in this game will always be permanently allied against you, even if you pick for them to be the least aggressive they can be (useless option). The combat is the most frustrating, rng-based, tedious, time-consuming, micro-managing ****fest I've ever seen. You can have many units occupy a tile, but they can only attack 1 at a time. You would think that means combat would at least be better than Civ 5 and 6, but like I said, the rng is so stupid that you have to make sure you have an advantage of 5x or more, unless you want to just load half the time and try the battle again, cuz you will fail half the time at a 2x advantage. And what I mean by that is this - You can have a unit with twice as much attack as they have defense, they can be wounded, sitting in a grassland/plain, not fortified, not across a river, and there's still a good chance you will lose if you attack him. In addition to that, you can NOT fully kill an enemy by bombarding. This means that you have to rely on rng attacking to actually kill any enemy military unit. Call to Power 2 sucks because you can't set up a scenario where the AI put up any threat (they won't attack you with anything more than a few units ever), and this game sucks for the opposite reason, because the AI only wants you dead and they have huge advantages even on low difficulties. It especially doesn't help that the maps spawn such few horses and iron (even though you NEED them to get anything past starting units in this game), seems to always put them near the AI and far away from you, and punishes you greatly if you build a town far away from your own (through waste/corruption penalties), in which, you would need to connect that town with a road in order to build those horse/iron units in your other towns. If you don't connect that town to your civilization, then like I said, the waste/corruption is so bad that you won't get to build ANYTHING in that town. The enemy AI also destroys your lonely roads in no time. I'm uninstalling this game and never considering it again. BLIZZARD, PLEASE PUT CALL TO POWER 1 UP FOR DIGITAL DOWNLOAD, SO I CAN ACTUALLY HAVE FUN AGAINST AI AGAIN!

author: {'steamid': '76561198143232730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 29712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20099, 'last_played': 1658100283}

author: {'steamid': '76561198047290897', 'num_games_owned': 1042, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1623288840}
review:
I learned more about history playing this game and reading the in-game encylopedia than I ever would have from history classes. The game is fun enough for me to put many many hours into it (this is my third copy, having lost 2 physical discs) and then looking up why the game works the way it does (and why each Civ acts the way it does) can easily be compared to Schoolhouse Rock (only aimed at older audiences)

THIS is edutainment done right.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970292191', 'num_games_owned': 796, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1548685401}
review:
还有比3代更经典的吗？！当年高中时入的天人互动的正版，附赠的手册虽然不是彩页，但是完全厚的可以和教科书一般。
那我明白了，人如其名，游戏也是如此伟大！

author: {'steamid': '76561198119943236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1641019544}
review: 시디게임으로 2000시간 넘게 플레이했었는데 스팀에서도 그냥 구매해봄. 공식한글패치도 없고, 컴플리트버전 한글패치는 따로 없어서 2~3시간은 인터넷에서 이리저리 뒤져가며 한글패치해야하는 부담이 있음. 그것도 물론 어느정도 지식이 없으면 불가능함. 문명시리즈에서 가장 현실성있는 시리즈라고 볼 수 있음. 쓸데없이 현실감없는 구성들로 채워진 문명4나 베이직한 문명5보다 훨씬 현실감이 있음. 나라에서 제일 중요한 것은 돈벌이이며, 넓은땅도 문명의 기술발전, 합리적인 정부체제 없이는 부패로 인해 제대로 운영되지 않고, 전쟁에서 가장 중요한 것은 타이밍과 병력의양이라는 것을 알게해줌. 다만 초기 '대도서관' 중기 '군사학교'의 효과가 너무나도 뛰어나서 게임의 전쟁밸런스를 망치는게 아쉬울따름. 언어의 장벽만 뛰어넘으면 문명시리즈 사상 가장 뛰어난 게임성을 즐길 수 있음. 고전게임으로 분류될 정도로 출시된지 오래된 게임이지만 동시접속자수가 아직까지도 수백명단위를 꾸준히 찍고있음.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214367808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1542058153}
review: So, yeah, the graphics aren't what we're used to now, but this is still a great game.  Far and away better than the one that comes next, Civ IV.  FAR better.  Enjoyable, not easy to win -- I lost my first two games...mostly because there's no tutorial that I could find and the buttons are not exactly intuitive.  Heck, the game I won I didn't do all that well on.  Still, fun.  It's certainly not 5, but it's a nice change if you like old-school games.  Well worth the incredible low price.  Plays like a champ for me, no glitches at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045735588', 'num_games_owned': 590, 'num_reviews': 463, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1542038552}
review: Cóż po latach szału nie robi a nie będę ściemniał, że zagrywałem się w nią w czasach świetności jednak teraz po odpaleniu widać, że kilka rzeczy z tej części brakuje w najnowszych odsłonach produkcji a są to na przykład zbliżenia na miasto czy inne tego typu smaczki. Raczej nie ma po co tego kupować a pozycja może zainteresować kolekcjonerów lub największych fanatyków civa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198811091243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 26597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1330, 'last_played': 1705444165}
review:
This is The Best version of "Civilization" in series. The new "comic look" they started in Civ4 gives me eye cancer. So lame look since Civ4, which probably appeals only to 4-8 year kids. This is why I stick with The Perfect Civ3.

P.S.

Runs perfectly on Linux (Ubuntu 16.04 with 2560 x 1440 resolution monitor).

P.P.S.

To run in Linux:

a)
On a steam client go to "Steam > Settings > Steam Play" and check option "Enable Steam Play for all titles".

b)
Run a game first time - it probably won't start if You have large resolution monitor like me, but thats alright - the first run will create a conquests.ini (~/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Sid Meier's Civilization III Complete/Conquests/conquests.ini) file.

Put these lines in that file:

KeepRes=1
PlayIntro=0

Save changes and play now till you drop dead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035332846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2145, 'last_played': 1685241636}
review:
So I first started this game in the third grade, I distinctively remember one day I woke up early Saturday morning  the sun was rising and I started playing, what seemed like a moment later I looked up and night was upon me. This is one of my all time favorite game series and in my opinion the best for those who prefer playing wide as well as fighting wars. The AI will frequently cover the map in cities and if you're not quick to the punch you will be struggling trying to capture the iron you need to survive the game without cowering in fear of your enemies at every threat. I love the brutality and cuthroat play of the AI in this game and to top that off there are little things added to this game that can change your gameplay in little ways. For instance global warming, technology trading, volcanic eruptions, disease and my personal favorite cultural conversion. While the late games have made many changes they also stepped back in many areas in content from what this series use to have. To top this off this game processes turns for me far faster than the later games. (Did I mention the scenarios also kick ass?)

All in all you have to play it and fail at it for a few games before you're going to find your playstyle, to me this game is a masterpiece. It won't be for everyone but if you're a warmonger such as myself this game will sate your bloodlust and then some. 

P.S. The soundtrack is amazing and evolves with you.

review: 十分优秀的作品，上学时候的回忆。从不会玩到熟练操作，非常引人入胜。不知道为什么，习惯了文明3之后，对之后的系列并没有太多兴趣。其实就是喜欢爆兵流！一堆坦克飞机，满足幻想啊！花费最多时间的还是在3上。为了情怀，在steam上买了正版，虽然当年玩的也是买的正版光盘，但是已经找不到了。买了之后又是欲罢不能的玩爽啊！

review: Одна из первых игр, которые я когда-либо играл, первоначально имела версию диска, поэтому мои парные часы были позади. играли это на протяжении многих лет более 1 часа и все время возвращались к нему время от времени, Моя любимая запись в франшизе Civ играл эту игру в течение многих лет, много, и ai очень сложно, и игроку предлагается множество различных вариантов, чтобы каждая игра отличалась. Это глубокая игра с немного устаревшей графикой, но они не соответствуют этим, музыка также является огромным плюсом.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060482338', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 66454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 224, 'playtime_at_review': 4955, 'last_played': 1710782410}
review:
Classic strategy in randomly generated maps against various factions from the earliest days of mankind to the modern era.

The good:
- Strategy
- Music
- Gameplay mechanics such as: diplomacy, resources, luxuries, war, trade, exploration, technology advancement, and more.

The bad:
- (opinion) Complete edition introduced some unnecessary changes to the game. Default edition was better
- Late game units are arguably unbalanced

review: Unit stats don't seem to matter at all: just lost 20 crusaders (def 3) to 20 attacking numibian warriors (attack 2). Similar experiences in the past as well. In other aspects it's a great game but unit stats are in a critical role so it's ruining it for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198292701601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 35025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3463, 'last_played': 1707498262}
review:
This game is actually pretty good and a nice way to pass the time, but I don't understand why you can't have infinite turns to have that alternate earth timeline atmosphere that it takes place in your own version of Earth where your Civilisation can further go through its ups and downs with no sight of any kind of game victory in any horizon, but instead the best we can get is 1000 turns, which in my opinion is pretty displeasing since I was able to get a cultural victory with 1000 turns in just one go, on a small island surrounded by sea, in a very large map. I don't know if you CAN continue to run your civilization after a victory, because the 2 times I did get an endgame and went to click "OK", my game immediately freezes and stops working, making me have to quit the game.
Overall, it's a very fun game for you to pass the time, but it's going to be a quite the downer if you want to fully invest in your civilization for as long as you want (which would usually be "forever and ever" in some cases).
Overall, this game is a 8.5/10 in my opinion.

*Edit: I found out about the infinite turns, I was just stupid

author: {'steamid': '76561198178860310', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1645720104}
review:
Eh beh, il mio primo Civilization, come si fa a non amarlo. Questo è uno dei migliori Civ della storia ed uno dei migliori RTS a turni e 4X della storia. Questo gioco regala ancora emozioni e in alcune cose è molto piu in avanti rispetto al V o al VI (ad esempio con il passare degli anni il vostro capo diventera piu vecchio sul III, oppure il fatto di poter vedere la vostra città dopo che avrete costruito determinati edifici sul III si può fare, sui nuovi no, insomma dei dettagli che fanno la differenza). 
Se volete rigiocare a questa vecchia Gloria, fatelo subito, non ve ne pentirete. Vi consiglio vivamente l'acquisto.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987366779', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 4388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1439, 'last_played': 1671057253}
review: Dalej będę twierdził, że to najlepsza część, a grałem we wszystkie i tylko do niej i do V wracam. O ile fani IV, których nigdy nie zrozumiem pewnie się z tym nie zgodzą, to kazdy musi przyznać, ze Civ III ma najlepszy edytor w serii. Jest to osobne narzędzie dla osób nieznających się na programowaniu i modowaniu. Dzięki niemu każdy może stworzyć swoją mapę, scneariusz, czy... zasady gry, zmieniając parametry jednostek, cudów, narodów itp. Śmiało można powiedzieć, że dla zwykłego użytkownika edytory z części IV i V to patyk, a z III szwajcarski scyzoryk i to wcale nie ten najtańszy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061164965', 'num_games_owned': 1278, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 5601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4936, 'last_played': 1708615246}
review:
Sid Meier's Civilization III is a turn-based strategy game on where you can play as one of many nations/countries and play on various maps which would be the "Earth" for that map. This complete edition concludes of the base game, Civilization III, Civilization III Play the World & Civilization III Conquest. We have many scenarios in this game with examples of them being Rise of Rome, World War 2 Pacific and even Earth type maps which you can either have true starting locations as your desired nation or have the spawn randomized. 

PROS
- CIv 3 has the biggest maps out of any other Civ game.
- We have no limitations on units like we had on every sequel. Units can stack which gave a much more war feeling to the game.
- If you want a game to last at least a week or even a month. On this game you can make it happen.
- For an old game it still runs smoothly.
- Multiplayer still works, so you can play with friends and/or family.
- Gameplay is simple, but you can make mistakes easily and the enemy will take advantage of that 

CONS
- Dated graphics (can be a + or a -)

Overall
This is and always will be my favourite civ 3 game, the sequels are all about fancy graphics and less war. If you want to actually feel like you have a civilization then this is the game for you. If you want the ultimate experience, on an earth map and the biggest map you can dream of. Then pick this map. TETurkhan Test of Time. This comes with various game types that include of spawning with pre-made cities like earth is today with the available civilizations in the game, true location start which allows you to where your country's first capital was. Or have it randomized. So you could have England in India or the Japanese in Africa. This is the biggest map the game has to offer and with the size of it. You are talking at least a couple of weeks to finish, if you plan to go with a total domination game. Well I'ma say it'll take you a little over a month.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044605238', 'num_games_owned': 920, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1547840551}
review: Цива 3 для меня игра детства, в которую за 17 лет ее существования провел сотни часов. Поэтому, думаю, что за все те положительные эмоции, которые она подарила она заслуженно считается лучшей частью. Для меня, конечно. На фоне пятерки она несколько сложна для понимания, и все таки она устарела, да, время беспощадно отнеслось к одной из лучших игр человечества про время :) Кто начал играть с четверки/пятерки настоятельно рекомендую к ознакомлению. Сделайте некоторые усилия, и вы откроете для себя игру многоранную стратегическую игру, настоящую легенду жанра 4X

author: {'steamid': '76561198032877737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 239141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2369, 'playtime_at_review': 32825, 'last_played': 1710488344}
review:
Long story short: I bought Civilization 6, it bored me, I went back to previous versions till I found the Civ III CD. I forgot I had it, I forgot I used to play the game, the CD didn't install on Win 10, I went back to Steam and invested $1.49 on a download version... WOW I remember this game... that dick Alexander! The Cavalry, the awesome advisors, the incredible balance of resourses that keeps them relevant and even vital throughout the game. The expansion of territory and number of cities that increases your gold and power and access to more resources and luxuries instead then weight down your empire sustainability.  Best Civilization Ever!!!!

And if you are in for a change of pace... play Elimination.... build a small empire on a huge scale world and wait (with 6 or 7 offensive units) for the AI players to spam their cities near you and raze the newest most undefended one, rinse and repeat.
It never gets old.  :D

review:
Игра, про которую не нужно читать обзоры, чтобы составить мнение о ней. 
Самая атмосферная из всех частей, 4,5 и тем более 6 части и близко к ней не подошли.
Крайняя часть, где ИИ хоть что-то из себя представляет, где империи состоят из сотен городов (в отличие от следующих частей, когда "империя" в 5 городов - гигант). 
В общем, игра на все времена. Особенно с модами типа Evolution.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966944858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 174612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64594, 'last_played': 1703554229}
review: I've been coming back to this game year after year.  Civ IV, V, and VI have tended to streamline play and take on a more multiplayer-oriented mindset, which is great if that's what you want; but I keep coming back for Civ 3 for its month-long games, detail, and versatility.  I'll concede the vanilla game isn't the best (though the built-in scenarios are fun), but over the years I've edited the default scenario to a point that fits my playstyle: more resources types, greater differentiation in terrain, more divergent unit types, more engaging naval forces, and a modern era that holds a bit more interest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131478710', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2221, 'last_played': 1551293218}
review:
Среди всех игр серии Civilization самой значимой я считаю третью часть. Она вышла в 2001 году, в эпоху восхождения классических стратегий, C&C: Red Alert 2, Heroes of Might and Magic 3, Civilization 3, Total War (Shogun и Medieval), Warhammer 40.000 и целая куча других игр - тому пример. И каждая из них индивидуальна, каждая из них внесла какую то необычную идею  в игроиндустрию стратегий. Цивилизация же показала, что глобальная стратегия с элементами варгейма - неплохая и очень плодотворная идея. Побывать в шкуре правителя, возглавить нацию и через время привести её к мировому господству, заниматься политикой, и вести войну - это нам приподнесла серия игр Civilization. 
Вторая часть цивилизации по сравнению с третьей может поспорить в номинации самой значимой, однако, именно третья часть серии отполировала всё наработанное, представив публике то, что в итоге эволюционировало в последующие части серии.

author: {'steamid': '76561198446906929', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 22102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7046, 'last_played': 1655937255}
review:
Loved this many years ago & it is still an excellent strategy game in 2018

Info: Windows 10 users will need to do a few tweaks to make this run correct & look as it should on a modern HD monitor, first find the configuration file conquests.ini, open with notepad, scroll to the bottom & add the line "keepRes=1" to run the game at your display resolution, next find the file civ3conquests.exe, right click & in properties select to run both as administrator and in windows XP SP3 compatibility to fix a bug where the game freezes at the end of a game.

You're welcome & enjoy this classic ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198153016478', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1531207739}
review: I spent a great part of my childhood playing it along with Age of Empires, and today I'm happy to say that I have no regrets about it. Even though this isn't the kind of game that tracks my attention anymore, I still have fun playing it after so much time. Civilization is a legendary series of games and anyone who likes Strategy in Turns should try it at least once. If you are a Total War fan like me, don't be afraid to give it a shot. It might not have the RTS battles, but it is compensated by the extremely well produced variety of strategies in game, and it's always fun to interact with legendary leaders or seeing Gandhi starting a World's Domination plan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033818893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 8651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7371, 'last_played': 1673204122}
review:
It is really hard to choose a Civ game, as all of them are pretty darn good. But it is safe to say that Civ 3 is the best among the 2D entries, being the most streamlined one, gameplay-wise. It changes some things from its predecessor, eliminating unneeded units and techs, among other things. The game offers amazing replay value, and is certainly on par with the series' fame. Graphics are ok, as is the music.

This Steam version is good and working on Windows 11 (I tested myself). I recommend it to everybody, but specially those with an older PC, as it can run on almost anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011965365', 'num_games_owned': 2434, 'num_reviews': 2080, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1530496492}
review: The people that rate this game poorly because of the tank/spearman issue likely do not know how to play the game. The game does not determine battle outcomes by icon, it uses a number system. So in the case where a spearman is attacked by a tank: Spearman (in city, fortified, on a hill, across a river, etc. etc.) will be pumped up quite drastically and make it feasible to beat a tank. Awesome game, endless fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032096578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1533583288}
review:
I played CIV2 a lot many, many moons ago when it first came out. One of the features I miss from CIV2 was the debug menu where you could add and remove pretty much anything - city mprovements, tech, etc. I used to enjoy building up a civ in CIV2 then using that debug menu to strip everything away again back to stone age levels to prolong the game and really for laughs. CIV3 doesn't have that feature. It's still a good game but, I find that missing that feature results in a lot less horsing around. 

CIV2 game play time - probably ~1000 hours over the yerars. I don't expect to get to that level with CIV3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198267000910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1073, 'last_played': 1528683209}
review:
[h1]La mejor franquicia en juegos de estrategia[/h1]
Muy adictivo y con una complejidad que puede agradar a los que buscan retos. Aun en la dificultad mas baja te costara al menos un par de partidas poder conseguir una victoria.
Corre en PC con especificaciones muy basicas al 100, Igualmente funciona perfectamente con un equipo con windows 10, perfecto si cuentas con un computador muy basico o de mas de 10 años de antiguedad, podras tener un gran juego de estrategia, muy ligero en peso y con miles de horas de juego, ademas de su bajo coste.
Todo un clasico.

review: Very good game. If you don't care about graphics then this is definitely the Civ to get, not to mention the price point. It can get slightly repetitive, however it is not a game to pay all the time. Instead it is a game that, once you've got over the honeymoon period, you play once a week for a few hours. Lots of options to change difficulty, size of map and number of opponents. Don't buy if you expecting a multiplay experince as it doesn't exist anymore.
