author: {'steamid': '76561198246769620', 'num_games_owned': 1028, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1522466108}
review:
$5 for potentially hundreds of game hours, with even more once you discover the modding community's content? Get it. It doesn't matter if Civ 3 isn't on sale, just get it.

If steam recorded non-steam hours I'm pretty sure it would be in the 500-1000 hour range from when I played it back in the day. Civ 4 is the successor and improves on it, but Civ 3 will run on a potato* and has a comfy OST.

Seriously, if you've read this far you can scroll up and click the "add to cart" button.

* It'd run hot on my first laptop, a $1500 one from 2002 for school. No heat on a computer a little less than half the price from 2015.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151754519', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 19634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1709672511}
review: I feel I have barely scratched the surface of this game, but I already think it's absolutely wonderful. I've only played three and a half rounds, but in that time I had a blast. It can be a bit confusing at first, heck I still find it confusing, but it's easy to see past that. I would like to note that this is the only Civilization game I have played, so I have no basis of comparision for the others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198323449767', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1487, 'last_played': 1513901561}
review:
Menos complicado que Victoria y Europa Universalis. Quizás para unos aburrido por el hecho que es en turnos y con más estrategia que Age of Empires o Earth Empire.

Para los que lo obtuvieron gratis y le quieren dar una oportunidad pero no saben inglés busquen parches y guias; es muy facil, aparte es muy facil entenderlo y manejarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094021692', 'num_games_owned': 1028, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1509140867}
review: Easily the worst game I have ever played. A freind and I tried playing it together and this was just such a train wreck. We started over multiple times. Every single time we get 1 citizen farming on irrigated land with a road and then once the second comes they get miserable and riot, so you boost their happiness with gold, then that new citizen goes to work and just get enough food to survive and this continues on and on until you dont have the gold to keep them happy because you would then be going negative. so you have to make them entertainers which means someone isnt gathering food and thus your population staggers and remains stationary not getting any new people... so you are making no progress. and then it takes you forever to get even the most basic of technologies that other ai civs seem to get almost instanty? whats their secret? is it putting gold towards research? we cant do that it has to go to happiness. do they have specialist researcher? Well they dont seem to even make a turn of difference and doing that would again just eat up a worker and your city wouldnt be growing as you are breaking even on food, the only thing that can counter this is having a special food resource like wheat (and even luxury resources don't seemt to make a difference to happiness) because you would be getting enough food to cover one single person I.E. a specailist entertainer to make the one more citizen you are going to get in the future happy this is a 1-1 ratio so already its pointless... It seems multiplayer is much harder than single player but from what I have seen this is not only the worst civ game but one of the worst games I have ever played in general as you stuggle for hours only to find out your fucked from the beginning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071339384', 'num_games_owned': 803, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1527221316}
review:
This was given for free to Humble Bundle members recently. First launch crashed. Second launch I relised that screen ratio is 4:3 fixed and zero (in words: 0) display options. Okay, start game anyway... less than 2 minutes into the game the music loops. Mmhh okay, keep playing. Everybody declares war on me, okay, end game. Game crashes upon exit.

Publisher 2K giving away something for free, there you have it: 2 launches = 2 crashes, and audio bugged. Now I know why it was free. And after reading this far, you know, too. ;-)

PS. Somebody in the comments section suggested to change INI setting to fix a display issue (found on Steam forums). That seems to have broken the game even more for me: when installed, the game will not start at all, when rolling back the "fix," the right and bottom borders in game are cut off. Therefore, changing Preferences now is impossible and minimap, End Turn button and menus in game are not accessible any more. Those changes seem to be permanent even after reboots and Steam's own "Verify game integrity."

review:
Got it free from HumbleBundle! :)

The first Civ/Sid Meier's game I have played, so no bias from that. Also one of the first strategy games I have really put time into (And one of the first ones I have played). The graphics of this game aren't the best, but they are good enough to where you can play the game without being confused. Great to waste time alone or with friends. After you get bored you can get Mods (I recommend Space Opera) to extend the fun ever more. 

Here is an arbitrary score. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197965049785', 'num_games_owned': 1464, 'num_reviews': 497, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1508498981}
review:
In what seems like forever ago, I was excited for the release of Civ 3. It was the time in my life when I was relentlessly digging into history books, and it would be great to have a game compliment that. Of course, I had already had games that did that such as Age of Empires 2. But a big strategy game that let me do everything? That seemed shiny. A friend let me borrow of Civ 2 so I could at least get a vague idea of what it was like before Civ 3 released, and then, eventually, I got my hands on the game itself.

Ok... this is probably an excess of nostalgia, but I was trying to convey something important here. Namely that I [i]really[/i] liked Civ 3 when it came out, and played it for countless hours. It was also the only real time where I actually got involved in modding, since the Civ 3 Scenario editor was super easy to use and making historical scenarios was one of the few fun things I had in those days. I didn't use this screen name back then, but I had another and it was synonymous with creating detailed, but accessible, scenarios about events such as World War I, the Eastern Front of WW2, and more.

Civ 3 also was the only Civ game I really got into. Sure, I played 4 and 5 plenty, but they just didn't suit me as much. Naturally, what I really mean by this is that like Civ 4 and 5, 3 had strategic resources that you needed in order to build certain units. Unlike those later Civ games however, the amount of a resource you had didn't limit the number of units you could build that used those resources. So in my games I ended up with enormous empires with scores of cities, thousands of military units, and also that one time I made over 300 ICBM's. While that might seem absolutely crazy (you do know who is writing this, right? :P), it made everything seem large in scale and made the late-game wars huge endeavors that actually felt like it was a world war rather than just a skirmish over a handful of cities. Civ games since have drastically cut down the number of cities wanted or needed for their games, and with it Civ, to me, lost the "epic" quality that made me like Civ 3 as much as I did. Some might prefer how Civ has changed in this regard, but for me there isn't quite anything like the kinds of global wars or the very real sense of nuclear annihilation that Civ 3 had.

So... yeah this "review" is basically just a nostalgia trip. Humble Bundle was giving this game out for free not so long ago, and so I found Civ 3 reinstalled on my PC close to fifteen years after I first played it. Does it work on Steam? Well, I was able to boot it up and poke around a bit just fine. I have heard that others have had problems with getting this running however, which is kind of funny because Civ 3 was a [i]very[/i] stable game in the sense that it almost never crashed.

Giving this a "yes" for all the fun times this game provided me in the distant past. I can't really do otherwise. :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198008741129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1508986642}
review:
Obtenu gratuitement via Humble Bundle, je me faisais une joie de découvrir ce jeu, mais...

- Jeu intégralement en anglais, impossible de trouver un patch pour cette version.
- Pas possible d'afficher le jeu en 1080P.
- Lancement difficile, obliger de passer par un mode compatibilité Windows XP (SP3).

Ce jeu est sans doute génial, mais il est tellement complet, que si votre niveau d'anglais n'es pas élevé (c'est mon cas), vous ne biterez pas grand chose :-/

Si vous êtes anglophone, foncez, dans le cas contraire passez votre chemin !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031426331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1508790302}
review: Got this from the Humble Bundle as something to tide me over until the morons at Direct2Drive get my copy of Civ IV running again.  Lots of fun, great replayability.  It runs pretty well, but there are some quirks.  I can't run it from Steam, have to open the folder and run the .exe.  Music does not work when talking to other Civs, but runs fine otherwise.   I had many hours on this game back when it came out, but I had forgotten how challenging it is.  Graphics are still pretty decent.  I much prefer this to Civ V, which I recently uninstalled, probably never to return.  Only real drawbacks for me are that it is not hex-based, which does let you cheese a bit on some aspects, and the fact that corruption, etc. do not scale well to really large maps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319999730', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1655325573}
review: This game is fun at times, but also confusing. The UI hasn't aged well. After playing the game more and more, I found a lot of  features that I didn't even know exist, which made the game more fun and easier. All things considered, the game isn't very hard, but because I haven't played it a lot to know all of the little or big features/strategies the game has to offer, I found it a bit challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202022263', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 423, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1508762243}
review:
The player must construct and improve cities, train military and non-military units, improve terrain, research technologies, build Wonders of the World, make war or peace with neighboring civilizations, and so on. The player must balance a good infrastructure, resources, diplomatic and trading skills, technological advancement, city and empire management, culture, and military power to succeed.

I for one find these type of games boring but since I received this game for free (from HumbleBundle) I'm giving it a thumbs up, it's not a bad game for it's time but you've got to have the patience and sadly.... I don't have that.

If I was a real reviewer i'd give this a 9.5/10 buuuuut i'm not so it's having a 5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176480177', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1508775574}
review:
Gra napoczątku jest ciężka do zrozumienia ponieważ niektóre opcje są wręcz "niechlujnie" przedstawione, lecz z czasem coś da się ogarnąć.
Ta oto produkcja jak na swój rok wydania ma dosyć dobry gameplay.

Plusy:
+ spoko soundtrack
+ wciąga dzięki tak zwanym syndromie " jeszcze jedna tura" :D
+ dosyć dużo nacji do wyboru

Minusy:
- Brak tutorialu pomimo włączenia takiej opcji w preferencjach
- Brak polskiej wersji językowej i zresztą jakiejkolwiek prócz angielskiej
- Oszukiwanie AI pomimo włączenia najniższego poziomu trudności
- Podczas przegranej, po podsumowaniu gra się crashuje

Ocena końcowa: 6/10 
Czyli tak średnio do polecenia, raczej nie wrócisz już do tytułu :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198072589819', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1655081135}
review: Para los que recien lo tienen y estan diciendo que el juego es buenisimo, pues lamento decirles que no es asi, si bien es cierto no he jugado tanto tiempo como para dar una critica certera, pero llevo jugando Civilization III muchos años, y la version normal funciona mucho mejor que esta. De partida, cuando te encuentras con otra civilizacion y se comunican, en la interfaz de comunicación, se para la musica y el sonido, y cuando la cierras por un instante se escucha la musica que habia de fondo. Segundo, cuando construyes Grandes maravillas nuevas, la estatua de zeus y "Caballeros Templarios", en la vista de la ciudad no aparece, afecta al juego y aparece dentro de las caracteristicas de la ciudad, pero en el mapa de la ciudad no aparece. Tercero, el multijugador no funciona, intente jugar en LAN, y no se puede, de partida no te dice como poder crear una o como saber si ya creaste una sala como para poder empezar a jugar, es muy poco amigable en ese aspecto que le quita bastante valor y gracia al juego, hubiera sido genial que el multijugador funcionara... pero no, no funciona, mi recomendación? juegen a la primera version de este juego Sid Meier's Civilization lll aun que sea para pasar el rato, esta mejor hecho que esta version...

author: {'steamid': '76561198158846525', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1508688145}

author: {'steamid': '76561198178844697', 'num_games_owned': 18, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1509568540}
review:
É um bom jogo, porém é meio complicado e acaba ficando mais complicado ainda por ser apenas em inglês, assim, para conseguir tirar um maior proveito do jogo, é exigido um conhecimento maior da língua inglesa.
 Os gráficos não são muito avançados para agora, mas acredito que eram bons para a época em que foi lançado, acredito que qualquer PC consiga rodar bem esse jogo.
 A jogabilidade pode ser meio confusa se for a primeira vez que você jogou um jogo assim, principalmente não ter um tutorial do básico, e a "Civilopédia" que contém as informações sobre tudo do jogo está em inglês também.
 Mas eu acho que é um ótido jogo, pode ser enjoativo se você jogar direto mas garanto que vai demorar para enjoar desse jogo.

review: Osobiście, bardzo polecam tą grę, jest bardzo ciekawa, trudna. To był tylko jeden minus. Na prawdę gorrąco polecam dla fanów strategii. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198137516578', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1527438768}
review:
Bir oyun açtım, ada da tek başıma 2 tane şehir kurar gelişirim dedim. Fakat adanın en küçük boşluğuna dahi gelip şehir kurabiliyorlar.. Ayrıca oyunun başında 120-150 altın falan istemeye başladılar.. Vermeyince de direkt savaş açıyorlar.. Neyse asker basar, adadan atarım dedim... Saniye başı teknelerle adam getirip durdular..Hığğammnna dedim kapadım... Biraz acımasız olmuş... Seri asker basmanız lazım en baştan... Oyunun oynanabilirliği de yüksek.. Yönetimi tamamen basit, civ serisinin sevenlerine zaten grafikleri yeterli bile gelecektir. Sıkılınca oynamalık...

Yaşadığım bazı sorunlar:
-Oyuna girişte, en başta çıkan marka logoları, video vs. geçmek için fareye tıklayınca oyun donuyor.. kapatıp açmanız gerekiyor. ve 10 dk bunların geçmesini bekliyorsunuz...
-Oyun kurarken, ''oyun sınırlaması'' diye bir bölümü var... Şu kadar bölümde oyun bitsin tarzında.
orada hangi seçeneği seçer isem seçeyim, her zaman seçenek ''x tur sonra bitsin'' de kalıyor...

author: {'steamid': '76561198378573878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3, 'last_played': 1509594588}
review:
Mi primer civilization; le recuerdo mucho tiempo jugandolo haciendo que reprobara en la escuela, despues de años lo vuelvo a probar y me sigue dejando la misma sensacion de un turno mas...
Una dificultad retadora que puede ahuyentar al novato por su falta de tutorial y una gran dificultad(presente desde la dificultad mas facil), pero que sabe recompensar una vez le encuetres el modo, y si bien no es perfecto si lo comparas con los demas juegos de la saga es un buen juego por separado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057075077', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1508623903}
review: Ich bin leider kein Spieler von Civilization 3 gewesen als es 2001 raus kam, deswegen kann ich es nicht mit dem Nostalgie Bonus bewerten, allerdings habe ich CIV 5 einige Stunden gespielt und will mir auch noch den 6. Teil holen. Von diesem Spiel hier kann ich wirklich nur abraten, es hat ein schreckliches Menu für heutige Verhältnise, einen Soundtrack den ich sofort ausgeschaltet habe weil er nur aus ein paar Trommelschlägen besteht (Im Spiel selber, die Menu Musik ist in Ordnung) und auch sonst motiviert mich einfach rein gar nichts hier auch nur eine Minute mehr zu spielen, als das kurze reinschauen. Für alle die es früher gespielt haben und einfach wieder die schönen Erinnerungen aufleben lassen wollen sind 5 Euro ein guter Preis, für den Rest, CIV 5 ist mittlerweile bestimmt auch in einem Sale mal für 5 Euro zu haben, es ist sehr schlecht gealtert und einfach nicht mehr zeitgemäß.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996128287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1513724540}
review:
So as I was getting tired with all these milleanial crying about bad graphics, the resolution doesn't change or there is no tutorial etc. Shame on you. 

The game was released in 2001. To me, the graphics look just fine.

As in for the resolution schaisse, i could find a fix LITERALY in one minute. Just googled "Civ 3 widescreen" and blam. There it was. Just modify the Civilization.ini (or in this case, conquests.ini) and add KeepRes=1. REALLY hard wasn't it?
And during the 2001, most people used windows 2000 or older system and had crt monitors.
So that kinda explains why all the problems with newer Windows systems. 

As in with the tutorial, im pretty sure that it was included in an actual manual that had came with the physical copy. Just like Civ 2 did. And in the 2001 it wasn't that common that a computer game didn't have an ingame tutorial. Hell, it was trial and error method on many games. That was what we did with my friends when we were kids and didn't know english yet (allthough we learned a lot from gaming and were top of the class). 

Stop whining about the nonexistent problems and learn to a) solve them yourselves or b) to find information on how to solve them.

Now, thats with all the steaming. In my opinion the game is good for its age and well worth the 5€ price. The "free" makes it even better. I can recommend this to anyone who wants to feel that great nostalgia or get back to the roots of civilization series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302804856', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 10724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1619694041}
review:
Civ III is an apogee of the former "Civilization" games focus. Why play it now, when Civ V is tuned,fixed, updated so many times - and even price looks fine for almost every pocket? Well, it's all for that focus I'm talking about.

First three of Civilozation games were taking the player back at the dawn of the known history- and to help to notice the flow of time,there was some borderlines across that mighty river of the so-called "4th dimension". Starting with the Civ V this process of moving through timeline were "smoothed", to the point where player gliding from the start to the end of the game without any noticable delay. I'm not saying that's bad- I like Civ V myself, but sometimes you don't want simple transfer from A to B, from the stone to electricage, you want to see cornerstones to each specific era. And with that, Civ V is giving you the better experience. 

 All that i said in the previous passage,is arguable,of course. But here is another trait of Civ III which was intentionally cutted off ( in favor of balance, of course) , the size of armies and all warfare business. 
With all complexity of the game mechanics in the Civ V,armed conquests there looking as they performed 20-30 people at best. In Civ III,we have totally another scale. So,when I want to win a game of Civilization by Assault strategy, I start Civ III. 

The third volume of Civilization is dated, but still deep,still challenging, still holding the billion of possitibilities to build your nation. Make your Way. So I'll mark the game as 9?10, not ideal, but so much enjoyable! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198090361767', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1508577142}
review:
这是我人生中买的第一个正版游戏

刚接触文明3的时候记得还在上小学

那时候叔叔开了家电脑店 送了我第一台电脑 装了金山画王 打字通 和大富翁

我对这些卡通化的东西早玩腻了 一直想玩一些 战争 策略 这类的

但有一个问题 就是没钱 

当时背着我妈偷偷去了碟子店 一共买了三张碟 一个抢滩登陆 一个尤里复仇的盗版一个就是引以为
豪的正版“文明3”

比较火的正版游戏 一般装在一个高达模型大的盒子里 橱窗里面标着六七十上百的价格

而我一个小学生完全买不起 但是一个叫文明3的“正版游戏”吸引了我 

这个号称十元正版的“芝麻开门”系列（虽然都是正版 但好像都不怎么火）的“文明3”明显包装就比盗版的颜色正 

而且看后面介绍 第一次听说这游戏能造奇观 还有类似于帝国时代的时代更迭 就比较感兴趣了 （但是后来玩起来节奏比帝国时代慢多了 我相信就是为什么当时火不起来）

和现在的文明相比 当时累积居民幸福度可以产生庆典 一层层加盖官邸 和simcity的市长建筑有点像 （从石器时代开始 即使到了工业时代还是是加盖石头官邸感觉怪怪的 不过当时的我并不在意玩起来还很有成就感）

但有个缺陷就是战斗动画基本没有 单位还可以在同一个单元格叠加N层

电脑喜欢暴兵 战斗的时候看电脑把堆在一个单元格的20多个兵一次次的移动 这感觉太酸爽了 

画面在当时算不错的 十几年过去了 再一次重温 面对低分辨率  和暗黑2 一样沧桑的Ui和美术风格 想

想当年面对这个游戏一坐就是一整天 不造出个全奇观满人口大城就不想停手 感叹时间过得真快啊 

即使现在再屌再火的东西放个三五年也是回忆了 放到未来来看甚至还有点可笑 游戏如此 人生何尝不是？ 

今朝有酒今朝醉吧 现在《茶杯头》这类的复古游戏这么火 说不定还有重制版的文明呢？

author: {'steamid': '76561198174884434', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 663, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1508546619}
review:
Bom, essa análise vai ser SUPER curta pois eu realmente não tenho muito o que dizer a respeito de Sid Meier's Civilization® III. Além disto, esta minha análise será diferente das outras, não irei falar dos pontos negativos e positivos do game, mas sim falar o que achei dele pelo que vi.

Para começar, caso queira jogar, tenha uma paciência sensacional, eu tenho, mas esse jogo conseguiu tirar a toda.

Como disse antes, você necessita de paciência, mas por que ? Eu não entendi muito bem a jogabilidade do jogo, pois você controla dois personagens, mas tem rounds para movê-los, não consegui entender mesmo.

Ao que me parece, a proposta do jogo é muito boa, que simplesmente consiste em você explorar o mundo como era antes de Cristo, tanto que no início do jogo, você escolhe o lugar que quer ficar, quem quer ser, como Româno, Japônes, Russo, etc.

Aparentemente, também podemos negociar com outros viajantes, ver a criação de lugares, como Nova York, e ter guerras.

O jogo também me parece que tem ''Finais'' diversificados, mas como assim ? Aparentemente você pode acabar morrendo em qualquer lugar no game, o que faz dificultar o jogo, logo, o jogo te dá a ''opção'' de morrer de várias formas diferentes.

''Então por que não recomendo o jogo ? Se tem o 3 quer dizer que  o jogo é bom.'' E bem, não posso negar, o jogo realmente deve ter feito sucesso, mas temos que lembrar que somos humanos e temos opiniões diferentes, e Sid Meier's Civilization não me agradou e não me fez querer continuar a jogar.

Eu peguei este jogo por key em um site, estou realmente feliz de não ter gastado dinheiro.

review: Está claro que es la evolución de CIV II pero su jugabilidad, a pesar del esfuerzo de los autores, no ha evolucionado del mismo modo. author: {'steamid': '76561198215270809', 'num_games_owned': 2152, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1518142621}
review:
Yes its 16 years old, its turn-based strategy with city management and diplomacy, it doesn't have eye candy and all the fancy shaders. But its real, deep and beautiful.
Civilization III is a worthy addition to the series. I've played I and II (I still play Civilization I on dosbox) and I appreciate all the improvements from Civilization II (But II still has the best and funniest videos in the series).
Game runs without any issues on Windows 10 and I only added a single line to the config file to play at my maximum resolution. 
So locate "Conquests\conquests.ini" and add the line "KeepRes=1"

...and enjoy another classic masterpiece

author: {'steamid': '76561198154391267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1582471522}
review:
Wann ist ein Spiel gut ?
Wenn man nach über 15 Jahren noch die Tastaturkürzel im Kopf hat !

Sicherlich ist die Grafik nach heutigem Maßstab veraltet, darum ist es bei CIV jedoch nie gegangen. CIV spielt sich zu grossem Teil im Kopf ab. Die Karte ist mehr eine schematische Darstellung der Zivilisation, des Entwicklungstandes und des Weltreiches das man erschaffen hat. Richtig zu leben beginnt CIV in der eigenen Birne.
Am Spielablauf hat sich nie etwas geändert: Siedler ziehen, Stadt bauen, Truppen bauen, Welt erobern. Wenn man die grundsätzliche Mechanik verstanden hat mutiert CIV sehr schnell zu einem Grand Strategy Game mit irrer Spieltiefe. Der Technologie-Baum ist riesig, und man kann sein Volk von der Steinzeit ins Atomzeitalter führen. Die eingebaute "Civilopedia" und ein kurzes Tutorial beantworten die meißten Fragen und erleichtern den Einstieg.

CIV macht süchtig und ist ein typisches "nur noch ein Zug"-Spiel. Durchzockte Nächte inbegriffen.

Läuft auch in hohen Auflösungen wenn man in der conquests.ini "KeepRes=1" unten einfügt.
Das Spiel ist auf Englisch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120809647', 'num_games_owned': 1580, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1508644823}
review:
接触到的第一部文明作品，造遗迹从小学造到了初中

叠兵、暴乱、城市预览、加上攻城即破的设定到了后来都没有了，

加上后来由2k发行[spoiler] 2k一生黑[/spoiler]3代成为我最喜欢的文明作品

5出来的时候，你玩过文明3吗
6出来的时候，你玩过文明3吗
真希望有人能答应句我小时候也玩过，我唐公九鼎国马兵贼六

当年的实体光盘和其他少数正版光盘放在cd包里一起收拾在角落里吃灰

或许这辈子也不会把它们插进光驱了吧，几年后跟孩子吹这些回合制老游戏也不会理解吧

别人眼里一个普普通通的喜加一，在自己心里却跟打翻了一瓶老陈醋一样

author: {'steamid': '76561198308367219', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1508600389}
review:
Когда Sid Meier в далеком 1991 году выпустил Civilization - это была революция в только зарождающемся игровом мире, можно сказать, был открыт новый жанр - строительство большой империи и не просто какой-нибудь футуристической, а
совершенно реальной, исторической. Игра была богата игровыми возможностями: вы основывали города, превращая их из небольших варварских поселений в мегаполисы; строили чудеса света; дружили и вели затяжные войны с соседними империями; развивали науку
(правда, этот процесс выглядел немного упрощено: ну представьте, что вы Чингиз Хан и вот сидите вы в своем замке, в столице и вдруг видите, на ваш город наступают войска соседей, вы созываете совет ученых и говорите: "А не изобрести ли нам Математику, дабы мы могли построить катапульту и отбиться от врага", конечно похоже на бред, но придумать нечто радикально иное мне не представляется возможным).
В том году это был стопроцентный хит со своей неповторимой атмосферой, игра стала культовой, обрела истинных фанатов,
вписала свою строчку во всемирную историю игровой индустрии, а имя Sid Meier стало знаком качества. Через 5 лет, в 1996 году Sid Meier подарил нам Civilization II. Улучшилась графика, расширился gameplay, игра пробрела глубину, а тираж этой версии достиг более 4 млн. экземпляров. И вот более чем через 10 лет после выхода
Civilization мы опять берем на себя бразды правление цивилизацией и начинаем писать историю нашего мира заново, ведь в нем было столько неправильного и несправедливого! 
Разработчики из Firaxis хотели сделать каждую цивилизацию отличной от другой: первый шаг к этому - это, конечно, анимированный лидер, другой - каждая цивилизация имеет преимущество над другими в двух областях из шести: 

Коммерция (Commercial) - больший доход с населения и меньший уровень коррупции (явно пока не относится к России)

Расширение/Экспансия (Expansionist) - захват больших территорий в самом начале игры, начинает игру со скаутом (по ровной местности делает два хода). Варварские поселения приносят больший доход (естественно от их разграбления).

Военная сила (Militaristic) - военные постройки (Barracks и Coastal Fortresses) обходятся дешевле. Военные юниты быстрее
получают опыт и звания (regular, veteran и elite, с повышением увеличивается показатель здоровья на одну единицу).

Религиозность (Religious) - религиозные постройки (Temple и Cathedral) обходятся дешевле
и снижается период анархии при смене государственных режимов (Деспотизм, Монархия, Демократия, Коммунизм).

Трудолюбие (Industrious) - рабочие быстрее выполняют свою работу. При большом населении в городе увеличивается количество shield'ов. (из
КВН'а: русские были очень ленивый народ, даже если их уводили в плен, они и там не работали, надеюсь
:).

Наука (Scientific) - постройки, связанные с наукой обходятся дешевле (Libraries и Universities). Бонус при старте каждой новой эры. 

Так же каждая цивилизация имеет своего уникального юнита, доступного для строительства только ей.
Например Россия: лидер - Екатерина, столица -
Москва, уникальный юнит - Казак (6/4/3), любимые
области деятельности - Экспансия/Наука. Число цивилизация было сокращенно с 21 до 16, были убраны Испанцы, Монголы, Кельты, Викинги и Карфагенянине. Не понимаю, чем не угодили испанцы, ну и ладно, главное Россия есть. 

Юниты.

Всего в Цивилизации III есть 65 юнитов (16 из которых специальные), которые в большинстве своем перекочевали из предыдущей игры. Главное изменение - это то, что юниты больше не поддерживаются городом, в котором они были построены. На их содержание идут средства из государственного бюджета aka казна. В зависимости от государственного строя, на котором основывается ваша империя, вы можете поддерживать определенное количество юнитов бесплатно. После того, как этот лимит будет превышен, придется выкладывать
денюжку отдельно. Юниты также не требуют на свое содержание shield'ов и пищи. Боевые единицы лечатся самостоятельно, если ими не ходить. Но они не будут выздоравливать, находясь на территории вражеского государства. Чтобы это произошло, придется построить Battlefield Medicine (Маленькое чудо света локального масштаба).

И самое главное, для постройки юнитов теперь требуется определенные ресурсы. Я был сам немного удивлен, когда, изобретя Рыцарей, я не смог их построить. Оказывается для этого теперь нужно иметь лошадей и железо. Вроде все правдоподобно звучит, но все равно как-то непривычно. Вот вам первый совет: в самом начале игры постарайтесь иметь доступ к железу, чтобы строить Swordsman'ов и это также неплохой ресурс для международной торговли. Ресурсы в игре расположены таким образом, что их только по 2-3 на каждом архипелаге, так что торговать с другими игроками придется. 
В игре также имеется небольшая особенность, связанная с взаимодействием юнитов и поверхности на которой они находятся. Например, артиллерия, расположенная на возвышенности, имеет более больший радиус поражения. А какой-нибудь warrior, забравшись на гору, будет видеть дальше. Земные и морские же юниты не будут видеть местность, которую загораживают горы. 

Теперь вы можете захватывать некоторые вражеские юниты (поселенцев,
рабочих и артиллерию, поселенец при захвате
превращается в двух worker'ов, потому что основание города иностранной нацией - как-то неестественно выглядит). Помню у меня увели большую половину моих рабочих, те просто стояли на границе, а Англичане, без объявления войны ни с того ни сего их атаковали. При чем к тому времени я был совершенно не готов к войне, и пришлось даже заплатить 1000 золотых за позорное мирное соглашение, потом пришлось перестраивать экономику на военный лад и уже через 15 лет, мои казаки, размахивая шашками, грабили Лондон.
Ни в одной другой игре нет таких богатых игровых возможностей. Пушки, катапульты и вся прочая артиллеристская братия теперь не может просто атаковать врага, но они могут бомбардировать ту клетку, на которой находится цель. Так же они автоматически вступают в бой, если находятся в городе или отряде, который подвергается агрессии. 

Появился Privateer (Пиратский корабль) так что можно атаковать вражеские морские цели без ущерба быть втянутым в глобальный военный конфликт.
Юниты теперь могут запросто
апгрейдиться в городах. Для этого просто нажимаете правой клавишей мыши на юните пункт upgrade, выплачиваете n-ную сумму денег и вот у вас боевая единица, отвечающая всем современным стандартам своего времени. Некоторые юниты, модернизируясь, проходят с вами через всю игру. 

Наука.

Техническое древо технологий было не очень сильно изменено: некоторые изобретения были переименованы, некоторые добавлены или убраны вовсе. Всего в Civilization III насчитывается в общей сложности 82 технологии. Они делятся на четыре секции: Древнее время, Ренессанс, Индустриальное и Современное. Вы должны полностью изучить технологии, соответствующие определенному времени, и только лишь за тем, вы перейдете в следующий период. Здесь все просто и ясно: во многом от науки зависит вся ваша империя и экономить на ней не стоит. 

Культура. Мы подошли к самому важному нововведению, которое изменило во многом концепцию и стратегию всей игры. Каждый город производит за один ход определенное количество culture point, эти поинты зависят от построек так или иначе связанных с искусством и философией. Такие как Cathedral(3), Coliseum(2), Library(3), Palace(1), Research Lab (2), Temple(2), University (4) (в скобках стоит число, на которое каждый ход увеличивается показатель культуры). Большие и малые Чудеса Света прибавляют от 1 до 5 очков. (например, Military academy - приносит 1 очко, а
Собор Баха - 5). Существует определенный предел, превышая который, культура в городе поднимается на новый уровень (в начале это 10/100/1000/10000/100000 и, наверное, до бесконечности). После получения нового уровня растет граница города и его влияние. Так, в самом начале постройки, граница города занимает всего 1 клетку вокруг, и с каждым пределом растет на одну единицу. И вот самое интересное, если вражеский город (с более низкой культурой) попадает

review:
#文明3#，全称#席德梅尔的文明3#，策略战棋类，hb限免领的，推荐文明5或6，以下也偏向5/6（反正都是阿提拉模拟器）。一个能让人不知不觉错过各种ddl的游戏，关于历史政治科学的阅读量近乎变态。玩法上是建国带领文明从石器时代进化到信息时代，侵略扩张无恶不作，各国首脑谈笑风生,修改器才是第一生产力。3代4代无官中，5有繁中，6有简加繁。

【游戏背后的神】席德梅尔介绍：
BV19x411Z7bT
BV1Et411n7BM

2020-05-21，epic平台限免领了文明6。

author: {'steamid': '76561198071138462', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 504, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1710154229}
review: С момента выхода игры наиграл бесчисленное количество часов. До сих пор вспоминаю, как покупал дополнения, встречаясь с продавцом в метро, потому что в местах продаж была только изначальная версия, и с нетерпением устанавливал в тот же день. Даже сейчас игра регулярно отбирает у меня полдня, настолько затягивает процесс. За что особенное спасибо мододелам, которые и в 2017-м продлевают жизнь моей любимой части "Цивилизации" (а начинал я с первой на школьном компьютере в середине 90х). Самый главный плюс - это дипломатия, психология каждого лидера уникальна, полное ощущение, что играешь с живыми игроками, подбирая ключик к каждому из них. Второй плюс - это масштаб, выстроив предварительно экономику и захватив лидерство в технологической сфере, можно вести войны, используя сотни юнитов, на разных континентах, вступая в сложные коалиции, причём зачастую проигрывая более сильным странам. Игра десять в одном  с очень широкими возможностями и свободой: тут можно просто заниматься огородиком, развивая государство, можно плести интриги, сталкивая лбами противников, можно поставить себе цель захватить все чудеса света, монополизировать ресурсы или, например, спасти более слабого соперника, которому угрожает громила, - всегда нахожу чем себя развлечь. Игру купил в Стим, чтобы отблагодарить создателей, со своей копией играется лучше. Из модов прежде всего рекомендую CCM (epic mod).

author: {'steamid': '76561198109632201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 69523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23924, 'last_played': 1676789572}
review: One of my very favorite games even to this day! The functionality runs seamlessly with game play and mechanics for a total experience in a world history of your own making. The civilizations are diverse, each with strengths and weakness you need to manage and combine together for the ultimate in strategy and critical thinking. Each individual item has its own entry which you can research and learn real historical facts from. Truly a game that will make want to have "just... one... more... turn.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031151026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 29146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9380, 'last_played': 1705493472}
review:
My favorite Civilization title of all time. This game may be old, but I find it's graphics are just right for the genre and it does not have the cartoony look that some later titles are sometimes guilty of. Being an older title, the AI isn't always the smartest and will struggle to perform certain tasks like sea-based invasions. A huge problem with this game is its infamous RNG which has led to powerful units being killed by weaker unit (i.e. spearman kills tank). However, just play without "preserve random seed" enabled and you can just save before each battle and reload quickly to get a better result if you feel you have been cheated. Other features missing include advanced diplomacy beyond war and trade and revolutions occuring in pre-established empires (a feature lacking from most unmodded Civ titles).

The thing that makes this game my favorite Civ is the availablity of mods to customize this game to your heart's content. You can play out just about any scenario you can think of. Although a lot of files were lost when civfanatics changed a while back, there is still plenty of diverse content available. I would highly recommend the WorldWide mod for anyone looking for a much expanded version of the game. Whether you want to make small changes like add in one or two units or a custom civ, or install total conversions and scenarios, the tutorials online make it very easy to add such things in.

I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys Civilization and other empire-building RTS games.


I have logged hundreds of hours on the disk version. The steam version makes it easy for me to carry this game wherever I go without having to bring disks. The only difference (and problem) I have found between the disk and Steam versions is Steam removed a lot of accesory files from the game's files, such as .exe's for vanilla Civ3 and Civ3PTW expansion. Otherwise, I have noticed little difference.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072646282', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1506047666}
review:
No está nada mal, aunque la IA no sea de lo más excepcional sirve para pasar un buen rato. Se echa de menos un tutorial, te ponen en mitad del mapa y debes ir investigando como se juega o en su lugar leyendo los consejos. La historia de las naciones es muy acertada, aunque históricamente hay aspectos que se podrían mejorar, las animaciones de los líderes de cada nación también se podrían mejorar, ya que muchos de ellos no coinciden con los retratos recogidos en dicha época, la mayoría son caracterizados por estereotipos, algo que en muchos casos dista mucho de la realidad.

Se echa de menos la traducción al español, votaría negativo solo por esto, pero en este caso no lo hare, al ser una edición digital y no una física como la que se comercializo en español, la empresa del juego debe llegar a un acuerdo con la que lo publicó en español para que les den los derechos de dicha traducción, normalmente esto es un proceso difícil y muchas empresas ni se molestan, y menos cuando es un juego de hace tanto tiempo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040694833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3257, 'last_played': 1654745076}
review:
Easily the best version of Civ, old or new. One of my all time favorites. Steam tracks my playtime now, but I promise that from childhood to today, I've lost track of how much I've played this game. So many different strategies, so many cultures, and so many ways to play it. The messed up part is I've only scratched the surface, and I'm still not THAT good at the game. Even on the lowest difficulty, it's a challenge. If you're into strategy games, this is THE strategy game. If you're new to strategy games, start here.

My only major criticism is that it's hard to learn. Later sequels have better tutorials, and I still learn things about this game to this day. Take that as you will.

review:
シヴィライゼーションの中では、一番面白い。
全く容赦が無い、純粋な、シヴィライゼーションの、スタック制。←ここ一番重要
蛮族でさえ、何十もの騎馬ユニットで押し寄せて町を略奪しまくってくる。
東西ローマ帝国のコンクエスト最高にお勧め、蛮族たちと外交しまくって互いに戦わせないと生き残れないよ、ガチで史実、リアルすぎ。（皇帝＆most）
（エディタで数秒ポチポチで東西ローマ帝国使える＆タイムリミット外せる）
エディタがあるので、自由に改造し放題。

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1503058300}
review:
Tags: TBS - Turn Based Strategy
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Sid Meier's Alpha Centauri is a more interesting early Civilization game. While Civ IV and onwards all outshine this.

Some people say the game have technical issues, some say the mechanics have issues. I'll be honest I dont care. My problem is mostly that if I am going that far back in the Civ Series, I will keep going to Sid Meier's Alpha Centauri and have a much more immersive and pleasant experience there. Otherwise for the vanilla caveman to space age Civ I would rather play a newer iteration than this

author: {'steamid': '76561198048157160', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 14241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1134, 'last_played': 1699817384}
review:
Ci gioco da 10 anni, il miglior Civilization in assoluto!
Giocato il 4, passato tantissime ore sul 5, mi sono bastate poche ore sul 6 ma il 3 rimarrà sempre il mio preferito.
Molto più complicato dei successivi, molto più accurato con possibilità infinite.
E' triste il fatto che i capitoli successivi siano stati semplificati per aumentare le possibilità di vendita.
Un must per gli appassionati di strategici a turni!

review: Это первая моя игра из данной серии. Да и в принципе игр такого жанра и геймплея. Самый лучший вариант это играть одному. Без врагов и союзников. Мне не особо зашла эта игра. Скорее всего это по той причине, что враги при равных условиях одним бойцом первого уровня пятнадцать моих. Хотя я понимаю людей, которым нравится эта игра. Её старенький, но милый графон вместе с музыкой способны затянуть на час другой. (За исключением того времени, когда ты воюешь)

author: {'steamid': '76561198185418747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1646, 'last_played': 1505557572}
review:
This is a newbie and an idiot's perspective of Civ 3, so get ready for a lot of... well, newbie and idiot stuff and more complaints than anything about a game released 16 fucking years ago. 

Before Civ 3 I'd never played a Civilization game, but would become curious periodically as to what they were about. I couldn't afford Civ 4, 5, or 6, so I bought the one I could. 

And... I'll be honest. I cannot beat the game even with all the settings set as low as they can go with 1000 turns, etc etc. I just can't get through the tech tree fast enough to keep up, I can send an entire army after a city and come back with maybe 2HP knocked off someone in the city, and not know what the hell I'm doing wrong. If you're new to Civilization, I would pick up a different version. 

There's also an issue with the sound; rather than playing a music track when I encounter someone else, the game glitches  with its music tracks and blasts my ears with something fucking awful. High pitched electronic squeaks that absolutely destroy my ears and concentration, possibly leading to me making deals I regret with the civilizations I encounter. This is less a "I'm stupid as hell but don't want to look up a guide" issue and more of an actual issue with the game, or perhaps my sound card is too advanced.

That all said, it's not the kind of shit that makes me want to give up on Civ 3. I still enjoy playing it, and I think others would, too. I likely just need some guidance about what strategies are good ideas for which civilizations, or which one will fit my playstyle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198346639376', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 24146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 34, 'playtime_at_review': 3723, 'last_played': 1710015689}
review:
Pros-
Graphics are Good. Even though it came out in 2001.
Comes with Alot of maps and can be randomly generated too. Example (UK Map, World Map)
There is mods out for the game here is the link - https://www.civfanatics.com/civ3/downloads/
The price of the game is $5 which is pretty good asking price. 
There is an Editor so that you can create your own map or scenerio.

-Mixed (Depends on perspective.)
The turns are pretty long for me at late game if I play on Huge Map. It would take 30 seconds to minute to go through in later stages of the game.

When you download the game you have to manualy set the resolution in the files to 1080p  which would only take a minute. You can find a tutorial online.

The game is less complex compared to CIV 4 or CIV 5. For example you can't edit the details of your goverment like you can in CIV 4 and there is no religion system like civ 4.

Con-
Not really anything I can pinpoint right now.


My Recomendation- You should get if you want a simple turn based strategy game. It's only $5 USD. Also when the game goes on sale it would go down to around 2.50 to 3 dollar range.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015476421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2788, 'last_played': 1688835285}

author: {'steamid': '76561198047455553', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 2326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2313, 'last_played': 1385343582}
review: Civ 3 é um sólido jogo de estratégia em turnos. Foi a versão de Civ que mais joguei. Gosto da simplicidade da interface, conteúdo de sobra e gráficos 2D que considero melhor para representar o tabuleiro. Ainda existem as Conquests que são scenarios específicos em vários momentos de nossa história que é muito divertido de jogar.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990637751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 7101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2687, 'last_played': 1647026172}
review:
I played Civilization V and Civilization IV, but for some reason I keep getting back to Civilization III.
It is a masterpiece that stands the test of time. It is more realistic and fun with huge maps. No religion, but best Nuclear Weapons, artillery mechanic, interface is great for me and Civilopedia is the best out of all Civilizations for me. Clear and Plain to understand.
Easy game to play, yet it is harder to master.
Advisors and Leaders change clothes, depending on which era it is. Interface is more "realistic" looking and not too cartonish as the newer ones. Music is outstanding.
A lot is early on about how much you expand, but it is also much easier to get steam rolled by opponents if your cities are not defended. Sometimes less better cities is more productive and efficient. Maps play a big role, and the map editor is amazing.
Diplomacy I found the most realistic of all. World war scenario can happen very quick with mutual protections. 
Never attack anyone however with open borders, they will hate you pretty much forever, lol.
If you are not the leading in technology you can still sell them to the one that have none. If you have a technology noone has, sell it to everyone (Like worldmaps) in the same turn. Extra money is great.
Governments are a very good mechanic too. Made no sense to me Civilization IV Police State with free speech.

I recommend this game to all lovers of strategy, history and nostalgic gamers.

Edit. P.S. Ignore my steam play hours, I have probably more than a thousand.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036388574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3290, 'last_played': 1689380078}
review: I have far more hours than is visible on Steam, I would estimate over 1,000. This game was my jam as a child, and hooked me on civilization/city builder games. While it's not perfect (controls aren't as intuitive as the newer versions, and sometimes the RNG in combat seems quite off), it is a ton of fun. Between making your own modifications and various mods I obtained in the past, there is always a new game to play, or new strategy to try. With the Summer sale especially, I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972446074', 'num_games_owned': 1171, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 80016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3779, 'last_played': 1705730744}
review:
I have probably put more time into this game than any other in my life and can call Civ III one of my all-time favorite games.

Long before Steam was a thing when Civ III was new, I spent a lot of time just playing one more turn.

Although the newer Civ games are great (Civ V, VI), the third will always be a classic to me and the one that turned me into a loyal Civ fan.

The soundtrack for this game was amazing, especially the late game music. Although it sounds very dated now, it is very well done and brings back a lot of memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277508081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1498596397}
review:
2 thumbs up, WAY up! Graphics are becoming dated but the fun isnt. Be aware that you may see a sunrise or two due to the "just a few more turns dilemma"

I've bought this game exactly 4 times for myself. The first copy wandered off to a friend who never got around to returning it and after a while I realized I missed it too much as I walked past the"Gold" CD version that was on sale at my local Frys which was promptly purchased. On to copy number 2, Yay! I've played that for a good long time on both Windows and Linux but finally got tired of slapping in the CD every time I wanted to play for its antiquated copy protection. Along came a Steam sale and I said 'Hello' to copy number 3. This version is slightly different than my "Gold" version (d*mn volcanoes) but still enjoyable as ever. Finally, just like clockwork, right after I bought #3 ran across another sale on that other game site that doesnt have any silly DRM on it in the first place and I was the proud owner of copy number 4. 

Add this :
KeepRes=1
to its own line in your ini file "./Civilization III Complete/Conquests/conquests.ini" to get proper widescreen support (non 4:3 aspect). This line used to be in Civ3PTW.ini but apparently got moved to this file at a later version. Depending on the version you have, this might be somewhere else too....perhaps one more directory down at "./Civilization III Complete/Conquests/Conquests/conquests.ini"

For Linux, see WineHQ for more info on how to get the "squaking" bird sound to stop once it starts. The quick fix is to turn off those sounds in options but slightly less enjoyable as it removes all the environment sounds. The short of what the fix entails is you just have to replace the bird sound file with a silent version which is easy enough to craft using something like audacity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198245711240', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1561596048}
review:
This game is great, but not as great as Civ5. It has pretty dated graphics and the leader animations are just downright ugly by today's standards. Some of the features are a little dated, too, like building roads to increase gold output and, of course, insane unit stacks. The music for the game isn't bad by the high standards of Civ, except the opening track which is so annoying I have to mute my speakers whenever it plays. 
This game, despite some of its dated features, is still a heck of a lot of fun. I relish the dated graphics as a "retro" Civ experience from 2001, and even the constant road-building gives your workers something to do in the later game. The "city view," which disappeared in Civ4, is something that I definitely wish would've been continued, as well as the palace view. It's also nice to be able to pass through civ borders without permission like the city-state borders from civ5, although this will anger the offended nation. I got it for $1.75 on sale and considering that's it the complete edition, it's worth every penny. 
The game is fun, cheap, and has a healthy dose of retro/nostalgic feeling for those who have played the newer Civ games. Considering that you can get this for less than two dollars, I definitely recommend this purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049176302', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1661059043}
review:
Probably the single game I've spent the most time playing over the course of my entire life. It has always been my favorite Civ since it's the one I grew up with. The music in this game is a really high point for me; each era has its own unique soundtrack that's catchy and interesting. The scenarios from Conquest are all pretty fun.

Of course this game has a huge nostalgia factor for me, so it may not be as good to newer players, but it's a great lightweight, cheaper option for an old computer or someone who wants to try a new take on Civ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132835790', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 2290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2028, 'last_played': 1557302822}
review:
Отличная и интересная игра, крайне продуманна, но в тоже время сложна.

Могу с лёгкостью сказать, что она является шедевром в своем роде. Очень сильно ощущаются различия третьей части, от пятой в плане геймплея. Сам же геймплей более продуман и похож на симулятор.

Развиваться в научном направлении довольно трудно, ведь всегда будет то государство, которое более технически развито, чем ты! ИИ очень любит строить много городов, застроить весть континент/остров просто нельзя успеть!

Одним словом, эта игра действительно вошла в историю геймдева. :)

PS: Как я люблю эту игру!

author: {'steamid': '76561198162485404', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2472, 'last_played': 1687505200}
review:
This is really a fantastic game for $5.  Tons of strategy, tons of replayability, tons of content, and a GREAT soundtrack.   

This may have been released 16 years ago but I can still play it and it feels just as fun as any other strategy game I've ever played if not more.  This game stood the test of time and it's a great buy if you're looking for a cheap strategy game that can run with the best in terms of gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072076329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3607, 'last_played': 1495134441}
review:
Why, oh why did they have to stick to this stupid isometric view like in C2? What was wrong with clarity of top-down view from C1?

I guess in attempt to make the map look more realistic shape of the land is blurred so much, that it's hard to see where it actually ends. The result is quite opposite than desired, and you can't easily tell what kind of terrain is there, what would the city be covering exactly, etc. Horrible! Mountains look artificial as hell, as well ;) or, no - most of the map looks artificial and flat.
Had to play with the grid visible most of the time, otherwise couldn't see shit. Didn't get used to the grid so switched it off from time to time... and again couldn't see crap.

Other than that, it is quite good Civ game and feels like much refined C2. I liked the concept of visible and expanding borders, rather disliked the idea of culture as a winning factor (yeah right, like this could happen in this dimension), loved the concept of strategic resources and linking cities by roads/harbors/airport to use them. C3 has a good "just one more turn" factor too... but too bad you can't see shit most of the time.

Disliked because you have to choose thumb up or down. Otherwise I would rate 4/10. Not a waste of money definitely, but it doesn't have that magic and simplicity of classic C1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198498504005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 7318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6738, 'last_played': 1524856409}
review:
Без сомнения, "Sid Meiers Civilization 3"- одна из самых удивительных игр, в которые мне доводилось играть. Я услышал о ней из многочисленных воспоминаний олдфагов в Интернете, которые с ностальгической слезой вспоминали те дни, когда сами во всю рубились в эту классику игровой индустрии. Кто-то подумает, что раз игра считается классикой, то в ней уже не может быть недостатков, ибо разве можно не рекоммендовать признанную многими игроками игру, в которую некоторые геймеры играют до сих пор? А вот как-бы не так, классика классике рознь. Одно дело играть в игру, которая, не смотря на свой внушительный возраст, может удивить игрока потрясающим сюжетом, атмосферой, геймплеем, балансом, а другое дело- играть в устаревший кусок програмного кода, который когда-то потряс игровую индустрию своей инновационностью, но сейчас не представляет никакого интереса. И сейчас я собираюсь выяснить, к какой категории отнести Цивилизацию 3.
Я не зря сказал, что Цива 3- одна из самых странных игр, в которые я играл. По отношению к этой игре я испытал 4 стадии чувств. Сперва я был заинтригован и, признаюсь, растерян, ибо я не мог привыкнуть к изометрической камере, 2-д графике, интерфейсу, который отличался от того, что я видел в 5-й части и к абсолютно новым стратегиям победы (например, ты здесь должен ставить как можно больше городов для победы, при этом ты не получаешь никаких штрафов за это, а победить с одним или двумя городами нельзя). Потом меня действительно затянуло, и следующие 15-18 часов я провел с удовольствием, я действительно вжился в роль российского царя, османского султана или генерального секретаря компартии Китая, строил свою империю (и в этом также огромный плюс игры, в ней можно создать любое государство, от абсолютистского Вавилона, который в XXI веке покоряет космос до коммунистической Турции), изучал новые технологии, формы правления (в отличии от Цивы 5 тут присутствуют не 3 идеологии, а формы правления (от деспотизма и монархии до коммунизма и демократии), каждая из которых дает определенные бонусы и штрафы, а чтобы сменить формы правления, нужно устроить революцию). Позже я начал ненавидеть эту игру (особенно выбесила долбанутая боевая система, когда ты добиваешь ослабленного, еле живого вражеского юнита своим прокачанным юнитом, а тот берет и убивает твоего юнита с полным хп (а эти очки здоровья еще так медленно убывают, неясно нахрена сделали эту медленную анимацию, если сваливать с боя при проигрыше могут только конные войска (может я некоторые виды войск новейшего времени не открыл, поэтому прям каждого юнита не знаю), а остальные юниты сражаются до самой смерти), и ,кроме того, еще и прокачивается до ветерана и восстанавливает себе часть очков здоровья, да, и в пятой части была доля рандома, были нелогичности, когда галера топила подлодку, но чтобы юнит после боя лечился, когда он должен был быть ослабленным?!), а потом настала 4-я стадия- уныние. Когда я играл за Китай, я отыгрывал миллитаристическую страну, но я воевал только с двумя странами, одну из которых я благополучно уничтожил, а у второй отобрал один город на побережье, с другими странами старался вести дипломатические отношения. Когда я объявил войну цивилизации Майя, те сразу умудрились две другие страны сделать своими союзниками, а остальные государства просто решили за компанию ополчиться против меня, а у меня в тот момент в государстве была анархия, менялась форма правления, было два восстания. В итоге я за 2  хода потерял 3 города, потому что Майя спамили как ненормальные кавалерией, к ним подключилась англия, которая атаковала с моря, ну и Авраам Линкольн благополучно стыбзил мой город. Результат- тотальный проигрыш, ибо как только я добивался аудиенции хоть с одной нацией за большие деньги, эту самую нацию брала в союзники враждующая со мной сторона, и я вновь оставался с носом.
Подведу итог: Цивилизация 3- самая неоднозначная игра, в которую я играл.То она тебя радует, то ты ее ненавидишь всеми силами своей души. Поставлю "Рекомендую", ведь игра, все-таки, затянула и подарила немало положительных эмоций. Если хотите ознакомится с классическим геймплеем старых Цивилизаций, эта часть- ваш выбор. Но предупреждаю- она очень сложна.

review: This is the best Civilization game on the market, and by far the cheapest. The game isn't cartoony at all with its graphics, and is very easy to understand and progress. There are many different styles to play and win, as most Civilization games do have, but the newer games in the series don't handle this as well with the number of errors and bugs they have in their games, as well as the lack of quality that Civilization III has. This game is a must-own for all strategy gamers, no question about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022107013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1348, 'last_played': 1494537556}
review:
Civilization 4 had the best modability features. Civilization 5 was the most expansive all in all to the entire Civilzation series. Civilization 6 looks promising, but it has a ways to go before it's fully expanded (which I don't think all the whining over is warranted. Civ 5 came out in 2010, Gods and Kings came out in 2012, and Brave New World came out in 2013).

But Civilization 3 is probably my favorite out of the series because of how succinct the gameplay is. The userface for each aspect is neat, tidy, and fits in only a few UI pages. It's the way Civilization was meant to be played, IMO: a neat board game too expansive to be Settlers of Catan. I would highly reccomend to anyone who enjoys the Civ series.

review: This is arguably still the best CIv Game. I think Civ 2 seemed to be really good when I tried it but since I haven't played that more than 2 hours I will let you decide if you think Civ 2 is better or not. Anyways Civ 3 has AI which can actually wipe you out and you have to keep trading with the AI constantly on higher difficulty levels to be up to date with the latest technologies. I give this game a solid 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198089930432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 12149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6050, 'last_played': 1622593751}
review:
I bought Civ III from the grocery store. It was in some 10 dollar PC game dump, and I saw the holy grail standing out. I picked it out and never saw anything like it. Had to beg my mom for it. That was 2004. Played it for years off and on, trying to learn everything about Civ III will drive you mad. Little did I know there was a complete edition with so much more content. 


Civ III Complete is the best Civ game. The game concepts are way ahead of it's time, and the way you have to manage you're Civ matters more than any soldier. Just opening the game and reading the Civ-pedia will leave you speechless with history lessons. I learned alot just by reading in-game. 

If you love prior Civ games before III, I reccomend you pick up this game and enjoy the good old days of Civ. This is the high point in Civ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004011207', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 803, 'last_played': 1580878755}
review:
When they rebuilt this game for use on modern computers, they -must- have adjusted the code in other ways as well.
There is no other reason why, on the second easiest difficulty, I have lost 28 games in a row due to the AI having massive troops, every Wonder, hordes of cities, and all this faster than I can build, no matter what I focus on.

If I try for city sprawl, the AI builds them faster than I do, and still somehow has enough time to also field a more advanced army because it's tech is better.
If I try for tech, the AI outruns me due to having many more cities feeding it's research.
If I go for military, the AI again has better tech, and more cities feeding the military.

Playing this feels a lot like the original Reach For The Stars game, where the developers outright state the game cheats in it's own favor.

I own the disks for the original game.  I used to play this, and beat it, on much harder difficulties all the time.
I refuse to believe the transition to new computers is responsible for the stupidly hard difficulty by itself.  Not on a turn based game.   Ergo, someone screwed with the code and refuses to admit it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090113572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2517, 'last_played': 1518476219}

Like all 4x games this is more addicting then it has a right to be. Playing my first game right now but was getting tired so I figured I would check the time because I didn't want to be up too late (past 10p), figured it might be 11-12 considering how tired I was. 4:30am lol... It's 6:30 now, looks like I am committed to an all nighter... oh well...

Just one more turn...*

*50 turns ago

author: {'steamid': '76561198151432613', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1618484672}
review: Her civilization oyununu çıktığı ilk oyundan itibaren keyifle oynadım. Her yeni versiyonda büyük gelişmeler göstererek bizleri mest etti. Grafiklerin geliştirildiği bu versiyonda ayrıca ünitelere tecrübe kazanarak güçlenme ve daha sonra general ile birkaç elit üniteyi birleştirerek güçlü ordular yapmanıza olanak sağlanıyor. Ayrıca ilk defa muhteşem insanlar karşımıza çıkıyor ve uygarlığımız geliştikçe kendi sarayımızı da geliştiriyoruz. Tek üzüldüğüm eksik wonder yaptıktan sonra gelen kısa film kaldırılmış. Defalarca oynayıp bitirdiğim ve hala oynadığım bu oyun her türlü övgüyü hakediyor...

author: {'steamid': '76561197987084977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1985, 'last_played': 1493101612}
review:
-America keeps getting angry because my workers are entering their land while building roads.
-America says they must leave or risk war.
-Declare war.
-Destroy all but 3 of their cities.
-Offer peace in exchange for all the gold in their treasury and New Orleans.
-They accept.
-Peace.
-2 turns later capture their second-last city.
-Offer peace in exchange for all their gold.
-They accept.
-Need 2% more land to secure domination victory.
-My mechanized infantry roll into Atlanta and are greeted by Spearmen and Archers.
10/10 would be bully again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140999820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 958, 'last_played': 1491042238}
review:
Lo compré en un Bundle que incluía también el Civ IV y el V al completo. Aún no me ha dado tiempo a probar los otros dos, porque quise empezar con éste y de momento no puedo dejarlo ;)
Pura esencia "Civilitation". Pese a que técnicamente acusa su antigüedad, el tiempo se te pasa tan rápido como con las demás versiones y las ganas de seguir "un turno más" son las mismas.
Lo ejecuto desde Windows 10 y funciona aceptablemente; la cámara tal vez se mueve un poco rápido cuando es el turno de la I.A. y no te dejar ver qué acontecimientos están sucediendo si no estás muy atento; supongo que los equipos actuales van muy sobrados y por eso se produce esta circunstancia. Hay que tener cuidado porque una vez comience la secuencia de introducción no hay que pulsar ninguna tecla para saltártela porque entonces el juego se bloquea. Si quieres saltarla, hay que hacerlo en cuanto aparece el logo de "2K" y entraremos en el menú principal sin problemas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030851403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1862, 'last_played': 1704223207}
review:
Jeżeli nie grałeś/ grałaś to najwyższy czas to zrobić. 

Moim zdaniem Civ 3 należy sposobem gry do jej poprzedniczek czyli Civ 1 i 2. 

Grafika została jak na tamte czasy bardzo poprawiona. Jak się wtedy ją włączyło było wow, ale pięknie. Teraz jest trochę inaczej...

Wprowadzono po raz pierwszy granice kulturowe, co było wtedy dużą innowacją. 

Rozbudowano system walki dodając hit points. 

Urozmaicono zadowolenie społeczne po przez wprowadzenie surowców luksusowych.

Ogólnie wprowadzono dużo udoskonaleń, mimo tego gra pozostała wierna podstawowym założeniom cywilizacji.

Polecam zagrać szczególnie młodszym entuzjastom gatunku w celu poznania historii tej fantastycznej serii gier.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995714610', 'num_games_owned': 1278, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1532585983}
review:
Having been a Civilization player since Civnet (yes I am old) this game was a surprise to me when it was first released by infogames in 2000 mind you we had just seen a year of 3 civ games due to legal work arounds etc etc. those being Civilization: call to power (Don't recommend at all) Civilization II Test of Time (pretty much a upped graphics version of Sid Meier's Civilization II with additional scenarios which I still recommend) and Sid Meier's Alpha Centari (AMAZING GAME)

but back to CIv III. The game was a nice upping the ante of Civ II and hitting all of its marks it aimed for including its amazing play the world expansion which allowed a relatively stable way to play multiplayer that CivNet tried and failed to do and Civilization II attempted with its Multiplayer gold expansion)

While I have poured countless hours in to my Disk copy I haven't really touched it since mid way through the life span of Civ IV. but I do still get requests to play multiplayer so it still does have a decent following.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198073396275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 24691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17033, 'last_played': 1547239103}
review:
The game is great itself, but there are couple of flaws, that spoil the pleasure:
- random civilization pick always take same seed, as a result you always have same set of civs
- sounds are bugged
- some buldings does not shown on city view
I contacted tech support, and they told, that will not spend time on this game.
This is no surprise, as it is old.
Still, I spent a lot of hours in this game and enjoyed it a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035477363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1515816927}
review:
Like every Civ , Civ III is easy to start playing, surprisingly deep, full of interesting choices, and creates a feeling of wanting to play just one more turn that makes it hard to stop! Though Civ III's age shows in its graphics and interface, the gameplay feels timeless. Civ III also stands apart from other versions of Civ.  I played countless hours of the base Civ III game many years ago, and even after playing the quite different games Civ 4, 5, and 6, Civ 3 keeps its addictive allure.  

Community mods also make Civ III an even better value. 

Civ III also runs on almost any computer, so It's a great game for a low powered laptop or tablet.

review:
Firaxis certainly tried their best to make every title in their series feel unique. In fact, this is probably the oldest Civ that aged well, and does not require you actually being around, when it was the most recent, to enjoy it. Also noticeably more monotonous than successors.

Civ3 is good, yada yada, game of my childhood, yada yada, but buy only if Civ5 and 4 are not for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147515986', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1576466614}
review:
Where do I begin? Civilization III is in my opinion, the last, true civ game. Yes I know there are many more sequels, but from civ 4 onwards, the game begins to turn into a strategy game of sorts. It is Civ 1-3 that TRULY give you the feeling of an emperor over a fledling empire. 

This game is not to be missed out on if you are a fan of the Civilization franchize, especially if you want to go back to one of the classics. Civ 5 & 6 are really good in my opinion, but Civ 3 REALLY TRULY steals the show.

For less than what a coffee at starbucks costs, GO BUY IT ALREADY!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198111277333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1487875818}
review:
Originally I had some crashes with this game version (Steam), but managed to fix it. The info is at the end of the review. Civilization III Complete was one of the games I spent the most time with, and really enjoyed it. For me, it's easily one of the best 4X games ever made (at least in the time I type it).

If you did not play Civilization 3 in the past and are wondering if you should buy it - below is some basic info that should encourage you to do that.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
The pluses:

+ Lots of civilizations, each plays differently

+ Lots of different units + special military unit for each civilization

+ The AI scripts are demanding (unlike in most modern games)

+ Resources on map force you to play strategically

+ Depending on the size and type of the maps, games might differ quite a lot

+ You can play in really big maps

+ The game has fine mods that you can find on the internet

+ It's hard to stop playing it

------------------------------------------------------
The minuses:
- It's hard to stop playing it

- At higher difficulties the military victory is the most viable option (only)

- When you control most of the map it's just boring killing of the remaining weaklings

- At the industrial age, you probably control most of the map

- At higher difficulties AI is cheating

- Civilizations are not balanced (some are really good, some - really bad)

- After you learn to use workers and diplomacy, it's not that hard (but still fun)

- Old 2D game, so in native desktop resolution units and fonts might be too small

- Old 2D game, so in native game resolution units might be too big (and no widescreen)

======================================

For native desktop resolution in game:

1. Go to the Conquests folder in your Civ 3 folder conquests.ini
2. Put "keepRes=1" in conquests.ini file (without "")

======================================

Those settings should fix crashes in Windows 7 64 bit.

1. Go to the Conquests folder in your Civ 3 folder
2. Rename LSANS.FOT to -LSANS.FOT

If that does not help:
Set Windows compatibility to Windows XP Service Pack 2 and run program as administrator.

If the game runs too slow delete keepRes=1 from ini file (in Windows XP mode the game is slower)

======================================

That's it. You can now go buy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051428193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 773, 'last_played': 1600821945}
review: An extremely deep experience that may put off fans of the new games. This game requires a great knowledge of strategy, and the techniques to properly build your civilization into a prospering empire. Still one of the best in genre, and a must play for fans of any type of Civ game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198105143643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1579182236}
review:
从多年前的一份盗版开始接触文明3开始，我就中了文明系列的毒。九鼎国马兵横扫世界给我带来了第一场胜利，国王级。然后去文明三吧看战报，自己摸索，发现了越来越大的世界。虽然至今不敢挑战sid级。( ╯□╰ )盗版里的游戏时间大概有几千小时了，毕业之后就静不下心重开一局了吧。比起五代、六代优良的画面，丰富的内容，我有时候还是更喜欢文明3庞大的军队数量之间进行较量。
    三代的奇观大多性价比优良，大图、大金、大庙、孙子兵法、长城、达芬奇还有沿海的巨人像、需象牙的宙斯，随便抢到一两个都能大幅提升国立。尤其宙斯，加一血的远古骑兵322，变态啊，还五回合一个，在它持续的时间里下几个国都不是问题。类似的十字军就鸡肋了。
       如果是文明系列的粉的话，我还是很推荐试一试三代的，能体会到很不一样的感觉。[spoiler] 毕竟我觉得六代和五代换汤不换药呢	[/spoiler]
