author: {'steamid': '76561198297458116', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5404, 'last_played': 1546670510}
review:
Muy bueno juego, sencillo en cuanto mecánicas (o eso pienso yo) con un único defecto a remarcar, la IA es nefasta, no podés poner la dificultad mas allá de Caudillo por el simple hecho de que la IA es muy agresiva y hace un rush de ciudades impresionante (siendo que en dificultades inferiores también ocurre), basta con dejar un hueco entre tus fronteras para que venga un colono de otra civilización a plantarte una ciudad. Es molesto, sí, pero no saca el hecho de que es buen juego, cumple con lo que promete y es entretenido. 

PD: No pienses que le vayas a ganar a un arquero con un moquetero (por dar un ejemplo xD), que por mas que el mosquetero tenga pólvora y el arquero una simple flecha, ESTO ES CIVILIZATION Y NADA TIENE SENTIDO, ¿QUÉ ESPERABAS?, ¿QUE LA TECNOLOGÍA MAS MODERNA PODRÍA GANARLE A LA MAS PRIMITIVA? JÁ, POBRE INGENUO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108235797', 'num_games_owned': 4056, 'num_reviews': 550, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1501694875}
review:
Don't understand what people are whining about.
Of course this game is old, so what? Old is gold (generally, not always, but certainly most of the time).
Would I say that it is better than Civilization V? Yes and no, both has their forces and their weakness and I am certainly not talking about the graphics because I do love the graphics in this game, call me crazy, I prefer the graphics you find in this game than those in Civilization V, it's simple but beautiful, old school some would say.

In my opinion, Sid Meier's Alpha Centauri, Civization III and Civilization IV are the best in the Civilization series.
Then you have Civilization V and Civilization II.

Beyond Earth isn't that good, far too little content.


If you love Civilization but haven't played this one, you'll probably love it!
If you're looking for a fantasy civilization then you should give a look at Warlock and Eador which are the closer ones to this series, there are some other such as Age of Wonders but it has its differences, lot of them.

9.2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198030968405', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1485634861}
review:
While I do recommend this game, be aware there's a bug that disables you to choose another game limit when starting a new game. This means you're stuck with the default 540 turns limit, which is really annoying. I'm guessing this is a Steam-related bug which I found articles about in the forum dating back to 2010. Clearly, it was never fixed.
Real shame... it is a good game despite its age.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132557116', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1484968879}
review: I'm sorry, but the game is way too buggy, and super slow when playing with others. I was in a multiplayer game with one other person, and we only got to 640 AD after playing for 3 hours straight. Also, as I retired in anger, the game crashed as I tried to close it. Also, unit stacking is possibly the worst feature the Civ series has ever had. You order your units to move, and they move one... by one... by one... until you are in your coffin, 600 years later, and you finally get that last spearman over. Speaking of units, these cities keep on making military units, past your limit, and you are soon in civil disorder because of money. Money should never be a problem in a Civ game, ever! I'd hate to give this game a bad review, as Civilization is one of my favorite game series(es?) of all time. Please, save your five dollars and use it on something else. May I suggest: save 25 more of those dollars for Civ 5? Or, you know, any other game?

review:
Recommended because it's so cheap. Yeah, the game's old and flawed (and not totally stable), but it's still good fun as well. Even if you only play through a few games, at this price it's still worth it. Go ahead and give it a shot.

The one exception to this would be if you're used to playing Civ 4, in which case the issues from this game that that one fixed might be too frustrating for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153166666', 'num_games_owned': 705, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 84, 'playtime_at_review': 1608, 'last_played': 1709797937}
review: What can i say about this version of Civilization? I've played Civ 5 - Brave New World for possibly thousands of hours, and i still go back to Civ 3, another game i've probably played for thousands of hours. Still highly addictive, incredibly difficult and a lot of fun. Very crude, in relation to the newer iterations of the game, but also, stripped from bullsh*t like annoying audio readings ("The meek shall inherit the earth but not it's mineral rights" - yes, i've heard you before! - and what does that even mean?!). You still get a sense of a fully realized game by the end of each game, as is the same with other iterations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014163253', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1484172745}
review:
[u][b]-Quick Review-[/b][/u]
Sid Meier's Civilization III Complete is a turn based strategy game developed by Firaxis Games and released Oct 30, 2001.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=839645517

[u][b]-Detailed breakdown review-[/b][/u]
[b]Story:[/b] The "Story" is more so in the individual experience you have playing these types of games. You're put into a random world with random NPC's (unless you try to determine the world and nations by selecting them...) the key defining elements are how you interact with the game's NPC's.

My personal story is I kept to myself, and then people started threatening me, and I'm not going to take any of that from easy difficulty NPC's, so they declared war on me and I fought them until the game ended. [i](Maybe this is why other Nations always think I'm a war monger... but I swear the other guys almost always starts it! ..I just finish it.)[/i]

[b]Gameplay:[/b] I've played Civilization Call to power, and I've played Civilization 4... Civilization 3 is different then both, but difficult to articulate how it's different... the game feels slower paced, I can't wage war as effectively by bombardment as I can in civ call to power or civ4.
The game just hasn't clicked with me in the way Civ5 did immediately. the User interface has a serious case of the 2000's [i](by that, I mean overly complicated, overly difficult, rather confusing.)[/i]

There are scenarios and tons of special mod or DLC packs which are included in Civ3. If you're looking to burn some time playing a strategy game, Civilization 3 can easily eat up that time with the crazy amounts of content it has.

[b]Conclusion:[/b] The dilemma I have with Civ3, is that I prefer Civ5, and Civ call to power... but that doesn't mean Civ3 is bad... it's quite good and chalk full of content. Especially for the low price... But while playing I just find myself thinking "man, I'd rather be playing Civ5".

I think it's nice to have Civ3 as a backup for my laptop when I'm on trips, or for a new/old challenge. [i](It's a new challenge because I haven't played it as much, but it's an older game... BAH, don't think about it)[/i]

review:
[h1]DO YOU WANT [b][u]HIGHER RES[/u][/b]??? I FOUND A SOLUTION.[/h1]

Step 1: Go to Steam\steamapps\common\sid meier's civilization iii complete\Conquests\conquests.ini

Step 2: Add "KeepRes=1" without quotes, then save

Step 3: Hit play

[url=http://forums.steampowered.com/forums/showthread.php?t=885318]Source (Steam Users' Forums)[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198271451378', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1462328426}
review:
My first Sid Meier game honestly and I must say it's actually really fun. 

Now, it didn't run perfectly on my computer, not entirely sure why as everytime I attacked, I COULDN'T SEE THE FIGHT MY COMPUTER JUST FROZE FOR TEN SECONDS AND THEN IT WAS OVER... but I digress, I got over that pretty quick and there was still a lot to do. So much land to conquer and claim as my own. 

A classic, what can I really say that's different from what most have already stated?

Fan of the Civ games? Try it. 

New to the name Sid Meier? Try it. 

Want to conquer the world? Try it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993927989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2907, 'last_played': 1692676733}
review:
Before I got this game on steam, I played it for 100s of more hours.  It's one of the best Civ games.

Basically Civ 1 done right with better graphics.  Civ 2 was messed with.  Civ IV while good lost most of the strategy that was in Civ III.  Civ V is just bad:  No unit stacking, no city view, no love.  I haven't played VI yet, so I would say Civ 3 is either the best Civ game or the 2nd best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114186986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1483112318}
review:
Want to change history, dominate the World, rule as a dictator and have fun while while doing so. Than this is your game. Sid meier's Civilization iii offers players variety of choices to shape customise and dominate all other civlizations through out the game. A worthy sequel to the original civilization games, the makers of this game has outdone themselves. 

The game has no rigidiry of storyline as mentioned, there is an innovative tech tree which makes sense, there are plenty of civilizations to choose from, whats more is that the Worlds are randomly procedurally generated. Every time you do some thing worth while within the game you get to create an improvetment to your palace. Which is also neat.

To be faor there are many positives to this game and relatively no negetives. But to name a few:-

Positives

1.The game is easy on the pockets
2.The game can be played by players of any age
3.The game has a neat set of ingame rewards which makes playing it worthwhile

Negetives

1. The game ends abruptly after reaching a certain technology

All in all the game for presentabiltys sake is 7/10. A ghreat game for the entire family to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198231878676', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 48427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1048, 'playtime_at_review': 9208, 'last_played': 1710855942}
review:
Civilization III ist ein zeitloser Klassiker der Strategiespiele. Noch heute ist er vollkommen gut spielbar und bringt viele Stunden Spielspass.

Pros:
-Map Editor enthalten
-Spionage
-Stadtmanagement
-gute Grafik
-Szenarios
-viele verschiedene Zivilisationen und Einheiten
-Technologiebaum
-gute Grafik (isometrisch)
Contras:
-seltene Bugs mit der Spielmusik
-Abstürze (1 mal in 50 Stunden)
-teils langweiliger Spielstart (in der Antike)

author: {'steamid': '76561198028643519', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1495232694}
review: So first off I'm going to start by saying even though it might show about an hour or so of playtime it does not mean I have not played this game before. I first came across this game at GameStop and I really hadn't played any games since I was young. But I needed a past time because I was dying of boredom being at home laid up in bed unable to do much. I had severely injured my back and I wasn't going to work anytime soon and the depression started to kick in. So anyways by now the game had been out for about 3 years and it looked interesting so I bought it. Went home and started playing it and it was my first time playing a strategy game so I didn't even know if I was going to like it. I started playing around lunch time by the time I know it was dinner time so took 10 minutes got my food and came back and ate while I played. By the time I knew it was freaking 6am the next day! I had never had lost track of time by that much, but man was I enjoying the game. I thought the graphics were pretty decent, the game play was very good and the UI was also good. Of course it was the first time I've had played a game with an in game Civilopedia and I thought that was awesome. The other thing I miss from Civilization III that has not been added to any other Civilization since is building your capital building when your citizens were happy you were able to add one section at a time until you finished upgrading your building. I thought that was fun, even though it was a very simple and quick thing. By the time Civilization IV came out I had around 3500 hours invested in this game and I still have the original disk I bought, but I went ahead and bought it on Steam because they had a very good deal on Civ III, IV and Colonization which I already have the other two also. But I want to keep those disks from getting any damage and besides Steam keeps a running track of your gaming time. So I can safely say this game is what got me back into gaming and becoming a full time gamer. I DO RECOMMEND THIS GAME, EVEN THOUGH IT'S AN OLDER GAME. Keep gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020972314', 'num_games_owned': 869, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 4421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3822, 'last_played': 1616311110}
review:
Civilization has been one of the main cornerstones of the 4X genre since its first entry in the 90s. I grew up playing tons of Civilization II until my brother got a copy of Civilization III for Christmas, and I've loved it ever since.

PROS:
+Grand strategy based on ruling an empire and balancing multiple facets including your militaristic, economic, industrial, scientific, and diplomatic agendas.
+Impressive number of Civilizations to play as (over 30), each with its own advantages and disadvantages.
+Despite the number of potential Civilizations, each plays with its own distinctive style.
+More peaceful options to win than spaceship-building.
+Numerous scenarios (or Conquests) including WWII in the Pacific, Sengoku-era Japan, Pre- and Post-Columbus America, and the Rise and Fall of the Roman Empire.
+Abnormally good soundtrack.
+Difficult to master, like many good strategy games.
+Introduces new game mechanics over its predacessor like war weariness, forced labor, and corruption.
+Included is a Scenario-maker, which is very comprehensive and allows for the addition of entirely-new civilizations, technologies, and maps.
+There's many of the popular fan-made maps and scenarios already installed with the game.
+Mods! (on CivFanatics)

CONS:
-Loses some of the character from Civilization II (such as wonder movies, animated high councils, and "Our words are backed with NUCLEAR WEAPONS!")
-Doesn't run as well on modern machines. I've had game crashes on the Victory Screen, but I've heard of people not even being able to start the game.
-Tutorial hints hidden in the Preferences menu, so unless you've played Civilization II or IV, this one's pretty hard to learn. Other Civilizations (including this game's direct predacessor) automatically turned on the hints if played on the lowest difficulty, or had menus for learning the game.

Personally, it's my favorite of the grid-based Civilizations, and I always come back for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254332308', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3348, 'last_played': 1528859653}
review:
All right. I got this game from a friend sometime around 2012, I think. I played it for a bit but honestly, I had trouble getting into it. A lot had changed from Civilization II and I never really caught on to all the differences.

Picked it up during the Steam Black Friday sale on Thanksgiving. I gave it a whirl. At first, I had the same feelings I did last time I played all those years ago. It wasn't CivII, and the strategies that worked for me then were failing me now. It didn't help that there wasn't a tutorial or a manual of any kind, and the Civilopedia is not the most user-friendly interface, although it's critical to understanding all of the game mechanics the AI employs.

I played on Chieftain for a while, just trying to get a handle on the game mechanics, but now I'm bored of chieftain. Too easy. Once you learn and begin to understand the game mechanics, this is a pretty great game. That said, it's virtually impossible to win if you don't constantly expand and build one city after another. I mean, that is all you will do. Build and build and build. If you don't, the AI will and you'll lose. Pretty much the only way to win is to begin building a ton of cities in the early parts of the game.

I did like the implementation of cultural borders, and how borders clash against one another. The cultural conversion tool was also pretty cool, where cities could rebel and join your forces because they realized that their own culture was lifeless. So it's a pretty good game, and definitely worth the price for my 46 hours (and growing).

I do have to say, though, that a couple of the leader choices are really dumb. Mahatma Gandhi was not a leader of the Indian nation. Although he championed the move for India's independence, making him the face of India is weird, because he was a guru and not a general. And Jeanne d'Arc leading the French? She was a teenager and a peasant who, by her own confession, never even used her sword in combat. They could have chosen Charlemagne or Napoleon Bonaparte, but Joan! Kinda silly!

author: {'steamid': '76561198286549399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1503275893}
review:
Still as good of a game as I remember it from my childhood, it's age shows a little, but for $5 (and potentially even less) it still provides that "one more turn" mentality. I probably sunk at least 200 hours into my local libraries copy, so when I saw it was on steam, it was a no brainer purchase.

Having played Civ 5, I have to say that the portraits of the rulers convey far more emotion, at least in my eyes, than the full set pieces of Civ 5. The barbarians have multiple AI options and can be absolutly brutal. Certain civilzations have certain traits which affect what actions trigger golden ages. You get to upgrade your palace in a way that actually changes the way it looks on the city screen. Also there is a city screen where you get a detailed overview of your city and all the wonders you built. As opposed to Civ 5's jam packed 3D model of your city.

Age helps, in a way, since with todays operating systems the turns are lightning fast, even with troop movement.

I know I have my nostagia blinders on, but I really like this game, despite whatever flaws I cannot see. I suspect that anyone who likes these kinds of games and doesn't mind the lack of 4k graphics, will definitely get their money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031428115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1511660133}
review:
English/Português:

English: Great Game. Atemporal! working now in STEAM

Em Português a coisa fica mais ou menos assim:

Escrevendo por conta da promoção do STEAM, de precisar fazer uma análise de um jogo que tenha sido indicado. Esse é o meu indicado na categoria ATEMPORAL.

Eu conheci o Civilization no 2, então a chegada do Civ III foi realmente um marco na minha vida gamer. Eu gosto tanto desse jogo que tenho uma versão dele na caixa ainda lacrada, guardado mesmo só pra guardar. Pena que a versão do STEAM não esteja funcionando direito.

Hoje a franquia tem uma mecânica bem diferente, existe uma necessidade constante por atualizações e mudanças na jogabilidade, inclusive muita coisa mudou pra pior ou mudou sem precisar mudar, mas esse aqui e o Civ II ainda são imbatíveis na minha opinião.

Edição feita pra promoção em 2017 (editada em 2018). O jogo não funcionava, estava bugado, agora não está mais!

review:
Il tipico gioco della mia infanzia che non smetterei mai di giocare per nessuna ragione al mondo. Longevo, difficile da considerarsi ripetitivo, molto molto bello. A mio parere il migliore della saga, però ammetto di non potere essere particolarmente oggettivo dato che sono legato a Civ 3 da molto tempo e che apprezzo personalmente molto di più la relativa semplicità di giochi come questo piuttosto che la maggiore complessità ed aggiunta di dettagli dei Civilization 5 e 6, per esempio.
Edit: passano gli anni, si accumulano centinaia di ore di gioco e il sentimento non può che intensificarsi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034329440', 'num_games_owned': 688, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 836, 'last_played': 1692925012}
review: My hours played do not reflect my time on this game, because I had it long, long before it was out on Steam.  What game could better deserve the 'Test of Time' award (except, perhaps, Civ 2: Test of Time, but that's not on Steam).  Civ 3 has a timeless appeal that will bring old players back, and give new players (who, perhaps, have played a more recent Civ) a look at the glorious history of the series.  The beginnings of National Wonders, the Worker/Settler split, rivers on tile borders, rather than on tiles.  All these and more began with Civ 3.

review:
This incarnation of the Civ series has just the right level of complexity and it's so easy to mod pretty much any aspect of the game. It's the one I keep coming back to.

I have spent so many hundreds more hours on this game than my playtime would suggest, this Steam version being the third time I have installed it.

You'll need to spend a little effort getting it to display in a modern resolution, but it's totally worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076803073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 20416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19972, 'last_played': 1558720275}
review:
Sid Meier´s Civilization III Complete je ťahová stratégia a môžete ju považovať za klasiku. V nastavení pre jedného hráča máte možnosť vybrať si z viacerých národov s rôznymi charakteristikami a nastaviť si obtiažnosť, ktorá robí z každej hry novú výzvu. Okrem toho môžete  využiť hru pre viacej hráčov a aj samostatné scenáre skrz epochy ľudstva. Síce si s Windows-om 10 nie úplne rozumie a má zo pár chýb nezabráni Vám to užiť si zážitok z hrania. Aj napriek tomu, že má už pár rokov môžete pri nej stráviť veľa času a neomrzí Vás hrať ju znova a znova. To je aj dôvod prečo som ju nominoval v kategórii „ZKOUŠKA ČASU“. 
Môj názor sa nezmenil a preto som aj tento rok nominoval túto hru a to do kategórie ZKOUŠKA ČASU.
Aj tento rok som sa rozhodol nominovať túto hru v kategórii "NESMRTELNA HRA".

author: {'steamid': '76561197966607956', 'num_games_owned': 960, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 152104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123945, 'last_played': 1492724950}
review: Como seria o mundo se a civilização romana não tivesse declinado em 476 d.c.? Ou se o Império de Alexandre, o Grande tivesse sobrevivido a sua morte? Ou se os Ingleses ou Franceses tivessem descoberto as Américas? Você pode tirar essas dúvidas e fazer com que isso aconteça em Sid Meier's Civilization® III Complete, um jogo que lhe dá a oportunidade de tornar o mundo do jeito que você achar melhor. Iniciando na pré-história você irá contruir uma civilização que deve sobreviver a todas as adversidades e inimigos, fazer alianças com outras civilizações, trabalhar a terra, negociar os recursos naturais, fazer acordos diplomáticos, escapar da fúria da natureza (o jogo tem vulcões que entram em erupção de tempos em tempos e que podem destruir as suas cidades). É preciso criar melhorias para as cidades e unidades para defendê-las de bárbaros cruéis que assolam as regiões despovoadas e que vêm até suas cidades para saqueá-las e provocar o caos. Atacar as outras civilizações proporcionará ganhos extraordinários ou levará ao colapso da sua própria. O jogo lhe proporciona a chance de ser um líder que deve decidir a cada momento o melhor para o seu povo, mesmo que isso signifique trair aliados, mentir, roubar tecnologias, romper acordos e pactos, escravizar inimigos, sacrificar o próprio povo (para que objetivos futuros sejam alcançados). Gráficos excelentes e trilha sonora excepcional lhe impedirão de querer parar de jogar e você terá horas de diversão por muito tempo. A sua missão não será fácil mas da sua sabedoria, força e ousadia depende o futuro daqueles que você lidera. Da idade da pedra até as conquistas espaciais, passando por todos os períodos hiistóricos, haverá muito a fazer antes do seu triunfo final, que pode ser decidido ao vencer a corrida esoacial onde você encontrará um planeta habitável para onde levará a sua civilização e assim impedir que ela seja destruída por seus invejosos adversários, Há várias opções de vitória, a corrida espacial é apenas uma, pois a sua liderança e senso de justiça para todos pode levá-lo a ser eleito secretário geral das Nações Unidas pelas outras 31 civilizações que lhe admiram ou simplesmente através da guerra total e sem limites você poderá trazer a Paz Mundial (afinal, não haverá mais inimigos). As guerras poderão fazer surgir grandes líderes militares, forjados na batalha, como Erwin Rommel e Tojo que lhe darão a oprtunidade de criar um exército por eles liderados e que é muito útil em uma batalha. Há ainda os grandes líderes científicos que podem surgir com os avanços de sua civilização que deixarão os adversários boquiabertos com seus conhecimentos muito a frente do deles próprios, como Copérnico ou Charles Darwin, que lhe levarão a um aumento na atividade científica de sua civilização. O Multiplayer é outro ponto de destaque mas lembre-se que esse é um jogo por rodadas o que pode tornar a partida um pouco lenta, mas enfrentar uma inteligência humana é sempre empolgante pois o inimigo agora será bastante astucioso e não se deixará enganar tão fácil pelo seu blábláblá e sua conversa fiada pois sabe que você se faz de amiguinho mas terá sempre o objetivo secreto de destruí-lo.  Você tem a opção de modificar o jogo adcionando novas unidades (como os jagunços cangaceiros), líderes, campanhas ou civilizações (como a brasileira) disponíveis para download em sites como o civfanatics. Muito mais há para comentar sobre o jogo mas não perca tempo, jogue agora e descubra o seu potencial como líder.

review: Still the best Civ game after all these years. I only wish firaxis would return to the model set by this game including the stacking of units, the single tile cities, the awesome full control easy to use GUI editor, etc.... The Civ series has consistently declined in quality since Civ3, culminating with the current Civ 6 release although the biggest jump down was from 3 to 4 where most of the features were removed to allow them to be slowly introduced in future upgrades and DLCs for the following games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019512267', 'num_games_owned': 849, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1411469262}
review: 문명 3는 컴플리트 판을 제외하고, BTW 까지 한글화가 진행된 최후의 문명 시리즈입니다(네, 문명 5의 옥수수 드립이 나오기 전까지 최후였죠...). 여튼 스팀판에는 아쉽게도 영어판이지만, 여러 사람들이 만든 한국어 패치가 돌아다니고 있습니다. 거기다가, 6까지 묻어놓은 아폴로 프로젝트도 나오죠... 후버댐이 불가사의가 아닌게 아쉽지만 뭐 어때요... 클래식 게임으론 추천합니다!

author: {'steamid': '76561198104425330', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2502, 'last_played': 1684980388}
review:
Civilization III is one of my long-time favorites. It's fairly complex, very interesting, (from a historical standpoint). The graphics still look quite appealing, even after 15 years. 

The only advancements I've noticed in modern Civ games include, religion, more complex foreign policy, and better AI. I should also mention multiplayer, as the multiplayer aspect of this game died with Game Spy, unless you were to organize a game with friends.

This is still a great game that I would reccomend to fans of the Strategy genre of games, and, I know this is being overused of recent, but I believe, this is truly a game that stands the test of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035472795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1271, 'last_played': 1426724797}
review: Maybe its nostalgia, or maybe it still stands the test of time. But there's a reason my childhood was spent on this game. The GOAT of Civ and turn based 4X.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136293575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 51725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 14, 'playtime_at_review': 10735, 'last_played': 1710781009}
review:
I have played a lot of Civ games, from Advanced Civilizations on DOS all the way up to the brand new Civ VI. And this is still my favorite of all of them. It is definitely not the prettiest or most user-friendly civ game, but its grit and punishing difficulty (at the higher settings) give it a realism lost in a lot of the newer Civ games.  That being said the game is a huge leap foward from a lot of its easier counterparts, though it's still not as difficult at Advanced Civilizations, you don't need to mount your C:/ Drive to play it and there is a manual... Stupid RNG no explanation Civil Wars...

Anyway, long story short:
If you are new to the Civilization Franchise I might recommend starting with  Civ V, its an easier more friendly game. That being said, if you are a veteran of the franchise or of the strategy genre, Civ III will give you a more difficult, more immersive, and more brutal experience, and is well worth the $1-$5 it costs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067504589', 'num_games_owned': 751, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1794, 'last_played': 1630240571}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001608620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1666, 'last_played': 1520126105}
review:
Despite this game's age, despite all the other versiona that have come out since, despite all the time I sink into all of those newer versions, I still come back to this one.

Civilization III is my personal favorite of the entire Civilization franchise, from Civ I to Civ VI, Alpha Centauri and Beyond Earth. For me, this game has truly withstood the test of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157724691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 6156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4374, 'last_played': 1556477954}
review:
Picked this up during a Steam sale a while back. I'd never really been a fan of 4X titles. This game single-handedly changed that:

Pros:
[1] Simple intuitive user interface
[2] Loads of custom maps and scenarios to play out
[3] Loads of civilizations to try out with each feeling slightly different from the others

Cons:
[1] Management of units becomes tedious during last game
[2] Competent but passive AI in lower difficulty settings

A definite must have in any strategy collection.... And it still stands the test of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039465067', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 115326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61200, 'last_played': 1708125551}
review:
Bought it on Steam for nostalgia-reasons.. It's the game that got me hooked on the "Civilization" series. Old but gold.
Civilization IV and V added a lot of great stuff, but also removed some parts i really liked.

Over the years, some awesome and still very playable mods and scenario's came out for this game as well
from Civfanatics i strongly recommend:
- Escape From Zombie Island (both 1 & 2)
- Hegemon! Of the Classical Greek World!
- Age of Imperialism

author: {'steamid': '76561198052520532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2408, 'last_played': 1708710158}
review:
Dart like loading speed and complex stratergy makes this game the best game I have every played and at ~£3 (marked down to ~75p at the time of this review) what is not to like. The graphics aren't even noticably early 2000's (I actually had to check that it was released in the early 2000's for this review). This game is as great now as it was when released. I'd give it 10/10 and 
[b]I nominated this game for the test of time award.[/b]
especialy the tukmans test of time mod.
:-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197976999134', 'num_games_owned': 3248, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1668, 'last_played': 1362470400}
review:
I became a PC gamer because of this game. Got it the Gold edition. Took forever to get conquests expansion. I still enjoy playing those scenarios. This game has a ton of micromanagement but still less than a lot of other 4x games. Easy to learn, difficult to master. It still holds up well. Cheap, fun, and runs on anything. Good to play on my laptop when travelling.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198027599004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1696853296}
review:
El juego es bueno, la compañia detra de su desarrollo no es buena.

review:
It's an honest game.
Abe Lincoln contacted me and said "Pay me 140 gold and we will have continued world peace.."
Paid the gold and 3 turns later, America forms an alliance against me and declairs war, when Im just mind my own business farming in my fields.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060025462', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1668785743}
review:
There is nothing more satisfying than watching your humble little settlement, turn into a continent wide superpower, with huge armies and nuclear arsenals. A "quick" game of Civ, you tell yourself. Then, next time you look out of your window, the sun is coming back up and you're late for work/school.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198057258683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1479568485}
review:
Yesterday my friend asked me how to beat AI at level 4, then I began to start to remember that is already a very long time when I played CIV3. Middle school, together with my brother and my best friends. We have talked a lot with this game and how it gonna to be. Some are already in CIV4,5,6 realized, but some maybe never. I remembered so many good stuff and decided to play again. However I can't any more. I have forgotten everything about techs and tricks how should I develop, and very soon, war was declared.

It is classic, it is epic, but it is already history. I buy this for my pirated version in the past when I was young. And then is the time to say good bye.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043399596', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1479177223}
review:
Sid Meier’s Civilization III is a 4x strategy game, that means the objective of the game is to eXplore, eXpand, eXploit, and eXterminate to win. First off, the game takes some time to get the hang of the concept, but it also just takes time to play. A game could last anywhere from 30 minutes to multiple years. I first read the manual for the game which did help out. It told me of keyboard shortcuts that I never actually used. It also explained to me the basics of the game so when I started my new game I wasn’t completely lost. (This is coming from somebody who hasn't played any strategy games.) The first 30 minutes of my first game I wasted my turns walking around then finally building a city. I played as the Iroquois, they are proficient in agriculture, though I started producing warriors and getting very aggressive. My neighbors killed me and within an hour my first game was over. My second game ended much quicker, within 30 minutes my tiny city was captured. I felt very lost within the first turns of my first game. I felt the game didn’t do a very good job explaining what to do. I just felt a desire to discover the dark parts of the map because it didn’t look very good to me. However, I did find the advisors that would pop up and tell me information that I found very useful and helpful. In this way the game was able to help me assimilate myself with it’s complicated mechanics. 
One interesting mechanic in the 4x strategy game is its robust diplomacy system. There are many treaties, alliances, trade opportunities, agreements to be made, and wars to be waged. On my current playthrough I am a militaristic expansionist Roman empire I encountered the Aztecs and began fighting a war with them.  Upon seeing the I could overthrow them the Aztecs asked for a peace treaty which I agreed to. From there on out the Aztec and I created a rite of passage where we would be able to cross each other's land. However, I plan on expanding cities and surrounding them then I will take over their cities and kill them. This diplomacy system is a major part of my strategy to win the game. This will play a consequential role of my playthrough of this game. 
In general I have never been a big fan of strategy games, however I did find myself enjoying this game to a certain extent. I don’t expect to be putting too much time into the game anymore, but I can say that my time spent with it has not been all negative.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166694681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1659590521}
review:
If you're looking for ludicrous and war-mongering AI, as well as the ability to make your civilization happy without a circus and other buildings that provide happiness, this is the game for you!

In all seriousness, this is a great game. It is 100% worth the $1.24 you pay when it goes on sale! It is very easy to manage your cities' happiness and production! With Civ III, you can que production items, unlike Civ V, which makes the game enjoyable. As well as allows you to have very productive cities. The way it makes that aspect of the game more enjoyable is that you don't have to click on the choose production icon every few turns. However, it sometimes likes to just switch to needless outdated military units after it runs out of production items in a que. Another nice feature of this game is the selecting how you want your game to be set up. It allows you to choose how old the earth is when you start the game. As well as has a few more features that are absent in Civ 5.

The only cons to this are the aforementioned AI, and playing it on a newer computer. The AI are typically kind of crazy when it comes to deals, and get really annoyed if you decline them. Which typically leads to war with them eventually. I seem to have a problem where the AI all declare war with me. Also, the AI expand their civilizations really fast, so if you buy this, make sure to settle as many cities as possible in the beginning of the game! Although that really applies to any Civ Game. Finally, Civ 3 seems to run too fast on newer computers, and it will skip through some animations. 

Other than that, this is a really great game! Especially when it is slightly more expensive than a pack of gum!

author: {'steamid': '76561198153609747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 930, 'last_played': 1683893113}
review:
Každý má rád "tu svou civku", káždá z her je trošku jiná a někdo má rád starou dobrou jedničku. Třetí civilizice je v dnešní době už klasika. Kombinuje herní prvky jedničky, přidává něco z dvojky a nakonec také přináší i něco svého. Myslím ale, že herní prvky tohoto dílu jsou nejlépe vyrovnány, jen ta diplomacie jako vždycky stojí jen na principu obchoduj - jedno s čímkoliv - a budou tě mít rádi. 
Osobně je pro mě tahle hra největší žrout času (podobně jako Transport Tycoon), doporučuju tedy všem, co znají a hrají Civky (i novější) i nováčkům: graficky zestárla hra dobře a hratelnost je velmi pěkná.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168829366', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 3654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 93, 'playtime_at_review': 2395, 'last_played': 1709852975}
review:
If you're looking for a Civilization game try either Civ IV or Civ V, both are better than this.

The combat feels too random and the AI seems to be overly aggressive (Something is wrong when someone like Gandhi demands tribute and refusing makes them declare war on you.) The AI also is very expansionist, creating new cities whenever it can.

I found no tutorial, so I had to learn how to play the game myself through trial and error.

On the bright side, it comes with its own scenario editor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157119708', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3983, 'last_played': 1701859678}
review: Personally this is my favorite turn based strategy. The game is playable for anybody and is very addicting if a person likes to be in control of things. What I like the most, is ability to grow really big, to name stuff as one wants and to play on real World maps. Editor is really simple btw. AI is kind of not really good, but it's challenging on high levels due to bonuses to AI. Also, there is a city count limit on a map which is 512 I think and the game has kind of built in minimal turn waiting time. I have tested this with some members on the community, and it seems that game code doesn't allow for faster operation, regardless of PC hardware one is using. No matter what CPU/RAM/GPU one has, two very powerful cores or 8 core CPU (since the game utilizes only one core by default), the speed of the slowest turn will be the same. Which is considerable, when you have full map of civs, dip relations and modern units.

author: {'steamid': '76561198297946714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 897, 'last_played': 1569458326}
review:
我是从很多年前玩文明3开始接触的文明系列，至今也是最喜欢的游戏之一。
文明4在大的框架上继承的是3代，并且更加完善。3代除了那个年代特有的操作方式以外，较真的话也有不足之处：
1.后期的污染清理，凭空给玩家找点事干，不过还好这一点没有被之后的文明继承；
2.爆铺惩罚极低，之后的文明系列尝试过各种方法来遏制这种倾向，比如维护费和全局快乐度；
3.AI在战争的大局观上有欠缺，经常送兵，不太擅长用攻城武器，这一点不如4代，不过还是要比5代之后不堆叠的AI要强……

author: {'steamid': '76561198122360918', 'num_games_owned': 4052, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1512624774}
review:
문명 2가 나오고 나서
모든 게임의 원조는 시뮬레이션이다...라고 박박 우겨가면서
문명을 플레이하다가
운명처럼 알파센타우리를 만나고
다행히도 용산에서 누군가 뜯었다가 반품한 알파센타우리 플래네터리 팩을 만원에 구입하게 되었고...
문명 3이 나오기 전까지 미친 듯이 알파센타우리만 하면서 지내다가...
문명 3이 나온다는 소식을 듣고 한정판을 질렀는데...
한정판이 나온 꼬라지가

깡통 캔에 종이에 시디 두 장이었던가...

알파센타우리 플래네터리 팩에 들어있던,
두꺼운 게임 컨셉 설명서
벽에 붙여놓으면 폼나는 테크 트리
그리고 사전급인 게임 매뉴얼
등등...을 생각하면서 한정판 오기를 기다렸는데...

근데 무려 한정판 문명 3에는 그냥 게임 매뉴얼 한 권 딸랑...
ㅋㅋㅋ

cd 종이 포장지는 좀 심했다 싶었는지 나중에 플라스틱 시디 케이스 한 개 보내주기는 하더라구요...
ㅆㅂ

근데 이것보다 더 웃긴 게 뭐냐면... 한정판 물량없다고 그래서 제값 주고 아타리 코리아에서 샀는데
한정판 발매한 다음날 용산 가보니까 용산에서 pc게임 파는 곳 마다 가게마다 한 50개씩 문명 한정판 깡통이 수북이 쌓여있음...

내가 그 이후로 발더스 게이트 2 한정판 사기 전까지는 한국에서 파는 게임 한정판은 안사는 걸 원칙으로 하며 살았....

아, 물론 지금도 문명 6을 디럭스로 예구하는 파이랙시스 고정 호구이기는 하지만... 여튼 그런 한정판에 대한 나쁜 기억이 있는 문명 3은
안사고 안사고 안사다가...
이제야 샀...

근데 솔까말로 문명 3이나 문명 4 바닐라는 알파센타우리보다 지금해도 여전히 재미없다... 그나마 문명 4는 폴 프럼 헤븐 모드가 있어서 평타 정도 인정해주는 거지...

난 아직도 문명 3 보너스 시디에 들어있던 시드 마이어 어릴 적 스케이트 보드 타던 영상을 기억하고 있다...

review: Ce jeu est le meilleur tour par tour de stratégie auquel je joue encore en 2016 bientôt 2017, ^^ aucun ne lui est égal niveau matière de gameplay (tour par tour), j'ai plus de 8700h :p en tout, mais sur steam j'arrive sur les 1000h avec ce jeu, et je suis toujours accroché à ce jeu !!!!! déçu qu'il ne soit pas en français, mais pour ma part je connais tous les bâtiments et technologie par coeur, ainsi que les régimes politiques et unités du jeu :) pour moi un 5 est insultant pour ce jeu, je mettrai plus un 20/20. Au final pour ceux qui veulent un bon jeu qui dur assez longtemps avec de l'action et de la baston à grande échelle, et de la vraie stratégie go prendre ce jeu en tour par tour vous ne serez pas déçu !!!!!! ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198140809545', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 24796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7679, 'last_played': 1692419777}
review:
>Installs custom leaderheads
>Playing as Franklin Roosevelt
>Best friends with the democratic nation of Nazi Germany
>Also best friends with the republican nation of The Soviet Union
>Fascist India approaches me with 20 war elephants
>Gandhi declared war on me again o no
>Signs military alliance against Gandhi with every other nation
>World War 1 lasted for 300 years
>Finally peace
>Next turn
>Gandhi declares war again
>Just finished the Manhattan Project
>Every city told to build at least one ICBM
>Gandhi attempts to take a city with War Elephants
>Stopped by a single Rifleman that I haven't upgraded yet
>Ended up nuking India 20 times in one turn
>Somehow wins with the "peaceful" UN victory


10/10 Would promote peace by completely decimating Mahatma Gandhi's empire again

*****

In all seriousness, though, Civ 3 certainly delivers. You'll most definitely have a fun time, with all these hilarious moments appearing left and right.

The advisors actually have a use, and they have expressions, unlike Civ 4 and 5. (The Science Advisor is literally Sid Meier btw)

There's whole government systems as opposed to civics. Means you can't fine-tune your government, but it takes a bit of load off your shoulders if you're not into figuring out what civics you want.

Also, spearman vs. tank scenarios don't happen *that* often. 118 hours in at the time of writing, and RNG hasn't pulled any serious BS on me.

The only real downside that sticks out to me is the loading lag between each turn that builds up late-game when you play multiplayer matches. That isn't too significant, though, since if you can sit through 2 minutes straight of nothing but an AI doing carpet bombing runs on your capital, you can survive an extra 4 seconds of loading time.

This was a wonderful Christmas gift I got from a good friend of mine. I would most definitely buy the game for someone else, too.
I mean, come on -- hours of endless entertainment for only $1.24? How could you resist?

author: {'steamid': '76561198014752703', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1516824752}
review: Civilization is like pizza. It's bad for your health, addictive, has a base of wheat and lots of tasty stuff on top...and most importantly, even when it's bad, it's still pretty good. This is by far the worst of the square grid Civilization games (so it's still better than V will ever be, but so is shooting yourself in the foot with a hexagonal bullet.) If you're seriously considering buying this, go play Civilization IV instead; it's a much better investment of your money and time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072450805', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 791, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1495125446}
review:
Jednym zdaniem: Trzecia odsłona Civilization to ostatnia Cywilizacja z klimatem, podpisana przez słynnego Sida Meiera. Potem zaczęło się już odcinanie kuponów od najsłynniejszej strategii na świecie. Civilization 3 jest też najlepszą cywilizacją do grania, gdyż nie jest tak muzealna jak słynna jedynka, a jednocześnie nie jest tak przebajerowana graficznie jak najnowsze części i zachowuje urok oldskulowej strategii. 

Plusy:

+ wszystko co najlepsze z pierwszej cywilizacji, plus to czego jej brakowało
+ ostatnia cywilizacja bez 3D (w wygodnym do gry rzucie heksametrycznym)
+ bardzo przyjemna kolorystyka i wygodny interfejs
+ najlepsza muzyka ze wszystkich części cywilizacji
+ ciekawe cudy świata do wybudowania
+ bardzo dużo nacji
+ w cenie dostajemy rozbudowany dodatek Play the World
+ tryb Conquest z histyrcznymi scenariuszami (epoka napoleońska, 2 wojna światowa itd.)
+ duża miodność (gra wciąga)

Minusy: 

- trochę zbyt niska rozdzielczość jak na dzisiejsze czasy
- opcja dyplomacji mogłaby być trochę bardziej rozbudowana
- nie można zagrać Polską :(

Komu polecam?  / Komu odradzam?

+ polecam fanom starej cywilizacji zanim nadeszła bezduszna 3D
- odradzam graczom szukającym zaawansowanej graficznie strategii

Rada: 

Jeżeli jakimś cudem nie graliście jeszcze nigdy w Cywilizację i chcecie zagrać w najlepszą, to polecam właśnie trójkę, bo genialna jedynka może Was jednak trochę odrzucić spartańskim wyglądem. ;) A najnowszym częściom jednak brakuje klimatu (4-5).

==============================================

➥ Obserwuj mnie jako kuratora ⤵
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/10437106/

author: {'steamid': '76561198086296893', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1616463363}
review:
Un verdadero juego de estrategia, no es el mas amigable para empezar a entrar dentro de la estrategia para eso ya tenemos AOE que se basa mas en la conquista militar y el uso de recursos para financiar contrucciones y un ejercito, aqui necesitas tener una vision mas amplia de lo que es manejar una civilisacion en ciencia,  cultura, relaciones exteriores y si militar es exigente dentro de la manera de jugar.
No es el mejor juego de la saga e de decir ese es el 5,  pero devo de decir que si es un titulo que se puede jugar y que te mantiene jugando provando las diferentes culturas y estrategias que pudes tomar en tus partidas, lo recomiendo si de verdad eres seguidor de los juegos de estrategia que no solo se basan en aplastar a tu objetivo de manera belica, aunque lo puedes hacer si asi quieres ;).

author: {'steamid': '76561198135497405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1347, 'last_played': 1697420428}
review:
I've played this game since it came out, on and off, over the years.  It's wonderful.  To me, Civ 2 is the archetype.  This one is Civ 2 with a modern look and sensical changes/additions.

This game can be very relaxing but can also be drenched in anxiety and frustration.  The AI cracks me up...  sometimes they feel like real human thinkers but other times they're just barbarian lunatics!

I'm running this thing on a Macbook Pro through CrossOver software.  With a few tweaks, it works great!  Which is amazing because it's the only way I can play the game via my computer.  I also have Civ IV which is also great, but I find myself playing III whenever I feel the urge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108005381', 'num_games_owned': 1215, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1530273234}
review: Одна из самых лучших стратегий и сложных на мой взгляд.Геймплей почти не отличается от новых частей,но в ней есть те самые тонкости которые и усложняют игру и превращают тебя в котёл который вот вот закипит и бомбанёт.Особенно эта фишка, когда у тебя юнит сильнее,но ты по неведомым причинам не можешь победить юнита слабее.Во всем виновата поверхность шарика под названием Земля.Развитие городов весьма впечатляет,особенно строительство своего храма(всегда хотел себе храм забабахать).Также в игре присутствует так сказать помощник,который мне лично не помогал(только в некоторых случаях).Другие страны очень агрессивны, так что сразу плодите орду,а то на вас нападут все страны сразу.9 юнитов из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198277628477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 19732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3641, 'last_played': 1674017964}
review:
Here's what I think of this game, I'll compare it to Civ 5 since most people consider that to be the best Civ game.

Music: Both Civ 5 and Civ III have fantastic soundtracks as with pretty much all Civ games. CIV 5's soundtrack is better, but that doesn't mean this soundtrack isn't worth listening to. 

Diplomacy: The diplomacy here in Civ III, in my opinion is better. You can trade maps technologies, change how agressive the AI is. The AI does get quite a bit agressive once you get to medium agressiveness although.

Scenarios: The scenarios here in Civ III are quite interesting. We have Rise of Rome, Fall of Rome, Napoleanic Europe, WW2 in the pacific, etc. I honestly can't choose between Civ 5 and 3 in terms of which had better scenarios.

War: And here is where we start to see the flaws of Civ III. There are certain units made for attacking, defending, and seige units. The seige units must be protected otherwise they will be either captured or destroyed immediately, and the attacking units are vulnerable to counterattack. Defending units ensure your cities are protected and your attacking armies. This part of war, I liked, It made sure I don't just build completely one type of unit. 
Cities are instantly captured if there is no unit inside. I wasn't as fond of this as the unit diversity, but it was tolerable at least.
But then their's the battle system. It's luck based, which I have a burning hatred for. I could attack a spearman one time with an archer and not take any damage, while another time, a defending spearmen exactly the same as the other one could take out my archer, without taking any damage. How does that make any sense? I get it it's an old game an all, but come on.
Also the AI seem way too powerful. I met Scandinavia on turn 2 and it already said his forces outnumbered mine.

CIv 5 definetly, has better war mechanics.

Barbarian encampment and ruins/friendly encampments: Whether you love 'em or hat 'em these guys are around, some encampment are friendly and will give you something like gold or a settler to give you a huge early game boost. and of course the hostile. You can make the hostile encampments non existant, sedentary, normal, roaming or raging. Since there is more option than Civ 5, I'd say these are slightly better.

Civilization balance: Civilization 5 isn't exactly balanced, (Babylon is much better, is pretty much better every aspect compared to let's say the Iroqouis). Civ's are more balanced here. Each Civ have a unique unit, 2 free technologies and 2 bonus'. Military bonus' allow you to build stronger armies faster, science allows you to build science buildings faster, religious allows you to build cultural building faster, etc. In my opinion the two best are science and religious (Which Babylon ironically has both XD). Besides that Civ's are quite balanced besides early game Unique units (I'm looking at you bowmen)

Victory types: Time victory is always on here, which I don't like (although you can push back the counter for time victory to kick in) cultural victoy revolves around how much culture you can get in either one city or your entire empire, dominatuion requires you to own at certain percentage of the world's population or land area, conquest is to eliminate all rival civilizations., wonder is to build a certain amount of wonders, diplomatic is to get people to vote for you once the UN is built, and space race to leave this filthy planet. All good, although most of the time you will win by either cultural or time.

Graphic: I don't really care for graphics much, but the graphic here are at best, pleasing to the eye and at worst, tolerable.

Conclusion: CIV 5 is obviously better, but Civ 3 is extremely enjoyable also, I have many hours into this, and many more will be put into playing this. I know the flaws I listed here aren't going to be changed unless everyone at Firaxis gets high. I haven't seen any bugs, just a great game.

I rate this 9/10- Aged beautifully, like a gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021059290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1467557685}
review:
Моё знакомство с цивилизацией началось именно с этой части, играл я во все 5 частей этой игры (кроме самой первой цивилизации) и могу сказать что третья цивилизация до сих пор может конкурировать с 4 и 5 частями. В этой цивилизации боты наглые, увидят даже 3 квадрата свободной территории, они вышлют туда поселенца и им плевать на то что эти 3 квадрата окружены Вашей территорией, им плевать на то что вы им дипломатически заявляете чтобы они не пересекали Вашу границу, они просто прут. Так же тут неимоверно быстро колонизирую территории! Тобишь настолько быстро что по факту остается выбирать, ты либо строишь поселенцев большей частью своих городов и забиваешь на их развитие, либо развиваешь города, но тогда ты в десятки раз меньше чем они занимаешь территорию. Так же в этой цивилизации есть очень много возможностей в дипломатии, мне не понятно почему в 4 и 5 дипломатию так сильно урезали. Так же если в 4 или 5 цивилизации вы будете играть на самой легкой сложности вы скорее всего ооочень сильно обгоните других в плане развития, в 3 цивилизации играя на легкой я кое-как оторвался на 4-5 технологий. Так же тут есть замечательная возможность смотреть город! Где город изображен НОРМАЛЬНО! А не как в 4 или 5 где посреди города стоит гигансткий солдат. А еще тут очень много науки, даже с ускоренным производством чтобы изучить всё, вам понадобится много времени, а если вы еще и отключили ускоренное производство то считайте вообще неделю убьете на это.

Из минусов игры... Слишком наглые (а возможно просто немного глуповатые) боты, потому что нигде, даже во второй цивилизации я не припомню чтобы настолько нагло всё заселяли. Так же мало ресурсов. Мало команд можно отдать юнитам.

Пожалуй, эту цивилизацию я бы поставил на второе место по интересности игры и другим параметрам. Первое место я всё-таки отдам пятой цивилизации. А третье четвертой.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158402865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2089, 'last_played': 1503796570}
review:
This maybe the cheatingest game I've ever played. Literally, at the later stages, it is essentially unplayable, because either your units are so nerfed or theirs are so boosted that nothing can be done.

You manage your cities perfectly. You carefully build a technological advantage. You've diplomatically played enemies against enemies.

And now it's time. Your tanks are ready to move on the helpless city guarded only by a few men with spears.

But there is a problem. For some reason, your tanks lose. So you send in the the airforce to soften things up. But, again, men with spears win the day. So, you park a battleship off the coast and start shelling. No damage. No damage.

Wait, an enemy trireme rows up armed with arrows... and sinks your battleship.

That's when you realize. The game is a cheating piece of shit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193932054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 13775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13473, 'last_played': 1445322477}

author: {'steamid': '76561198256237444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1501865815}
review: I only have 9 hours on this game, that is one whole afternoon of "One more click mom, we can go then." "Sorry, I'm waging a war on the filthy Aztecs." *3 hours pass* "What? Sorry dad, we can go out to dinner later, I'm in the middle of literally taking a massive shit on the Incans." This went on till 6:30 in the morning when I went to my kitchen for food, and found my mom making coffee. She wasn't happy after me saying "Goodmorning, I'm in the midst of taking over the world, the americans and the russians are making a pathetic attempt to destroy my communistic empire of the elite." If I were to play more of this game, I would have a week of only playing it, I do not have it installed for this reason. I would have no life if friends play this game with me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135552970', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1638192693}

author: {'steamid': '76561198162270976', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1545511532}
review: Civilization III ilk defa 10 yıl önce oynadığım ve hayran kaldığım bir oyundur. Daha önceden oynadığım Aoe ve Stronghold serilerinden farklı olarak kaynak toplayıp asker basmanızı istemez. Haritasını bilmediğiniz bir dünyada kuracağınız devleti teknoloji, ekonomi, diplomasi, ticaret, savaş yönlerinin tamamıyla kontrol etmeniz gerekir. Grafiğe bağımlı olmayan yapısı sayesinde her zaman oynanabilecek bir oyun. Civ serisine 4. ya da 5. oyun ile başlayanlara bu oyunu oynamalarını da tavsiye ederim. Tabiki 4. ve 5. oyunlara göre eksi yönleri var ama Civ serisinin güzelliği de bu. Diğer oyunlar gibi yerinde durmayıp her oyunda kendilerini geliştirmeleri ve çıtayı gittikçe yukarı taşımaları.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154582634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 34234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1507, 'last_played': 1703951371}
review:
Man this game. This was the 3rd or 4th video game I ever played after Hotwheels MicroRacers and LegoRacers. I started playing it at 5 years old and dude, I spent so many hours on that Windows 98 playing this game.

10/10 would get grounded again for this game


Pros:

-the fricking sounds, not only the soundtrack (which changes from era to era and man is it the best ambient music ever) but the sound effects are so percussionistic and beautiful too

-the uncomparable depth to the game; the vast amount of different things you have to pay attention to and manage: most games require only a linear train of thought like hey shoot the bad guys, maintain your health, upgrade weapons. Not Civilizations. Build Cities, Create armies to protect and expand your empire, research technology, explore the world, fend off barbarians, build roads, find resources, build farms to speed up your city growth, build settlers to build new cities, I could go on for hours.

-educational, yeah it is. As a young kid I learned about Samurai, the Immortal Guard of the Persians, The Hanging Gardens, The Great Lighthouse, Names of Leaders of Nations like Hannibal and Elizabeth, etc. Proof that games can be subtly educational

-definitely best of the Civilization series, Civ IV was ok, religion was the only noticeably cool aspect. Civ V was better but the lack of stackable units and limited resources was a pain to get used to. Civ V did have nice expansions and I very enjoyed their City Defense aspect but Civ III had much simpler everything without giving up anything. XP, technology, interactions with other civs are a few of the things both III and V but III had it much simpler and efficient.


Cons


-um I guess it looks really old now and the highest resolution is really low lol.

-i guess i could see it being hard to get into these games for many people due to how old it is now

author: {'steamid': '76561198197886913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2018, 'last_played': 1464487826}
review: I bought this game because of my experience with the newer Civ 5 series. I thought that I could give it a try for the very low price. I am still on the fence about this game because of its learning curve but I do love this type of simulation genre. The AI  is impossible to please, yet they relentlessly want all they can take from you. I am not a fan of the save point & retry strategy but sometime you got to do what you got to do. Overall, if you're familiar with the Civilization Series try this game a very low price. If you aren't familiar try it at a very low price. FYI I bought this game for less than a dollar. Manuals the are more detailed than the game manual are online. The version I brought did not have an activated tutorial either. Cheers.

review: As an avid player of older strategy games, both real time and turn based (AoE and such) I find this really fun to play. Highly recommend downloading even more supplementary mods than the complete edition comes with and you'll find this awesome to play. Don't mess with Gandhi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127670588', 'num_games_owned': 27, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1229, 'last_played': 1584300567}
review: Questo gioco tende a diventare una specie di droga, una volta che inizi a giocare ci vorrà qualcosa di piuttosto importante per farvi staccare dal monitor, è fatto molto bene, un gameplay non complicatissimo, che viene spiegato abbastanza bene dal gioco, e contiene un sacco di mappe extra fatte da fan e quant'altro, volendo uno potrebbe giocarci fino alla morte. Passate sopra al fatto che sia in inglese e che, pur essendo un gioco non troppo vecchio, ha una grafica e musica discutibile, ma a un certo punto non ci farete caso, tipo quando sarete per conquistare il mondo con uno stack di 40 unità posto accanto a una città nemica, quel momento è pura ignoranza

author: {'steamid': '76561198003956915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 46106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11139, 'last_played': 1701804786}
review:
This game is complicated, difficult, frustrating, and oh my goodness so much fun. I think this is probably *the* gold standard for turn-based strategy games, even now, all these years later. I've tried later iterations of the Civ franchise, but /// is still my favourite. The 2D graphics are clear and very pretty. The mechanics are incredibly detailed and complicated, but also fit nicely together into a unified whole. The gameplay is fun, and the game always gives you plenty of different things to do -- without making you feel overwhelmed (well, at least once you get used to the basics). The interface gives you access to tons of information and lots and lots of options without ever feeling cluttered; in fact, on most of the screens you'll be seeing, the UI feels slick and very attractive, while still remaining effective. The game even has a lovely sense of humour -- the "you say you want a revolution?" bit always makes me smile. :)

In short, this is one of the very best computer games I've ever played, in any genre, and definitely the best strategy game. At this ridiculously low price, which includes all of the game's various expansions (including internet multiplayer, which still works very nicely and will lead to lots of fun and/or horribly frustrating gameplay time with friends), there is no reason not to snap it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031976721', 'num_games_owned': 2310, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 59587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31272, 'last_played': 1709548231}
review:
이 게임은 그냥 게임이 아니라 마약의 일종이다.

아기자기한 그래픽과 유닛마다 서로 고유한 목소리로 싸워대며 실제 내가 이 유닛들을 통솔하고 키우는 느낌이 있기 때문에 후속작에서도 느낄 수 없는 고유의 재미가 있다.

또한 우호도가 높을 수록 문명마다 고유한 자기만의 문화에 따른 대사를 하는데 굉장히 재밌다.
5나 4를 재밌게 했어도 고전겜이라고 너무 등한시 하지말고 일단 깔아보자. 아마 낮이 밤이 되어있는 기적이 일어날 것이다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007539033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1666075438}
review:
The series ended here, as far as I'm concerned. Now, Civ 4 was a good game, and while the less that is said about Civ 5 the better (if you ask me), in my mind Civ 3 was the epitome of the Sid Meier vision for the series and the greatest achievement of aesthetics, style, pacing and general gameplay - as far as Civ gameplay could go.

I think this has a lot to do with the predecessors. Civilization: Call to Power was an epic computer game, surpassing and extremely entertaining. Alpha Centauri was of course one of the very greatest titles the genre has ever seen, encorporating gameplay additions and features - so much recorded voice acting~ - that still feel fresh and ingenious to this day. It was into this setting of established 2D, top down turn based strategy excellence that Civ 3 had to plonk, and what a plonk it was.

How did it work so well? Well it was the way the game juxtaposed itself against it's lineage as much as the way it reproduced and refined it that really rung true with me. Civilzation 3 was all about resolution, refinement, aesthetics and staid excellence. The pacific colours, the fantastic drawn visions of your cities, the subtly faux-3D border markers, the movements of the characters, sounds and the pacing of the game were all just totally lovely touches that made this experience feel high quality and timeless.

Playing it today reveals a game that is completely succesful as a final installment in a series, even though the series itself continued on into the age of 3D. There are flaws of course - in end game especially the dominated maps completely cede any kind of influence over gameplay to your railways, aircraft and ICBMs, the voice acting of Alpha Centauri would have been really great here (it was used for Civ 4, famously, with Leonard Nimoy granting that game degrees of cultural magic that few computer games enjoy) and one could say that consequently the gameplay gets a bit stale towards the later stages of a long game, but it is what happens in the interim - especially the first three quarters of the span of civilization you navigate - that is a really wonderful experience, worth any price.

Play it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141483054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 4218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2579, 'last_played': 1491360242}
review:
I have civ5 complete too. Like some of the other reviews I found the game fairly different from civ5. Definitely worth the buy ($1.37 on sale). Not having the culture group stuff from civ 5 makes the game alot better. Another up compared to civ 5 is that it doesnt have the fancy graphics, so I can run it on my work laptop (which has no dedicated gpu) [civ 5 to go? lel].

I find the whole idea of *clicking on my temple to add an upgrade (all visual?)* pretty pointless and dumb. I literally just hover my touchpad over the whole screen till i hear a sound, then click and escape. It was pretty annoying to 

The time it takes to finish a game is both a pro and con. If you are a time sensitive person I would suggest you turn off move animations for all units because you will leterally have your eye pop out waiting for allt he units to move at the end. Some of the other default settings also made the game annoying to play. In particular, if you have units which are fortified or in alert stances, the turn may very well pass away under the default setting unless you do some annoying repetitive camerfa movement. There was a setting to wait at the end of ever turn to make this easier, I'm totally fine hitting space bar or enter at the end of every turn then watch things happen in a way i didn't want it.

I still have to learn about some other mechanisms in this game before I comment further. I'll probably add more next time i stop by.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027611421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 35913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24970, 'last_played': 1621543116}
review: Civilization III ainda é, para muitos que acompanham a série Civilization desde o princípio, talvez a melhor versão deste clássico do Sid Meier. Embora já tenha 15 anos de lançamento, a jogabilidade não foi afetada. Roda em todos os Windows, inclusive nas versões de 64bits. O visual é limpo, claro, criados de maneira a representar as unidades como eram na realidade histórica e não como meros desenhos de fantasia. Ou dizendo melhor, não tem nenhuma aparência infantil - no meu ver o grande erro do Civ IV, e nem o excesso de grafismo utilizado no Civ V, o que fez com que também deixasse a desejar. Para quem quiser se iniciar nos mistérios da série, Civ III é o melhor caminho. E acredito que será difícil abandoná-lo depois. Detalhe, não é viciante. É envolvente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013781501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 21128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10552, 'last_played': 1602435510}
review:
My Dad thinks that games are a waste of time and that one can have much more fun and growth from reading Thackery or Trollope. That being said, he must have put in several thousand hours into this game since he bought it for me around my 6th-odd birthday in 2001. Our primay form of bonding is talking Civ strategy. 

He has no interest in 4, 5, BE or anything like that. Says they're not interesting like this one is. I'm inclined to agree. I think that Civ 3 is the essence of 4X, and that any designer wanting to know what makes 4x games great,  should play this obsessively. There are a few things here and there that I think could have been expanded on- such as plague- and the fact that some civilizations simply have uninspired Unique Units with bland mechanics. Nevertheless, one of my favourite games ever. Now that Civ 6 is happening, I do hope that Meier et al look back to this one, for inspiration, on how a truly grand 4X should be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112810429', 'num_games_owned': 2591, 'num_reviews': 578, 'playtime_forever': 2977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2844, 'last_played': 1462313274}
review:
Civ III is an apogee of the former "Civilization" games focus. Why play it now, when Civ V is tuned, fixed, updated so many times - and even price looks fine for almost every pocket? Well, it's all for that focus I'm talking about.

First three of Civilization games were taking the player back at the dawn of the known history - and to help to notice the flow of time, there was some borderlines across that mighty river of the so-called "4th dimension". Starting with the Civ IV this process of moving through timeline were "smoothed", to the point where player gliding from the start to the end of the game without any noticable delay. I'm not saying that's bad - I like Civ V myself - but sometimes you don't want simple transfer from A to B, from the stone to electric age - you want to see cornerstones of each specific era. And with that - Civ III is giving you the better experience.

All that I said in the previous passage, is arguable, of course. But here is another trait of Civ III which was intentionally cutted off (in favor of balance, of course): the size of armies and all warfare business.
With all complexity of the game mechanics in the Civ V, armed conquests there looking as they performed by 10-20 people at best. In Civ III, we have totally another scale. So, when I want to win a game of Civilization by assault strategy, I start Civ III.

The third volume of Civilization is dated, but still deep, still challenging, still holding the billion of possibilities to build your Nation. Make Your Way. So I'll mark the game as 9/10 - not ideal, but so much enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014237183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 48932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35661, 'last_played': 1663498133}
review: I have played this game since it came out brand new back in the day (my hours don't reflect the amount of time I've put into it) and I still believe that it's one of the best games ever made.  Out of everything I've played, I come back to this game over and over again and am constantly amazed at the replayability it brings.  It's always different and interesting to see how the enemy will attack you and what it takes to defend yourself/territory.  Taking over the world is my favorite, but may take days.  If you blow it then just start a whole different one.  It's easy to understand and learn but very complicated to master.  It's right up there with Chess and Axis and Allies in my book of classics. I've found nothing else quite as great........

author: {'steamid': '76561198188578901', 'num_games_owned': 2526, 'num_reviews': 956, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 937, 'last_played': 1455126788}
review:
Hayatım boyunca oynadıklarım içinde en sevdiğim strateji oyunudur. Age of Empires 2 ile çok kıyaslanmıştırsa da ben Civilizationcu olarak bundan yanaydım :) Ayrı bir şeydir bu oyun; herkese göre değildir amma oynayana hem yabancı dil hem de kültürel olarak çok şey katar.

Civilization serisinde tabi ki sabit bir senaryo olmadığı için (Senaryomuz tarih. Tarihse belli. Her yeni oyunda gelişen ana şey oynanış ve grafikler) illa buradan başlamak gerek gibi düşünmeyin kendinizi. Ancak Civ3, sonraki Civilization oyunlarının kemik iskeletini oluşturuyor ve zaten seri bu oyunla birlikte o hızı kazanıyor. Şimdi direk Civ4 veya Civ5'ten başlayan insanların çoğu adapte olamıyor. O yönden Civ3 daha basit olmasından kaynaklıdır diye düşünüyorum. Ama tabi ki elinizde ileriki oyunlar var ve bu yoksa, illa bunu alıp oynayın demiyorum. Ancak hiç Civ oynamadınız ve seri toplu olarak indirime girdiyse alın Civ3'ü ve serinin yükselişine yavaş yavaş tanık olun :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198007372152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1323, 'last_played': 1520740130}
review:
Civ 3 Complete on sale for $1.24 so I buy it since I recall how great it was years ago.  I am a big fan of Civ 4 & Civ 5 with all the expansions.  And I am delaying getting a new PC until I know the system requirements for Civ 6.  Still I realize that there was a lot I missed from Civ 3:  Artillery that doesn't suffer damage.  The people's portraits in the city display (I liked Civ I's  full figurines even better).  The fashion progression for world leaders and the population.  (Nineteenth Century attire looks good on everybody; I don't know why).  Single figure unit graphics.  And extremely good graphics for the system requirements.
     And the world is massive.  Civ 5, by giving every unit at least 2mp, really shrank the world.  
     Units simply gain more hits points on promotion; no decision on how to specialize.
     Music that expresses the time frame of the turn.  Civ 5's music is just as varied but seems 
     designed as background music.
Of course it all depends on what one wants from a Civ game.  But if it goes on sale again for $1.24 that's not much of a gamble.
