author: {'steamid': '76561198097731679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 28430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8938, 'last_played': 1706902884}
review:
Absolutely amazing game. I've played all linear [i]Civilization[/i] games save for Civ 2 and this has by far been my favourite. I really wish they didn't stray from the feel of the first 3 Civ games, I'm really not a fan of the feel of Civ 5, but alas the masses seem to disagree with me. 

I don't want the bland interface of the fourth and fifth games, I want character, and my loyal advisors to guide me.

I don't want to set my political civic 'Police State' and my economic civic to 'Central Planning'; I don't want to take whatever 'social policy' tree (with permanent effects + no drawbacks) or adopt the 'Order' ideology.
I want to use the 'Communism' government and have my advisors refer to me as 'Comrade' as I free to the proletariat of the world from the bourgeosie and the 'Fascist' Aztecs!

The character of the game, the way events and history play out, managing your empire and waging war, etc. is simply really something and it really seems to have been lost with the new Civ games. And the sad thing is, it has so much potential for future games with more fleshed-out content, features, etc.

Definite 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198089148950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3473, 'last_played': 1709160966}
review: This game is fun.  I know you're endlessly searching through the 50% offs and free-to-plays, hoping destiny makes the next best decision of your life for you.  Take control of your life...put the drink down, go set your alarm for tomorrow morning at 8:00 am, and do something randomly nice for your parents or significant other.  Once you're mentally set that this is the moment your life turns around, download the game, and by golly have some fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040721051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5293, 'last_played': 1666288205}
review:
Civilization III is the first 4X game I've seriously tried and I must say it was a surprise! At first the game wasn't likeable to me because my civilization was considered the worst at the easiest difficulty. I learned with some time (in multiplayer) the basics, I would say that it was a fun way to learn things.
The feeling you get when the first game's over is unique, on both victory and defeat circumstances, you learn lots of things seeing the enemies' play on the summary.

I want to say to all the new players to not get discouraged by the brutality that CPUs have in this game and I recommend to try it out with a person in multiplayer [i]like I did[/i] and also to read the informations found on the civilopedia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070439580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 48591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9984, 'last_played': 1672353645}
review: A very confusing game to play if it is your first time playing a Civ or other turn based strategy game. With enough perseverance, you'll learn the ropes though. While a more simple game than its successors Civ 4 and Civ 5, this game is extremely complex but still wildly fun and addicting. It doesn't make my computer slow at all and is fun to play alone, especially in an airport or on a sick day. It can, however, still be enjoyed just as much in 5 minute intervals as a pick-up-and-play game. 5/5 would recommend to anyone with patience and an appreciation for historical accuracy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203780215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1455247994}
review:
文明系列我是从文明4上手的，文明3很久以前玩过一段时间，借同学买的所谓正版，也不清楚是不是正版玩的。当时感觉很一般，因为那会还年轻，比较侧重画面，而不是内容，所以玩了一段时间就放弃了。
现在玩文明5，看到文明3打折，就买了玩了玩。不知道为什么，感觉内容比文明5还好，略逊色于文明4。可能也有个人情怀在里面吧！
其实我更喜欢这种2D的风格，而不是文明4和5的3D代入感，因为这种回合策略游戏，根本不看画面，而是看内容的。在文明之间的外交上，很喜欢这种3、4的方式，而不是5代粗暴简单。

author: {'steamid': '76561198073600298', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1449516696}
review:
I understand, it's just not for me. 

When I was a child, I played this on and off constantly and never figuring out what I was doing. I played Diablo 2 around the same time and also didn't know what I was doing. 

This complicated empire micromanaging game is an old classic that many people remember, be it from watching one of your relatives playing or being that relative playing. You must manage large armies and cities while trying to expand your kingdom across the world. Disease, famine, civil unrest and poverty are just some of the factors you will have to deal with with trying to be the greatest empire. Doing things all the time is what will get you ahead, and failing over and over learning what does and doesn't work is the tutorial. Hardcore RTS is defined by the Civilization franchise.

I never really understood this game and I still don't. I never really enjoyed micromanage games as they posed too much stress for me to correctly enjoy them. This is personal and won't sway the game itself. 

This game is for people who love watching massive amounts of action going on at the same time with rediculous difficulty options and really good customization for world generation. For being this old, it holds its complication and difficulty really well. If you love this kind of stuff, then it's a no brainer and if you have never heard of this or just faintly remember it from long ago, make sure you Youtube some videos to make sure its your type of game.

It's not my kinda game, but it might be yours.

Personal Rating 1/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198054297474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1605, 'last_played': 1457160347}

author: {'steamid': '76561198033632960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 2403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2342, 'last_played': 1629637276}
review: Общее игровое время с далекого детства можно, наверное, исчислять несколькими месяцами. Возможность строительства своего собственного мира - бесценная возможность. Сколько раз запада на Рим или устремленно строил на копии карты Земли Российскую Федерацию, СССР и т.д. Жалко только, что искусственный интеллект вяло использовал возможности морского десантирования. Были и сногсшибательные дополнения, расширившие, например, мир Civ 3 до эпохи Звёздных Войн. Сколько карт под себя в редакторе делал - это вообще отдельная история. Ах да. И морские бои не совсем были отработаны. Тогда была ещё романтика - когда совершенно не угадывался результат боестолкновения, и линкор с одним очком жизни мог расстрелять в упор аналогичных линкор с полным запасом "здоровья". В общем, впечатлений хватило на всю жизнь. Того же желаю и вновь приобщающимся. Удачи!

review:
I really wanted to get into this game. My brother has it and wanted me to play with him. I got it, and noticed it suffered from frquent crashes on my machine (even after going on countless forums and looking for answers there), no multi-monitor support (I couldn't move the camera to the left without moving my mouse off of the screen), and I found it to be a chore to even attempt to try to get it working (from y'know, the frequent crashing and such). It looks like a fun game, but that doesn't matter if the game just simply doesn't work.










But who knows? Might just be a problem on my machine...

author: {'steamid': '76561198272691901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1472265666}
review: There pretty much isn't a bad game in this strategy franchise. The concept is simple: Pick your civ, play through history, win... But the execution is VERY complex. You win in different ways depending on which country you are and which does what. If you try to dominate the world as a civ that specializes in researching technology, Well you're gonna have a bad time. You could be doing amazing for a few hours and a few hundred turns into the game, but make one bad decision or one bad move and you could cripple your empire. This game has hours among hours of replayability and content, and it's relatively cheap. If you get it on sale it's dirt cheap. And I personaly think this Civ is a little easier to pick up and learn then Civ 5, but maybe not everyone will agree with me. But this is a true gem in the strategy genre. Easily a must own for any fan. 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025297465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 269906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164344, 'last_played': 1496286499}
review:
I share my steam account with my Dad. 
He plays only one game - Civilization III.
He's clocked in over 4000 hours on this game. 
He plays it religiously and has recently gotten my uncle (who is the same age as him) addicted to it as well.

Let's just say my mom and my cousin's mom aren't very happy with them being addicted.

Mom and Aunt: "How can you even keep playing this game over and over again? Don't you get tired?"
Dad and Uncles's response "You must understand. I'm getting civilized"

11/10 - Get Civilized. Play Civilization III.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970705205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 12347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11415, 'last_played': 1675196578}
review:
Watch out, this game will steal your time. Spend it wisely in life.

Game is great, it is very easy to edit, making an empty "Scenario" and writing new rules for everything. It makes this fun.

Lots of options, and the computer is not a cheating one like in Civ2 so you can keep it at stoneage if you want to.

 I wish it had some of the ideas of Civ4, but the graphics on this one are better. Indeed I think the graphics have only gotten more tacky and childish from Civ1 to Civ5.

review:
One of my favorite games. 

If you haven't played this and are a fan of later titles, I'd say it's worth picking up. I prefer this one over newer titles myself, but that might be partially nostalgia. Either way, it's a classic.

Come to think of it more, one of the main reasons I prefer this game over later titles is because I feel each leader's dialogue is unique and adds personality to the world. In the fourth and fifth game the dialog in the diplomacy screen isn't as interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191900387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1697294122}
review:
Ещё одна нежно и необъяснимо любимая на территории РФ игровая франшиза. Цивилизация, заглянув на огонёк второй частью в игровые клубы и редкие, тогда, классы информатики, покорила сердца многих игроков. Масштабная стратегия-песочница с пошаговым режимом и почти неограниченными возможностями. Где ещё вы сможете провести племя Ацтеков от древнейших времен к космическим достижениям? Где ещё можно управлять Россией на протяжении тысяч лет от лица Ильича? Только здесь, в гениальнеом творении Сида Мейера.
 Третья часть расползлась уже куда шире своей предшественницы, и грозилась отобрать лавры "ну ещё часок!" у Diablo 2. Графика переместилась в изометрическую трёхмерность, вырвиглазная палитра сменилась на более приятные цветовые сочетания, а юниты обрели хоть какую-то индивидуальность в виде. Вот только суть ни на йоту не изменилась - вы бессмертный вождь, и ведёте свою нацию к господству. Как вы это делаете - уже другой вопрос. Можно стравливать между собой соседей, можно вести экономическое давление, а можно попробовать закидать оппонента "шапками", устроив старый добрый раш. И всё это, при должной прямоте рук, работает - можно даже вести войну на несколько фронтов, и почувствовать себя одним австрийским неудавшимся художником. Вот только стоит принять условности, что население не будет радо затягиванию поясов при любом политическом строе, отряд копейщиков из Франции запинает вашу великую зулусскую ядерную ракету, а в Пекине окажутся разом Пирамиды, Эйфелева башня и вообще штаб-квартира ООН. Свобода выбора, ничего не попишешь.
 Но несмотря на кучу условностей, именно третья Цивилизация, без кучи странностей и свистоперделок, является эталоном серии уже более десятка лет.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041063398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1454566922}
review:
Date: 2/2/16
Review Number: 7
Game: Sid Meier’s Civilization III
From (Creator Publisher): Firaxis / 2k games
Played On: Laptop
Steam Price as of Review: $4.99
Total Time played: 60 minutes
Review:

I had been waiting for this game, and really I was surprised that it came up so quickly in the randomizer.  Now, I have been a fan of the civilization series for well over a decade and a half, since the first version came out on PC, and have played it in one form or another almost constantly between then and now, and on nearly every console or PC I have owned.  That being said, more often than not the versions I have played have either been first generation games or one of the many free clones, so it was a treat to be able to play one of  the games I haven’t played yet.

Now, I have to admit that spending only an hour on any civilization game isn’t quite enough to have an adequate run with the game, but I still intend to give it a review based on that limited experience.  The gameplay is solid, though Civilization has a steep learning curve, providing little in terms of understanding asset management and growth.  This version does allow workers to auto-update the surrounding areas around the cities, so some of the more mundane tasks of the earlier versions are removed ,at least to an extent, however the controls around individual units have been reduced to a sort of drag and drop system, which can get confusing, especially when requiring units to change direction mid order.  The graphics are about what you can expect from a fifteen year old civilization game, though units are easily enough distinguished from each other, there isn't much else there in terms of fancy looks.  But then again, that isn’t why you’re playing.  Instead, you’re playing to feel the inexorable crushing defeat of having your little peaceful civilization on the  corner of the map overrun by whoever is the aggressive one of the AI monsters.  You play to waste time clicking on your cities each turn to watch the build counters drop.  You play to try, and fail, to understand why your citizens in just that one city won’t shut the fuck up about taxes.  I mean, come on, every other city is okay with it.  You really don’t have much to complain about.  So why riot?  I certainly wouldn’t know.

Game’s Fate: This one will remain, and probably take up all my spare game playing time, at least until another one of the series comes up in the randomizer to replace it.
Buy/No Buy: Does Ghandi love Nukes?  you damn right you should buy this

author: {'steamid': '76561197967718132', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1453876689}
review:
The Steam edition of Civilization III does not work correctly on Windows 7, which kind of defeats the purpose I had in getting it to begin with. Unlike the retail CD version of the game from years ago, it installs without hassle. What it doesn't do without hassle is run correctly. Every time I've started a game, I've encountered audio bugs where the music stops and the sound effects run an in endless loop like crickets. Heaven forbid you ever try to quit the game, either, because it will not only crash, but lock up your entire monitor and not let task manager launch over it.

If a game is going to be sold on steam, I expect some kind of work to be done to make it compatible with current operating systems. If Gog.com can do it, so can Valve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031691896', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 11129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7664, 'last_played': 1644012860}
review:
I don't understand why modern game developers (and a large portion of modern gamers) are so hell-bent on graphical perfection at the expense of actual content. Part of the beauty of this game for me has always been its balance of graphics,  being easy to navigate, and its underlying mechanics. 

To me, this will always be the pinnacle of the Civilization series. 

I don't know how many hours of my life went into playing this game since I started out with the CD version before buying a copy on steam when I lost the orginal disc, but I doubt I'll find another game that can entertain me for as long as this one did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102051668', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1523059983}
review:
Sid Meier's Civilization III is a turn-based conquering game that is really fun to play.
 
  Before you actually start the game, you need to choose the kind of world you want, such as choosing the size, the weather and the planet's age, after that you must choose one of the many available nations to play with, each having their unique traits.

  You can play with bots or real-life players, choosing the team in which you want them and yourself to be, thus having allies and enemies in combat.

  And as a final note, don't stare too much at the leaders, or else they are going to consume your soul, except for Theodora of course! <3

  Therefore I recommend this game to everyone interested on strategy games! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198031474038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1453396051}
review:
Civ 3 is a classic, turn-based, strategy game that pretty much set the standard for this sort of game.
Time has passed, and there are newer games that you can play (including newer Civilization games), but for those who played this one: it still holds a place in their hearts.

For those who have never played this one, you can probably skip this edition. Not only are there many things that feel dated, but the newer Civ games refine this formula in almost every way, making this one obsolete.

--- No score ---

author: {'steamid': '76561198097675196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1452112337}
review:
So many many many years ago I played the first CIV game. I loved it. Barely understood it as I was too young but I loved it. Lost the game at some point and didn't play the other CIV games until I bought CIV4 during a Steam sale. While the graphics improved a lot from the first game I did not enjoy the game as much. It was rather simple and straight forward. So now during another sale I decided to buy CIV3 as a lot of people are saying it's the  best version. A few hours in and I have to say I like this one better then 4. The game is a bit more challenging even on easy mode and I am just having a fun time creating my own civilizations. That however doesn't mean there aren't any downsides. Some things do not make sense like older units being stronger then newer units. Then there is the little glitch that you will constantly be aware of and that is that it looks like the game is freezing at the end of every turn. It just freezes for a few seconds and then continues but it is a bit of a pain. So far I have no had it shut down on me completely like I am reading in other peoples reviews but who knows it might just happen at some point. Honestly for the money I paid for it I won't complain much. It would have cost me more to get the cd version though I wouldn't have the glitch. My opinion? Totally worth playing and if you don't mind waiting a few seconds at the end of every turn get the steam version. If you do then buy the cd version. Have a lot of fun with it! 

P.S. having the chance to build your own castle is something I missed in CIV 4 glad to see it in CIV 3 :)

review:
I played several hundred hours of this game before it came to Steam.  Steam wouldn't let me import the old disk copy I had so I bought it again, hence the pathetically low hour count.

That being said, this is my favorite of the Civ games.  Simplistic, basic, and at the roots of all things Civ.  Downright fun and addicting, there is nothing more I can say except that you should buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090650360', 'num_games_owned': 460, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 3358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1578292991}
review:
This is the first Civilization game that I have ever played. And I have nothing but pleasant memories about it.

It includes all the basic mechanics that define a Civ game. But it hasn't aged very well. The interface is archaic and it's all 2D (except for leader animations). Not that it matters much for a strategy game, but still. 

Civ4 and Civ5 have much more to offer, so it's probably worth playing Civ3 only for nostalgic value. Although, I miss palace customisation and City View with wonders in the later games. Another cool feature is that the leader appearance and title change with each next era

Anyway, if you can get over occasional crashes, you will still spend hours building your empire, but, as I've said, with newer version on the market, Civ3 is mostly for veterans and those who'd like a more challenging game than Civ5.

My overall rating: 7/10

(-2 for crashes, -1 for not being as good as Civ5)

author: {'steamid': '76561198150978518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1663424935}
review:
This game is dated, and while it does run on the more modern OS's out there, it isn't well optimized.  I found the game running at a steady 8 frames per second on my old Windows 8 machine.  However, most gamers here use PCs powered by 32 gigs of ram and NVIDIA's latest graphics card which requires the heat of the sun to forge properly, so it might run better on your Windows 7 or 8 computer.

The game itself was a staple in my childhood.  I had many hours of fun with it, even though I sucked at it as a kid.  Now, I can lay out a strategy, and retaliate easily when the enemy declares war.

The game itself has quite a bit going on.  You have to balance your gold economy, which can be a challenge as you progress in scientific research, military power, and additions to your city.  You have to make use of the terrain around you, which itself can be a gamble.  You might get everything you need under one generated map, and then get completely fucked by another generated map.  There is a lot to cover, most of which I'll leave you to see for yourself.

In the end, there's a lot of content, and for its current price, its a great game.  If you like strategy games, then you'll probably love this game.  9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126533418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 273140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14508, 'last_played': 1708004656}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198123421671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7966, 'last_played': 1642960289}
review:
It may seem a bit anemic compared to the later installments but I find CivIII is still worth picking up to at least try if you're a Civ fan.

While not deep, this 4x experience is very refined, you really do have to play exactly to your Civ's strengths if you want any hope to succeed in the higher difficulties- there is no real catch all method. People may have complained about bombardment and bombers being Op since they can straight up kill units but I find this adds a lot more tactical complexity to war, especially in the mid Ind. age where it really reflects how much warfare at that time was based around defensive positions.

The campaigns within are straight up the best of any vanilla Civ game, Rise of Rome, the Middle Ages and the Age of Discovery are excellent, and hell the Pacific Theatre almost could've been its own game!

Finally, it may be a personal thing, but I've always preferred the isometic display here to the 3d graphics of 4, 5 and Beyond.

And as a small side note, because of how cheap this game is now it can be an effective litmus test to see if you'll even enjoy Civ games, so there's that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141707054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 12292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6882, 'last_played': 1579370434}
review:
The game is price worthy.

If you have alot of extra time on your hands, this game is for you.

The music, although limited, is great.

Scenarios are fun to play.

I've played Civ III off steam alot, so my hours on Sid Meiers games is actually quite inaccurate. I had bought Civ III previously off of steam- then I hoped that buying it off steam I could find other civ III fanatics who I could play with online. Unfortunately, it was difficult to find one. There are some things in Civ III that compare better than do civ II, IV, and V. 

-Attacking units is more exiting and not deterministic. There is a random seed option that allows battles to be different every time.
-If you play the game long enough, you'll see a spearman successfully defending against a tank. Funny but only to your own detriment.
-Game is feels fulfilling

What I particularly got from Civ III is that it has no cheating console- so you can't exatly put warriors all over the map and destroy everyone before they found their first city. This forces the player to actually play the game- it took me a little while to get used to it. Eventually I got used to the fact that I couldn't cheat and I actually had to play a fair game. This game taught me that cheating is less fun than actually playing the game. I'd like to thank the creators and actually the game itself - without it, it would have been a while longer before realizing cheating is not as fun as I thought.

Also, friend me if you would like to play a little good game of Civ III sometime. ^

author: {'steamid': '76561198078138461', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1683348527}
review:
Cada serie do jogo Civilization , reserva suas particularidades e desenvolvem um dom específico em quem joga.
A vontade alucinante de esperar o próximo turno para poder sair do jogo....e assim um ciclo viciante até você cair de sono em cima do teclado.

Civilization III dentre os outros da série é um dos meus favoritos, devido a sua mecânica leve e ao mesmo tempo se apresentando como um jogo extremamente complexo em suas entre-linhas.

Para os adoradores de estratégia 4X/ ou por turno, é um dos jogos que mais oferecem diversão.
Vale cada centavo.

review:
Even though civilization III ...
1) is actually a gussied up version of Empire (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Classic_Empire)
 2) is not the game that I thought (imagined) I was playing 3) when played strictly to win, the optimal gameplay is not fun and ignores most of the advanced features 4) will only leave you feeling dissapointed when you try the sequals and are dissapointed 5) Is so increadly engaging that you will play for DAYS AT A TIME imagining that it's a much better game than it actually is

One of the high points of gaiming history, almost good enough to be an achievement in the game Civilization

author: {'steamid': '76561198080664798', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1700456004}
review: Prabally one of the best turn based games out there. I remember pleading to my father as a child to give up his computer for a few hours so that i could make the Roman Tanks slaughter Aztec pikemen. I must have had four to five hundred hours into that game. Now, i am 14, have my own computer, and the disk seems to not support Windows 10. I went to Humble Bundle and got this for $1.25 and it works almost perfectly. I did have a crash for a custom game, and when i finished a nine hour game at the congradulations screen it crashed, BUT it plays just fine all the rest. One of the best parts of this game is the World War 2 built in mod. It is really well done. If you have played any of the newer Civilization games and you want to see the earlier titles, go for this one. In my opinion Civ 3 is the best Civ game in the series, followed closely by Civ 4

author: {'steamid': '76561198048764875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2677, 'last_played': 1437242438}
review:
An old one, I can see why it was well liked when it first came out. Not so aged that it is horrible now, but cheap and worth the price. I decided to first try out the series with this one recently and I enjoyed the game. Enough that I am looking to play 4 in the near future.

The army movement and combat isn't deep, but there is enough that you need to be sure where you want the armies to go and make sure you have enough strength at the places you need them. Otherwise you can lose land to an invasion you weren't prepared for. Tech trees are nice, lots of tech through the different ages, some of which reward being the first to research it. The wonders have some game influence, so they are not just decorations. Like all empire games you need to manage your resources between development, research and military. You can also make land, sea and air units as they become available

author: {'steamid': '76561198117244154', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1446290939}
review:
Żałuje, że nie miałam okazji wcześniej dołączyć do serii Sid Meier’s Civilization. Pierwsza część, z jaką się spotkałam to V i ona pozostaje w moim guście najlepsza! Jak miałabym cofnąć się w czasie o 14 lat, to na pewno Civ III zrobiłby na mnie dużo lepsze wrażenie niż dziś.
W moim przypadku, po przegranej grze, program przestaje odpowiadać i się wyłącza. Kupiłam ją za grosze na G2A i ma mi służyć, jako gra, która zadziała na każdym nawet najgorszym komputerze i uratuje przed nudą po za domem – bardzo dobrze się sprawuję w ten sposób!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040191355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 171740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30180, 'last_played': 1693520733}
review:
Not without its bugs and problems, but still a very fun game to play. Civ3 is easily of the best civilization games made (in my opinion). Even better than civ5. While newcomers from later civs may have trouble adapting to this game, if given time, it will grow on you. After playing out the main game, mods and scenarios will continue to take up your time and amaze how much can be accomplished with just a simple and easy to use editor.

If you have problems installing and playing this game, dont worry the game works great even with steam. I see other users having problems with steam installation and modern operating systems, but the game does actually work fine it just may need a few tweaks depending on the issue. I myself have never had a single issue on Windows 7 (apart from if in a long session for several hours, like 3+, there's a possibility of it crashing, but this is minor and can be quite common on other games as well) using the steam version (I also have the disc version which works fine being on the same computer with the steam copy).

author: {'steamid': '76561197997502024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3656, 'last_played': 1684684357}
review:
Bought this originally when PC games came out in those big square boxes, and to be fair it does show its age. The graphics aren't enivable at all because, well, it is nearly 14 years old. It crashes sometimes too. There is quite a learning curve, but after a while you do get through it. The AI is random or too predictable at times, if they plop a stack randomly into your territory and refuse to leave, they're 90% going to declare war. Playing on easier levels, outsmarting the AI is fairly formulaic, aggressive expansion for the first half, strategically stealing all resources and then ploughing through them all. Small maps are too small, and if you create a massive map (which you can do in the editor, which itself has a learning curve) there is a city limit of 450. The game reaches its limit, but by that point each turn is so long, why bother. Naval conflict is always a bit piddly too. 

But really the base game has a simple enough format that its almost like a PC version of Monopoly. You can play it again and again, no fancy 3D experience or anything, the graphics really don't impede gameplay. 14 years later its still perfectly playable and, importantly, provides a fun and varied experience. Each game comes out wildly different from the last one, and every time you play a new challenge will arise. The randomized earths created offer nearly infinite variety and eliminate any boredom you could experience with similar games. I can easily play this game for hours and hours. Similar to Paradox games, once you start a campaign its hard to finish, there is enough variety in maps you always want to do something else. Games can easily go far into the future, and with some mods you can add some variety onto the existing game's timeline. 

9/10 game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198164670347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1477005432}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069244438', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 4296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1702553856}
review: I still hold that this is the best Civilization that Firaxis ever did.  It's beautiful, it's intricate, it's on a proper grid of squares instead of those weird hexagons, it's got a community that makes total conversion mods that nothing for Civ V can compare to, it's perfect in every way.  Just play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054039478', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 3584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3094, 'last_played': 1490159276}
review:
I'm going to start by saying I'm not a strategy 4X kind of guy. I'm terrible at them. This one is no exception. Additionally, I bought this a week before losing internet for an extended period of time, so my hours are waaay off.

That being said, I've been playing since 2011 when I was looking for cheap games on Steam. To my surprise, I noticed one of the five dollar games had a 90/100 on Metacritic whereas many other games had a 70/100 at best (I cared about Metacritic back then, sue me.) so I knew I just had to have it. I had no idea what I was getting into.

To this day, this one of my most cherished purchases on Steam, and by far my favorite strategy game EVER. I played Civ 5 for a bit, but despite its evergrowing modding scene, I always come back to this one. The graphics still look good to this day (Save for the civ portraits, and dated resolutions. Yuck), and the music will forever dominate space on my music player of choice. 

Buy it at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108924570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1663, 'last_played': 1494829556}

author: {'steamid': '76561198152529939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 5665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5513, 'last_played': 1444669706}
review:
My first civ game: bought it dirt cheap during some Steam sale just to see what the series was all about. Turns out this one is so old it is unplayable - I spent 50+ hours getting my head around the basics and made it to a hard-earned "space race" victory, only to get an error message at the victory screen. Game crashed to desktop, no victory registered, had to restart from an older saved game. Got the same result again, discovered the error was not a one-off thing! None of the suggested workarounds on the internetz worked for me (.hof file didn't have any read only restrictions, tried changing the victory video file, switched to game's default resolution etc.). I reloaded the last save and went for domination this time, and boom - crash on the victory screen again. 80+ hours now, and while I will admit it was fun while I was learning the game, the lack of the satisfaction from registering any victories is seriously disappointing.

The only good that came out of my investment was that I discovered that the series CAN be fun when it works. I bought Civ V recently; I hope that game works without any hitches like the ones that I suffered in Civ 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026329103', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2616, 'last_played': 1592622944}
review: This is the game that started my love of the Civilization series, and strategy games in general.   I have fond memories sitting down and spending hours playing this game, even though I didn't fully understand it's mechanics at the time.  As I grew older, this was my favorite game for a number of years.  This game holds it's own in just about every key aspect, even compared to the newer installments of the Civilization series.  Online multiplayer? You bet!  Unique mechanics and smart AI for it's age? Yup! Good graphics for a game made in 2001? Heck yes!  The replay value of this game makes even Civ 5 blush.  I've been playing this game since 2006, and I still never get bored of it.  Every scenario pans out differently, and no two games are ever quite the same.  Even to this day, I prefer this over Civ 5.  Maybe it's the nostalgia talking, but this is definitely my favorite Civ game of the lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111847113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1443778910}
review:
--My review is done from the viewpoint of having played the iOS version of Civilization: Revolution--

Thanks to playing Revolution, I had some idea of how everything would work.  I do recommend finding tutorials on this if you've never played anything Civ before.  http://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/3910/manuals/manual.pdf?t=1400366001  This seems to be a very complete version of the manual, maybe to such a degree as to be an overload of information, but it should be useful in addressing issues.

My first impression is that it is a good game, with a decent balance between depth and simplicity in the gameplay.  It is not so overwhelming as to completely kill any hopes of learning how it works, but it is no walk in the park either.  If you prefer simplicity though, you're better off playing Revolution.

I enjoyed the half-hour that I spent playing it, and I'll hopefully get some more time in every now and again.  When I do, I'll try and update this review with more details.

So to sum it up, it's a good game, fair level of complexity, if you prefer simplicity, play Revolution instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102550167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1447544559}
review: Brutal yes. Un fair yes. Fun absolutely yes. This game will make you get so angry as you get horribly wrecked time and time again. There is a steep learning curve to climb to just survive in the brutal world of civ. Everytime you overcome a new obstacle you surmount another one will come up. You sort of just learn your strategy as you go with this game. 10/10 would submit myself to the pain again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042176626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 27872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 263, 'playtime_at_review': 3985, 'last_played': 1710811351}
review:
For me, this is my favorite Civ game of the series. I like the whole series in gernal but think the ones after this get too complex and the one's before this were still a bit too simple. This one fits the right level of fun and complexity for me.

I've been playing since the original so the UI doesn't seem that complex, but I could see player's who never played a Civ game having some troubles. I do think the Civ guide in game though explains well what everything does.

If you like a slow strategy game, I think you could find yourself playing this for 20 hrs straight like I just found myself doing :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198008260349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1535072398}
review: Civilization is the best strategy (none space) 4x game ever made, I love all the Civ games, and Civ3 Call to Power is my favorite, unfortunately it's not avalible on Steam. but none of the Civ games are bad, and this one is also really good, even it's quite old now and the graphics might suck a bit, but these kind of games are not played because of graphics, they are played because of strategy and tactics, then the graphics  doesn't really matter. because it's all about the game play. Civilization 3 is also very light on your computer, so if you don't have the latest monster machine, Civ 3  will run smoothly on your rig. I have ran this game on an old pentium 4 without problems. definitely recommend it. Civ3 is just as deep as Civ 5, it's only older and doesn't look as good, I love Civ 5 to death but sometimes it's nice with some variation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133726587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1443045091}
review:
Years ago I owned this game, and had long lost it. It was a game I liked and so when I found here on Steam, I figured it would be worth it to get it again. 

Publishers shouldn't sell things that they are too lazy to tweek to modern comps / operating systems. Should players really have to google fixes for all the slightly older games sold here? IF a publisher released something for free, no update would be understandable. On games where they charging though, take the 10 mins to update the code so it runs ok vs making playing spend much longer fixing it.

I'm running windows 7, and when I start a new Civ3 game, I start with 7 duplicate leaders of my Civ. I have no idea why 7 Abraham Lincolns are doing running around, and with a big bug right from the get go, I have no trust of the game. I did google for it and couldnt find anything for it. After spending 30 mins googling and fixing other things just to get the game going and then going in windowed mode, that was enough. With the 2 hour limit on playtime for refunds, I am not going to push my luck on a game with questionable functionality.

I tapped out at 46 min and submitted for a refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033771227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 7880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1305, 'last_played': 1707772178}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057394497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 24687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21926, 'last_played': 1532500651}
review:
ive spent hundreds of hours expanding the german empire, wiping out the human population with my vastly superior military technology. panzers vs muskets. nukes versus cannons.
I overtook europa, then swept through asia and africa in one foul swoop. the bolshevik menace is dead and bleeding, while japan slaughters the chinese and overtakes the pacific and australia.
the global blitzkrieg soon smashed though the new world, annihilating the capitalistic American pigs. 
the mushroom clouds of the deutch nuclear doomsday device rises above new york, Los Angeles, DC, Moskow, and Mecca
I am drunk on power.
drunk on the deaths of hundreds of millions of digital innocents.
when will the senseless slaughter stop?
when I see the impossible outcome of the civilization ive built up crumble beneath my feet from the inside, the fate so many empires before me have faced... the last society left on this planet...
the end of civilization...3

author: {'steamid': '76561198009479699', 'num_games_owned': 4287, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1906, 'last_played': 1359014400}
review:
I enjoyed the game what has not already been said by other people.  The gameplay has a sharp learning curve and can be very simple or complicated depending on difficulty and what outcome you want to achieve.  You can destroy those that oppose you and wipe them from the face of the earth or you can be a man of peace.  It's up to you.  Compared the previous titles,  It has improved dramitically,  I have played some of the newer titles, have gone back to this one from time to time for a more simplistic gameplay.  Even if you own the newer titles honestly I would highly reccomend buying this one,  If you want a change of pace from the newer ones, or just want to see how things have changed.

Like other Civ games be careful you don't Lose track of time, because sometimes  you can get lost in the empire building.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076398749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1479887755}
review:
I own this game on disc, as well as on Steam. My hours do not reflect my actual play time.

 When I first started playing this game, I was sitting in my grandparents living room. I sat for several hours untill I had the game all figured out. At one point, I was thinking out loud a little too loudly and I burst out "WE ARE AT WAR WITH GERMANY!!!!!" My grandmother looked at me from around a corner with a shocked look on her face. "What? What are we gonna do now?" She was in a state of panic for a few seconds.

 Had to explain to her that I was just playing a game and that she didn't have to warn her Jewish friends(Too soon?)

 This game is a turn based game in which you control one of many civilizations in an effort to dominate the world. You start out with one city and very little technology. Over time, you become the dominant ruler of the world in the year 2000, along with your allies Gengis Kahn and Ghandi. You take out your final enemy only to find that Ghandi has nuked EVERYTHING YOU HOLD DEAR!

666/10, Would scare a Granny again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077881133', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 57359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 37, 'playtime_at_review': 17796, 'last_played': 1710721578}
review:
Played this since I was like 7 and got it on steam after losing the disk for x years. It's still as fun as ever, but not really sure if I can recommend it to the uninitiated.
 - There's a huge learning curve to all Civilization games.
 - This game doesn't offer much the other Civilization games do not.
 - This one is especially hard to get into.

Here's why I have so many hours here: it boasts a 10/10 user friendly scenario editor. This is how I got started modding and making games, and even in 2018 it's still something I like to go back and visit sometimes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123533135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1697527253}
review:
Ja, der gute alte Sid, 95% von ihm san en Hit.
Mit dieser Version, steht Dir ne Menge Fun,
zu einem fairen Preis ins Haus, Du erkennst
ja nen faieren Preis: *g
Für SparFüchse der beste Einstieg in die
Civ-Welt!

Eins meiner ersten PC-Spiele nach dem
Abschied vom Amiga,

Das allererste, war Age of Empires.

Wenn der Preis HOT, ist greif gleich zu
CIV 5, abba CIV 3 sollte net fehlen *schmunzel:

A Fan - is a Fan

Mega-Stunden an Spelspass sind
garantiert: solo und online!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019158651', 'num_games_owned': 374, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 120040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2930, 'last_played': 1707890186}
review:
I played this game when I was younger, and enjoyed it to the point that by the time I burnt the CD out - it was around the year 5000AD and me [Germany], America, Egypt, India were all that was left - Super states having had numerous nuclear wars. Europe had turned into a desert thanks to the global warming, America had conquered the entire Western Hemisphere, Egypt - all of Africa. 

Our militaries had become so large, so advanced, and the nuclear wars so constant that we eventually found ourselves in a deadlock - slowly starving, rotting away with the time. Our capitals had long been wiped away - eventually, wars were no longer profitable, the resources had run out. 

I played that game until the CD had finally quit on me, determined to see the end of the world. Compared to today, it may not be as flashy anymore - but Civilization III is the best of the series, Civilization IV comes at a close second, but things were removed and added in the later installments that made one feel like they had lost  a bit of the original game. I've since rebought it, and I'm already at 1,797.6 hours.

review: Probably my favourite of the Civilization series! An oldie but a goodie. It's simpler than Civ IV, and still has loads to do. Plus it's based on the old square tile system instead of the hexagonal system, which is great for if you're not used to turn-based strategy gameplay. Finally, this game has absolutely wonderful music that doesn't get old. Especially when you hit the modern era and end up watching 100+ bombers blow the countryside to smithereens.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056024739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 5287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1683504792}

author: {'steamid': '76561198186603317', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 427686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7880, 'last_played': 1707914111}
review:
From the very beginning, every mainline edition of the Civilization series has gotten an average of a 90-95% user approval rate which is a greater approval rate than that normally ascribed to civilization itself. This could be due to the fact that the Civilization seies simply soars while civilization itself seems to soar and stink in equal measure. Then again, it could be that the game of Civilization simply appeals to the inner narcissist lurking somewhere within us all. After all, how often is it you can be elected ruler of your nation by popular acclaim, rule them in a governmental form of your choice, eventually rise to rule to world, establish Earth's first off world colony, and live for centuries. I have to admit that is slightly more ambitious than my own real world expectations, but I do have an eye on the North American continent. Consider yourself warned.

Now don't get me wrong here. I am not trying to say that Civilization is the best turn based, civ building, strategy game ever. That would be unfair to all those games I have not gotten around to trying. What I can say is that it is by far the best I have ever played, and narcissist that I am, I will try most anything that gives me a shot at world domination.

The Civilization series is up to Civ-5 at this point, but Civ-3 is a game which endures the times, remains comparable to like games of more recent production, and holds a special place in my heart when compared to the newer versions of this long running classic. Later editions of this game introduce elements which alter the play style and base strategy of the game, but while I believe that Civ-4 & 5 remain true to the original construct to a large degree, it is Civ-3 which most closely  resembles the original. In fact, it is exactly like the original, but with greater user options, and smoother game play. 

If you have been thinking about giving this series a try, Civ-3 is a great place to start. With the release of Civ-5, the Steam price for Civ-3 is a mere $5.00 which in my opinion makes it one of the best bargains in the entire Steam Library. Just one run through of this game will keep you occupied for longer than the run time of a long movie, and when was the last time you got into a movie theatre for &5.00 eh? I began playing this game when it first came out for PC in the 90's, continue to play it to this day, and played Civ-1 & 2 before that. How's that for a testament for long term replayability? I simply could not recommend another game of this type more highly.

review:
I can only say that this is just a great game.

If you haven't played a civ game before, you might have some trouble at the beginning and if you can't figure something out then you can find it on the internet.
But it's a known thing that older games often have steep learning curves

Anyways, this is the oldest civ game that you can curently buy without using emulators and such.
Even though it's old, it is stil a very good civ game that every civ fan must own.
The graphics are of cource not of this time but that doesn't matter at all.
It plays a bit difrent then the later civ games so it won't become boring at all.

I bought it at full price and it is worth even more!

9/10, it has a few minor issues but you probably won't even notice them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034238027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4151, 'last_played': 1651770840}
review: This game has, by far, taken more of time than any other.  In fact I am on my fourth, hopefully final, copy of it.  I orignally was gifted a 3 part CD version of the game from a neighbor who never was into computer games and did not want it.  I played CIV3 nonstop, I would sit in class fantasizing about the game, I would go to sleep dreaming about the game and I still to this day reminisce about specific games I had played close to ten years ago.  I was so hooked that my father took the discs and snapped them in half.  Months of stellar behavior later I managed to earn another copy on my birthday, which was quickly destroyed a month later due to an average of ten hours a day, and 16 hours on the weekend.  I was able to get another disc copy without my parents knowing but I could not control my addiction, causing them to find out about my new copy and promptly destorying it.  Now, able to do things on my own, I bought my latest version on steam for no other reason that I do not feel complete without knowing I have it.  Honestly, this game does not play as well as CIV5 but if you are looking for a changeup, buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093672754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1587233451}

author: {'steamid': '76561198125654898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 25224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24816, 'last_played': 1518187214}
review:
Decisamente un gran bel gioco, molto meglio di civ 4 e di civ 5 (del quale trovo decisamente orrida la grafica, ma anche per alcuni sistemi che decisamente non mi convincono), se si esclude il nuovo civ 6 (la cui recensione arriverà quando ci avrò preso una maggiore dimestichezza ma il cui primo feedback è estremamente positivo) è decisamente il miglior civilization in assoluto, con questa grafica retrò che sa di disegno che non è paragonabile a quella orribile un'po cartoonizzata di civ 5, rigiocabilità infinita o quasi, in sostanza se volete giocare a civilization o prendete questo bel civilization 3 oppure passate direttamente al nuovo civilization 6, i 2 in mezzo non meritano nulla a confronto.
P.s. E' perfettamente funzionante su windows 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065665393', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1382, 'last_played': 1668535129}
review:
O que falar do primeiro jogo que joguei em toda minha vida...daquele jogo em que jogo a 14 anos...Bom, é p seguinte, esse jogo é para quem tem paciência(com excessões, por exemplo meu pai, que joga a muito mais tempo que eu, e que ja quebrou inumeros teclados....kkkk) Trilha sonora perfeita, nas 2 primeiras eras você viaja...(eu escuto para dormir...), jogabilidade não e tãoooo complicada para um jogo de estratégia, como esse. É antigo, mas passa rasteira em muito jogo atual...inclusive eu prefiro o 3(esse) aos mais novos, como o 4 e o 5...Se vale a pena? muito...nem sei o que dizer direito, jogo desde meus 4 anos(logicamente não entendia tudo, so fazia o basico...) e com certeza jogarei até morre! Bom meus dois jogos do coração são Civilization 3 e CS GO, mas cá entre nós...eu prefiro o civ... kkkkkk

Recomendadíssimo!!! Como o gringo ali a baixo disse...just one more turn...

author: {'steamid': '76561197998273415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 1694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1694, 'last_played': 1628050667}
review:
[b]⊕[/b]this game received a much-needed update to get rid of the nonfunctioning Gamespy multiplayer! What a relief! This is my favorite installment of the Civ series. The game has a slew of nice preferences to choose from, even including an aid for the colorblind. More of a board game feel as opposed to strategy. STELLAR soundtrack.

[b]⊖[/b]New to the game? Go into the options and turn the tutorial on. It’s off by default for some reason. The cutscenes look horrible because of age and stretching. Resolutions are ROUGH. Compared to modern installments, the opponent civs act rather erratically, to the point of being nonsensical. There is no balancing, so some Civs are OP and others you would ideally never play.

[b]✎[/b]It's easy to lose track of time in Civ3. It's great fun and I think it hits a goldilocks zone of being more succinctly-designed than 4 or 5 but more appealing than 1 and 2. If you don’t have nostalgia for it though, it might just be the game you know and love but with less features.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094934846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1457381242}
review:
A great strategy game! It may be a bit outdated in graphics (the portraits of the leaders horrify me), but it still gives a great visual. My MAJOR complaint is how the tutorial is LOCATED IN THE PREFERENCES (options). And it's a mode for when you start up a new game. I wish they had just a mode of tutorials, because my first time was pretty rough. I had to figure out most of the mechanics, hell, I didn't even figure out that giving jobs to your citizens was a thing until I found the tutorial. 
8/10
Needs better tutorial systems and explainations on their "rules".

author: {'steamid': '76561198185871178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 891, 'last_played': 1471565241}
review:
From a humble start, hunting and gathering and establishing a small town.
To a vast empire, mighty armies, establishing diplomatic ties, building great wonder of time, and lunching a ship into deep space.
Civ 3 is a great game, and has aged relatively well. The game can seem a little overwhelming for a new comer, but once learned can be played easily. It certainly brings me back.
The combat system can cause problems. It’s based of attack and defense, so occasionally a unit with a weak defense will defeat a unit with a strong attack (spearman vs. tank and wins!).
Overall a great game! Totally worth the price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198133641767', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1417951003}
review: Разочарован! Я обожаю "цивилизацию", особенно 3-ю её часть, как увидел в стиме - купил сразу же. Но в стиме она какая-то странная. Нет русского языка и русика в руководсвах, я подумал: "ну да фиг с ним, всё равно в неё лет в 7 на английском играл до изобретения интернета и ничего ж, понимал!". Когда запустил карту Земли, сразу же окунулся в ностальгию, сказал: "Да, эта та самая цивилизация!". Но, спустя несколько минут увидел отсутствия кнопки обзора города, а так же не было надписи "люди счастливы и желают улучшить ваш дворец" (хотя уже дважды был золотой век). После 8-ми часов игры я всё же наконец задолбался, желая всё-таки нажать на кнопку "глаза"и осмотреть город, скачал с торрента НОРМАЛЬНУЮ, РУСИФИЦИРОВАННУЮ ЦИВИЛИЗАЦИЮ. Так что покупать не стоит. Но игра - О*****ая

author: {'steamid': '76561198129860702', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1432640519}
review:
Are you looking for a Time sink?

Here you are!

This is a basic turned based Real Time Strategy game based around building a civilation from a tribal state to a modern age.

The Charm of this game really comes from your opponates, how they'll mock you, or try to threaten you to give them what they want. You can completely civil, or you can be a thorn in everyone's side, which can get to the point of the entire planet trying to destroy you.

A problem is that the mechanics can be confusing, heck it took me a solid three hours of reading to get a basic grasp on the game. but once you learn it, it's down, and it become second nature.

Another problem, if you can call it one, is that this game will burn hours of your life without your consent, seriously, you will play 4 hours stright and swear it was maybe 30 minutes.

8/10 
PROS:
Great RTS game play
Aged nicely
great freedom to choose

CONS:
Quite a few things to learn to even start playing
Will sink hours without you knowing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009210413', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1650269900}
review: The franchise is run through to the bitter end, with players opting for piracy and spacecraft without help or hail-mary, as the plot devolves unerringly to next advances in technology. The tech tree from Civilization II carried the throne room. In Civ III, the multiplayer and marginalised are in an open door to cultural centres around the world, egging on the tech-savvy, New York hipster, python coding sky rise. The introduction is the selling point. Closing on the propogandist last installment, Civilization V: Brave New World. Not everyone knows, but Huxley's Brave New World Revisited is a non-fiction debacle couched in a comfortable sequel for bugs from early adolescence to young adulthood. The gateway to television since Iraq is clouded by war still now, and today, a friendly reminder of our spiritual needs as anthropogists is as healthy as any Black Sabbath. Drugs tear families apart. But babies need drugs to grow. Weather control is a superpower. I recommend frequent save games with a friend

review: This phenomenal strategy game is mentally stimulating and epic, though I will admit it might not be very rewarding. Standard games usually took me days, and each of the hourse you're playing requires you be goal-oriented and considerate. Strategic resources, oceans and capturable units can be a pain, but I recommend this game to those who have a lot of free time. I suggest choosing small maps and few rivals.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977643373', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1431294523}
review:
2 options in this game. Trial and error in a game where nothing is connected. Or just google until you find out what ever it is you are supposed to do. 
There is no help in the game.
There is no advice.
I got destroyed by 15 barbarians on easiest game mode in 4 turns.

Do not waste time on this unless you are one of those wonderful few who enjoys reading 5 paragraphs of text about how best to utilize workers only to realize there is absolutely no explanation on how to use them or even make them. 2 turns in and city starts burning, without fail. 
4 tries on easy mode and either I'm the dumbest creature to ever roam these parts or this game is a waste of money, take your pick.

oh, and turning sound off only turns off screen borders for some reason. So just endure the so called "music" if you play because if you try to mess with it you can't move the screen around anymore.
1/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198155393894', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1432532026}
review: Simplesmente perfeito! Lute contra diferentes nações na tentativa de defender a sua ou obter mais terras, mas é bom ter em mente que nem sempre você ganhará, se puder, faça de algumas nações, sua amiga. Defenda de seus inimigos e tente obter a terra deles ou de cidades com níveis baixos se você ainda não tiver muito alto. Produza coisas e veja o que é melhor pra sua nação, descubra novos territórios, capture os inimigos, construa estradas, poços... É exatamente isso esse jogo, além de ser bem viciante, por mais que você perca feio, você vai querer contiuar jogando!

author: {'steamid': '76561198145547913', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1708803266}
review: Classic game. It is true that third game in series is often the best one. One example is Heroes of Might and Magic, where 3rd game is for everybody most complex and enjoyable, another is Civilization. 3rd edition of this acclaimed strategic game series is the best in my opinion. It ads some great components (like borders, cultural expansion or great persons) but dont have some not so good stuff from next games (like religion for example). I spend with it so many hours that cant count and still playing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198059833540', 'num_games_owned': 759, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 3104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1642951564}
review:
小学时候接触的这款游戏，家里一个亲戚给我的天人互动公司代理的文明3汉化版光盘，当时还附赠了一本游戏指南，好像有一百页，已把此书翻烂！！！当时玩这游戏一直想把皇宫建完，但是一直没有实现T_T

经典之作！再次入正收藏之！

PS: 当时我用奔腾4 C，256M内存的机器跑这游戏完全不感到卡顿，除非有大量部队需要CPU计算的时候才会卡一下，但是操作的时候是绝对不卡的。不像现在的文明，卡死了T_T

review: Assolutamente perfetto. Non sono uno esperto della saga di Civilization, in quanto ho giocato solamente al terzo e a Beyond Earth (Che mi ha deluso non poco). Ma questo gioco è semplicemente perfetto. Rigiocabilità altissima, colonna sonora semplice, ma allo stesso tempo d'effetto. Certo il comparto grafico è un po' vecchiotto, ma è uno dei giochi che mi hanno tenuto attaccato allo schermo per il maggior numero di ore consecutive. Da prendere subito.

review:
One of my favourite games by far. This an old-ish addictive game that I couldn't live without; as it provides so much satisfaction when dominating your own civilization in any play style you want - expansionist, culturalist, scientific or perhaps miliatry based. The latter games in this series are bit more complicated and are almost as enjoyable, yet the simplicity of this game requires more skill to dominate.

GET THE RUSSIANS BEFORE THEY GET YOU

author: {'steamid': '76561198160416751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1429989325}
review:
Dont trust the one line fanboy reviews. This entire series is one those emperors new clothes type of games. No one wants to say how crap it really is because its a 'classic'. 

There is no strategy involved. It really doesnt matter what you do. You wait for your advisor to tell you what to build and you click ok. The game is very buggy. A strange glitch produces seven of your main characters eg 7 Queen elizabeths. It randomly crashes when attacking a city. 

The 'city view' has to be the single most pointless thing I have seen in any game. An identical view for each city that is of no use whatsoever. 

The cartoonish attempt at humour is just embarrasing and ruins the feel of the more serious stuff like the scientific research, that would have been interesting if it was more detailed. The AI are not funny or clever for that matter. 

If you like strategy and history this will not challenge you in any way, maybe get it for your kid?

author: {'steamid': '76561198018575640', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1709205270}
review:
This Review is dated from 27/03/2015

I love this game. It is one of the better Civ's. But i hate it on steam now. Ever since the new patch was released the game has been broken. I would not advise you to buy or download this game from steam, buy it on a disk and play from there. You will not be dissapointed from the disk release. You won't get:

- Lagging
- Screen Tearing
- The game will actually work
- The game Speeding up so that it is unplayable
- The game crashing all the time

If steam patches the game to make it playable again, i will edit this review and give it a 10/10. For now, i will not give it any score by default due to coding errors which render it unplayable.

Thumbs Down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070198949', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 1839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1616893832}
review:
Однозначно, лучшая часть Цивилизации, и вообще одна из моих самых любимых игр. По всем параметрам лучше первой и второй частей и по большей части - опопсившихся четвёртой и пятой.

Интересный геймплей, живой мир и абсолютная реиграбельность - черты, благодаря которым игра, возможно, никогда вам не надоест. Графика весьма на уровне для 2001 года, и, в принципе, относительно сносно выглядит и сейчас. Наличие исторических справок и сценариев, основанных на реальных событиях, делает игру не только увлекательной, но и познавательной. Из явных минусов можно отметить только две вещи, на которые, как складывается впечатление, просто забили: слабо проработанный дизайн и отсутствие адекватного музыкального сопровождения. Что дизайн, что музыка состоят из, как правило, слабо сочетающихся друг с другом элементов, что не шибко способствует погружаемости; или наоборот - из зацикленного короткого шаблона, из-за которого болят глаза или уши.

Если говорить о геймплее, третья цивилизация - идеальная стратегия. Точнее, удачное объединение трёх стратегий сразу - экономической, военной и политической. Игроку предстоит просчитывать ход дальнейших событий на несколько шагов вперёд и действовать исходя из них - заключать выгодные в будущем союзы, перебрасывать войска к будущей линии фронта, возводить нужные в будущем строения. К сожалению, в следующих частях эта часть геймплея - особенно экономическая - была значительно упрощена и ухудшена. Например, в пятой части даже нет такого понятия, как коррупция в отдалённых от столицы или слабо развитых городах.

В тактической, более прикладной составляющей - конкретных сражениях или переговорах - всё уже не так интересно. Я бы не назвал эту часть геймплея провальной, но она могла быть намного лучше. Например, бои относительно пятой части серии выглядят достаточно унылыми: если в пятой исход сражения во многом зависит от расстановки войск и порядка действий, то в третьей бои большей частью ведутся "стенка на стенку", а там - как рандом выпадет; и вообще, исход сражения зависит скорее от стратегических действий в масштабе всего мира, нежели от тактических в масштабе одного поля битвы. Короче говоря, игра акцентирована на стратегии, а не на тактике.

В остальном же игра идеальна. Очень радует, что её не забыли до сих пор: возможность играть через Steam даёт ей шанс на новую жизнь. Настоятельно советую купить и опробовать всем, кто хоть немного ощущает себя любителем пошаговых стратегий или какой-то игры из серии в частности.

P.S: для комфортной игры на больших экранах попробуйте открыть файл \conquests\conquests.ini в папке с игрой и добавить туда строчку "KeepRes=1". В этом случае игра должна работать в том разрешении, которое у вас стоит в настройках системы.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093074150', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1609682689}
review:
The more you play it, the more you realize it is the strategy equivelent to Dark Souls.
Guess Playing this in my childhood is what makes me a glutton from punishment.
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197963736646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8110, 'last_played': 1426259693}
review: I love Civ III.  I didn't like having to search for my CD to play it every time, or find the original CDs every time I wanted to install it on a new computer.  $5 later, I have Civ III Complete on Steam now!  Way more convenient, fully patched, works flawlessly.  If you are still messing around with your old version on CDs do yourself a favor and just grab the Steam version.  Considering how many hours you are going to put into it, you deserve it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012309790', 'num_games_owned': 1036, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 1310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1299, 'last_played': 1507251410}
review:
Are you looking for a Time sink?

Here you are!

This is a basic turned based Real Time Strategy game based around building a civilation from a tribal state to a modern age.

The Charm of this game really comes from your opponates, how they'll mock you, or try to threaten you to give them what they want. You can completely civil, or you can be a thorn in everyone's side, which can get to the point of the entire planet trying to destroy you.

A problem is that the mechanics can be confusing, heck it took me a solid three hours of reading to get a basic grasp on the game. but once you learn it, it's down, and it become second nature.

Another problem, if you can call it one, is that this game will burn hours of your life without your consent, seriously, you will play 4 hours stright and swear it was maybe 30 minutes.

8/10 
PROS:
Great RTS game play
Aged nicely
great freedom to choose

CONS:
Quite a few things to learn to even start playing
Will sink hours without you knowing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090462379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 52226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3530, 'last_played': 1643323743}

Excelente juego, el concepto de un Civilization perdura. Lo único en lo que falla es el código en las batallas es muy raro. Aveces pierdes aveces ganas aún teniendo una buena unidad militar y elevada a grado Élite o Élite*.

author: {'steamid': '76561198175898551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 494353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6419, 'last_played': 1660781778}
review:
So much replay value.  If you didn't play this back in the day you may find issues with it.  But if you like to play a game where you are always saying, "I'll just play one more turn..." and you look at the clock and you have to be at work in two hours, this is for you.  
If you like sleep, not for you.  
Tons of mods out there too, so you can mix it up.

review: This game is a classic and a great one at that! I have spent hours playing this game. The controls are easy, the interface is so user friendly. Keep up the settings and eventually you'll be a pro!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053291408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1463246788}
review:
5:00PM-
I set down to play this game for the first time. 
Graphics look ugly, and so does the UI.
I'll just test it real quick to see if it's even worth playing.
At least this junk was cheap...

5:02PM-
I have no idea what I'm doing or how to make this little guy even move.
Oh, look, he just built a city... meh!
I'll give it a 2 more minutes because theres got to be more to the game than just this.
I've got important errands to run anyways...




8:40PM -
Huh!?!  How is it already 840PM!?!
I forgot all my errands!
Oh well, I'll just play for a few more minutes.
It's too late to late to do anything else...

review:
First Civilization game I've ever played. I really wish they had included a small tutorial mode, but figuring out what was happening was a fun challange in and of itself. I imagine returning Civilization fans would be familiar with the engine already. 

Anyhow, the game runes extremely smooth, no glitching or crashing. If you're looking for a 4x game and are on a budget you can't beat the $5 price. It's worth having in your library just for the hell of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020147012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1492445915}
review:
Эх ностальгия. На заре двухтысячных началось мое знакомство с серией как раз с третьей части. ( первый комп третий пень накрыл меня с головой ( батяня спасибо)). Сколько бессонных ночей я провел, сколько лекций пропустил. Но на данный момент серия шагнула далеко в перед. Был бы еще перевод мож прошелбы но так с инглишем не дружу а почитать охота, исторический экскурс не хуже чем в пятой но он вроде бы даже другой просто. Но графон механика уже не канают. Так для ознакомления с серией фанатам рекомендую.
PS. Я даже ломал диск с данной игрой перед сессией, потом правда приходилось выкладывать бабули за новый.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113504355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 14142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1644163565}
